The Senior Business Development Analyst provides high-level analytical support to the Senior Director of Clinical Business Development of ColumbiaDoctors and the CFO of Columbia Physicians and Surgeons and Columbia Doctors to achieve the organization's financial and operational goals.

title: Business Operations Analyst IV - Finance 17 month Temp project with global ecommerce leader. CA/CFA certification desired
description: Vettanna is seeking a CA or CFA to work a 17 month Temporary project for our client eBay. The project is listed as remote work with location preferences being San Jose, CA or NY, NY. You will be a fulltime employee of Vettanna with benefits for the duration of this project. The Strategic Pricing Team within Pricing and Monetization is responsible for defining the vision for how our client monetizes large merchants -- balancing growth, customer satisfaction, and financial objectives within a challenging and dynamic competitive e-commerce landscape. The team identifies and implements opportunities to accelerate commerce on the multi-billion dollar US & CA platforms with the goal of benefiting our buyers and sellers through bringing new and unique inventory. We are seeking a Business Operations Specialist on our North American Pricing and Monetization team. In this role, you will play a crucial part in collecting, analyzing, and interpreting data to provide insights for pricing decisions. Your responsibilities include building the management reporting that sets the foundations for all strategy and measurement of our sellers You’ll be responsible for measuring the impact of strategies by gathering and visualizing data, storytelling through presentations, collaborating with experts in areas like technology and influencing senior leadership on critical decisions. You’ll be conducting thorough quality assurance of implementation in a methodical manner and resolving any discrepancies. Your contribution will be pivotal in ensuring the precision, efficiency, and seamless integration of pricing strategies across eBay's global e-commerce platform. You’ll work with tools like SQL to query data, use spreadsheets to organize it, and slides to present it, along with a number of other modern analytics tools. Responsibilities Performance management of sellers through the creation and maintenance of management reporting Build targeted insights to inform the development of new seller offers Lead the implementation of pricing strategies within eBay’s pricing engine Conduct testing and review of pricing configurations to verify accuracy and functionality Investigate and resolve discrepancies or issues identified during the pricing system implementation Conduct audits of pricing data to verify accuracy and compliance with established pricing guidelines Effectively communicate with team members and stakeholders regarding pricing system changes, updates, and issue resolutions Qualifications 2+ years experience in operations, ideally in pricing operations, system implementation, or related roles in the financial services industry CA, CFA preferred Experience in coding and/or data visualization (e.g., SQL, Python, Tableau) Bachelor's degree in Business, Economics, Accounting/ Finance, Computer Science, Math, Physics, Engineering or related quantitative field Familiarity with business intelligence visualization tools Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with a keen attention to detail Excellent communication and collaboration skills for effective cross-functional teamwork
summary: Vettanna is seeking a Business Operations Specialist to work on a 17 month project for eBay. The role involves analyzing data, building management reporting, implementing pricing strategies, and conducting quality assurance. The ideal candidate will have 2+ years of experience in operations, preferably in pricing operations, system implementation, or related roles in financial services. Familiarity with coding and data visualization tools like SQL, Python, and Tableau is required. A Bachelor's degree in a quantitative field is also preferred.

company: Skadden, Arps, Slate, Meagher & Flom LLP and Affiliates
title: Global Business Development Analyst
description: The Opportunity We are seeking a Global Business Development Analyst to join our Firm. This position will be based in our New York office (hybrid). This position is responsible for the collection and analysis of information related to market research, industry trends, company profiles, competitive analysis and other duties, as assigned. The Global Business Development Analyst participates in various firmwide strategic initiatives related to business development, cross-selling and growth opportunities. Responsibilities include but are not limited to: Researches and prepares company profiles including information on company operations, connections to key senior management and board, analysis of deals and litigation activity, and recent news. Updates and analyzes industry and regional lists with internal and external data to better understand coverage of industry or region, practice mix, Partners involved, etc. Benchmarks current position versus competitors through analysis of league tables, corporate transactions, litigation events and even recent legal industry news. Analyzes daily market intelligence to identify upcoming deals that can be communicated to Partners for their review. Analyzes daily new clients added to assign an industry, region, country tag, which bolsters our understanding of market share across industries and regions. Monitors and analyzes new developments in various industries and geographic regions using internal and external data sources. Ad hoc analysis of M&A, capital markets and other deal types in support of various practice and/or office initiatives. Demonstrates effective interpersonal, written and verbal communication skills to facilitate effective work relationships with others. Manages Firm resources responsibly. Complies with and understands Firm operation, policies and procedures. Performs other related duties as assigned. Qualifications Proficient using full MS Suite with intermediate to advanced Excel skills (pivot tables, look-ups, etc.) Ability to synthesize, interpret and summarize information from various sources in a clear, concise manner Takes ownership for significant portion of projects and generate action-oriented insights and recommendations Ability to manage multiple projects, meet deliverable deadlines and display sound judgement, particularly with sensitive and confidential information Self-starter capable of working independently as well as within a team and comfortable with ambiguity and adaptable to change Ability to remain effective and adaptable to change Excellent analytical ability with a keen business sense, troubleshooting, organizational, and planning skills Resourceful internet research skills utilizing various online sources Basic understanding and or exposure to business financials (including SEC filings) Well-rounded interpersonal skills and communication skills (both verbal and written) with the capacity to build trust-based relationships with teammates and stakeholders Highly self-motivated, a passion for excellence and the desire to have a significant impact Demonstrates effective interpersonal and communication skills, both verbally and in writing Demonstrates close attention to detail Ability to handle multiple projects and shifting priorities Ability to handle sensitive matters and maintain confidentiality Ability to organize and prioritize work Ability to work well in a demanding and fast-paced environment Ability to work well independently as well as effectively within a team Flexibility to adjust hours and work the hours necessary to meet operating and business needs Experience/ Education Bachelor's degree Minimum of one year of related work experience About Us Skadden, Arps, Slate, Meagher & Flom LLP (Skadden) has forged a reputation as one of the most prestigious law firms in the world. By relying on innovation, intellect, teamwork and tenacity, our lawyers deliver the highest quality advice and novel solutions to our clients' legal issues. We are recognized as a global powerhouse for complex transactions, litigation/controversy issues, and regulatory matters, as well as for the open, collaborative relationships we build with clients. Our attorneys, who reflect diverse backgrounds and perspectives, collaborate seamlessly across 50-plus practices and 21 offices in the world’s major financial centers. Culture & Life at Skadden What makes Skadden special is our people and the culture, community and spirit of collaboration we have created. We believe in teamwork and inspiring each other to be our best in an atmosphere that promotes professionalism and excellence in all that we do. We know that inclusion, equity and drawing on the strength of a wide spectrum of diverse talent only make us better and is vital to the firm's success. Our goal is for everyone at the firm to enjoy a challenging career with opportunities for development and growth and to support the well-being of our attorneys and professional staff. Benefits The overall well-being of our team is important to us. We offer generous benefits to help you achieve wellness in all areas of your life. Competitive salaries and year-end discretionary bonuses. Comprehensive health care (medical, dental, vision), savings plan/401(k) and voluntary benefits. Generous paid time off. Paid leave options, including parental. In-classroom, remote, and on-demand learning and professional development opportunities. Robust well-being classes and programs. Opportunities to give back and make an impact in local communities. For further details, please visit: https://www.skadden.com/careers/staff/employee-benefits The starting base salary for this position is expected to be within the range listed under Salary Details. Actual salary will be determined based on skills, experience (to the extent relevant) and other-job related factors, consistent with applicable law. Salary Details $80,000 - $90,000 Skadden is an Equal Opportunity Employer (Disability/Vet/other protected categories). For more information, please visit Skadden.com/careers.
summary: Skadden, Arps, Slate, Meagher & Flom LLP is seeking a Global Business Development Analyst to join their New York office (hybrid). This role involves collecting and analyzing market research, industry trends, company profiles, and competitive analysis to support firmwide strategic initiatives related to business development, cross-selling, and growth opportunities. The ideal candidate will have a Bachelor's degree, at least one year of related work experience, proficient MS Suite skills, strong analytical and research skills, and excellent communication skills.

title: Fixed Income Business Analyst
description: Job Description: Our client is looking to fill the role of Fixed Income Business Analyst. Our investment management client headquartered in midtown Manhattan operates from 18 cities across 13 countries with US $247B AUM in traditional and alternative listed equity and fixed income. The feel of a small firm with the scale of a large global organization. The Fixed Income Technology group is looking for a business analyst who will be part of the project team responsible for transitioning business groups and functionality onto PORT Enterprise, Bloomberg’s module for performance, attribution, and risk reporting. This role will crystallize requirements, define best practices, and work with the vendor, internal technology, and business stakeholders to meet project deliverables. Responsibilities: Collaborate with the business to gather and document business requirements and functional specifications, document minutes and track takeaways Analyze and evaluate business requirements as it relates to large scale financial implementation projects, while providing hands-on expertise throughout implementation Ensure deliverables meet product requirements, and work with end users and project stakeholders to define best practices Evaluate business processes, identify areas for improvement, and develop and implement solutions Understand upstream and downstream processes relevant to area of expertise Work in a dynamic environment, partnering with fast-paced agile teams, to deliver quality software solutions to complex business problems Required Qualifications: 10+ years project management/business analyst experience in IT In-depth experience in Fixed Income securities Excellent knowledge of Bloomberg ecosystem Solid grasp of SQL and the ability to create and update queries Excellent organizational skills; handle multiple projects and timelines while being detail oriented Strong verbal and written communication skills Bloomberg PORT and functional knowledge risk and attribution Working with JIRA/Confluence, MS Excel VBA/Macro Ability to collaborate as part of a team and take on additional responsibilities as required Accountability and willingness to be pro-active in learning and improving the quality of deliverables and efficiency of processes
summary: This role requires a business analyst with 10+ years of experience in IT, particularly within the Fixed Income sector. The focus is on transitioning business groups onto Bloomberg's PORT Enterprise platform, including gathering requirements, defining best practices, and collaborating with vendors and stakeholders. Strong technical skills with SQL, Bloomberg ecosystem knowledge, and proficiency in tools like JIRA/Confluence are essential.

title: Lead Health Care Business Analyst
description: UNIVERSAL Technologies is hiring a CBAP or CCBA certified Lead Business Analyst with experience in Government Health Care/Human Services Applications to lead a team of Business Analysts through large, complex information Technology projects. This position requires onsite work in Albany, NY with travel as needed and some remote work . Selected candidate must be ready to work in Albany, NY beginning day one. Mandatory Requirements Seven years of experience in business analysis of large, complex information technology projects spanning state and local systems. At least three years must have included supervisory or two years managerial experience. IIBA certification of CBAP or CCBA Bachelor’s degree in information technology or business administration. Experience in Health & Human Service programs (examples: Medicaid, SNAP, HEAP, PA, Child Care, and Child Support). Experience using Blueprint Requirements Management Tool or equivalent tools such as JIRA, HP ALM. Responsibilities Manage team of Business Analysts and assignments within the Program Area. Lead Program Area activities related to as-is and to-be requirements elicitation, analysis, documentation, and design. Liaise with various stakeholder groups, including but not limited to executive teams, program managers, subject matter experts (SMEs), and end-users, to collect, document, review, and obtain feedback on relevant business processes and requirements. Collaborate with internal IES teams including the PMO, BA, Quality Assurance, Technology, and Executive Leadership teams to ensure system requirements are documented clearly and according to project artifact standards, feasible, testable and are within approved project scope boundaries. Lead staff in adherence to internal controls leveraging the Business Team Center of Excellence (CoE), prescribed tools, and standards. Provide input, evaluate, and adhere to project timelines and priorities. Assist in reviewing vendor work products. Keep management informed of progress, issues, and risks. Develop a deep understanding of the business processes and system solutions within IES. Perform full range of supervisory responsibilities and manage blended teams of state and vendor resources. Create an environment where staff is motivated and energized to high performance. UNIVERSAL Technologies is an equal opportunity employer.
summary: UNIVERSAL Technologies seeks a certified Lead Business Analyst with extensive experience in government healthcare and human services applications to manage a team of analysts on large, complex IT projects. The role involves onsite work in Albany, NY with some remote flexibility. Key responsibilities include leading requirements gathering, analysis, and documentation, collaborating with stakeholders, ensuring adherence to project standards and internal controls, and managing a blended team of state and vendor resources.

title: Business Analyst-S and T-Parthenon-TSE-Deal Strategy and Management - Mgr - Multi Pos-1512890
description: EY focuses on high-ethical standards and integrity among its employees and expects all candidates to demonstrate these qualities. At EY, you’ll have the chance to build a career as unique as you are, with the global scale, support, inclusive culture and technology to become the best version of you. And we’re counting on your unique voice and perspective to help EY become even better, too. Join us and build an exceptional experience for yourself, and a better working world for all. Business Analyst - Strategy and Transactions (S&T) – Parthenon – Transaction, Strategy, & Execution (Deal Strategy & Management) (Manager) (Multiple Positions), Ernst & Young U.S. LLP, New York, NY. Serve as a Strategy & Operations professional to prepare and execute mergers and acquisition plans to maximize synergies and financial benefits from transactions. Understand the factors that drive successful mergers and acquisitions, and apply knowledge of the organizations involved in a deal to drive operational value. Provide operationally focused support and advice across the transaction life cycle (including carve-out, due diligence and integration), whether supporting an acquirer or seller. Focus on enhancing value, accelerating implementation and managing operational transaction risk. Support and advise on operational aspects, from carve-out readiness and support, operational due diligence, synergy assessment and delivery, day-one readiness assessment and 100-day planning, to support the integration process. Manage and motivate teams of professionals with diverse skills and backgrounds. Consistently deliver quality client services by monitoring progress. Demonstrate in-depth technical capabilities and professional knowledge. Maintain long-term client relationships and networks. Cultivate business development opportunities. Full time employment, Monday – Friday, 40 hours per week, 8:30 am – 5:30 pm. MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS: Must have a Bachelor’s degree in Business, Finance, Accounting, Computer Science, Analytics, Engineering, the Sciences or a related field and 5 years of work experience. Experience may be gained as part of the required education, including co-op and/or internship experience. Alternatively, will accept a Master’s degree in Business, Finance, Accounting, Computer Science, Analytics, Engineering, the Sciences or related field and 3 years of work experience. Experience may be gained as part of the required education, including co-op and/or internship experience. Must have 1 year of experience in business integrations, divestitures, or carve-outs including experience with quantitative and qualitative analysis. Must have 3 years of experience in conducting assessments of technology, finance, operations, manufacturing, or supply chain infrastructure. Must have 1 year of experience in the integration or separation of client operations. Must have 1 year of experience in a consulting or professional services firm in mergers and acquisitions, which includes merger integrations, divestitures, and/or carve-outs. Must have 1 year of experience in synthesizing approaches in complex integration or divestiture conflicts. Must have 1 year of experience in project/engagement management, including managing engagements and engagement related budgets, as well as managing, developing and coaching professional employees. Requires domestic and international travel up to 80% to serve client needs. Employer will accept any suitable combination of education, training or experience. title: Conflicts Resolution Group, Business Conflicts, Analyst/Associate, New York/Dallas
description: Job Description CONFLICTS RESOLUTION GROUP The Conflicts Resolution Group (CRG) evaluates a wide range of the firm’s business activities, including advisory, financing, principal investing, lending and certain other activities, in order to identify, assess, and manage actual or perceived conflicts of interest resulting from the firm’s new and existing roles, positions, and responsibilities, as well as reputational risks. CRG determines from a conflicts of interest perspective whether the revenue businesses may continue to pursue a transaction (subject to further review by CRG and other control functions and committees) and may impose limitations or conditions which are monitored by CRG. In doing so, the CRG helps to protect the firm’s client relationships, safeguard confidential information, mitigate reputational risk, and ensure that we are able to fulfill our responsibilities to clients prior to accepting a role and over the course of our engagement. A role in CRG offers an exceptional opportunity for professional development for a person interested in financial markets and firmwide business activities who has the capacity to appreciate the complexities of risk management in the space. Responsibilities RESPONSIBILITIES AND QUALIFICATIONS Review and initiate new checks, including coordinating with businesses to ensure accuracy and completeness of information Conduct due diligence of business opportunities by considering the firm’s current and historical assignments, positions and economic exposures, and other touch points with relevant transaction parties Identify potential issues and report findings to the CRG Monitor and update the status of previously cleared opportunities using information from public sources, deal teams, and internal reporting tools Document the elements of review for each conflict check in the CRG’s proprietary database Qualifications 3 - 5 years of work experience, preferably in the financial or legal sectors supporting Investment Banking or Corporate Finance J.D. or MBA degree is preferred (but not required) High attention to detail Strong organizational skills Ability to operate in a fast-paced environment with a high sense of urgency Ability to process and analyze high volumes of information Commercial savviness with ability to exercise discretion with respect to highly confidential/sensitive information Strong communication skills and ability to interact directly with a wide group of professionals at different levels of seniority across the firm Ability to work in close coordination with others as part of a global team Proactive and self-motivated mindset About Goldman Sachs At Goldman Sachs, we commit our people, capital and ideas to help our clients, shareholders and the communities we serve to grow. Founded in 1869, we are a leading global investment banking, securities and investment management firm. Headquartered in New York, we maintain offices around the world. We believe who you are makes you better at what you do. We're committed to fostering and advancing diversity and inclusion in our own workplace and beyond by ensuring every individual within our firm has a number of opportunities to grow professionally and personally, from our training and development opportunities and firmwide networks to benefits, wellness and personal finance offerings and mindfulness programs. Learn more about our culture, benefits, and people at GS.com/careers. We’re committed to finding reasonable accommodations for candidates with special needs or disabilities during our recruiting process. Learn more: https://www.goldmansachs.com/careers/footer/disability-statement.html © The Goldman Sachs Group, Inc., 2024. All rights reserved. Goldman Sachs is an equal employment/affirmative action employer Female/Minority/Disability/Veteran/Sexual Orientation/Gender Identity Salary Range The expected base salary for this New York, New York, United States-based position is $85000-$140000. In addition, you may be eligible for a discretionary bonus if you are an active employee as of fiscal year-end. Benefits Goldman Sachs is committed to providing our people with valuable and competitive benefits and wellness offerings, as it is a core part of providing a strong overall employee experience. A summary of these offerings, which are generally available to active, non-temporary, full-time and part-time US employees who work at least 20 hours per week, can be found here .
summary: The Conflicts Resolution Group (CRG) at Goldman Sachs evaluates business activities to identify, assess, and manage conflicts of interest. Strong analytical, organizational, and communication skills are essential, along with the ability to operate in a fast-paced environment and maintain discretion with confidential information.

title: Acquisition Product Strategy Analyst - C14 - NEW YORK
description: The Acquisition Product Strategy Analyst is a strategic professional who closely follows latest trends in own field and adapts them for application within own job and the business. Excellent communication skills required in order to negotiate internally, often at a senior level. Developed communication and diplomacy skills are required in order to guide, influence and convince others, in particular colleagues in other areas and occasional external customers. Accountable for significant direct business results or authoritative advice regarding the operations of the business. Necessitates a degree of responsibility over technical strategy. This job description provides a high-level review of the types of work performed. Other job-related duties may be assigned as required. As the Acquisition Product Strategy Analyst, this individual partners with acquisition channel heads to develop effective offers and messaging. Serves as the primary liaison to the product management team on strategic initiatives, leading and optimizing go to market strategy to meet Cards proprietary product objectives. This individual would support one of the proprietary product portfolios (Rewards, Value, Cash) Responsibilities: Developing and articulating proprietary portfolio strategic objectives Lead articulation of go to market strategy and learning objectives Ensuring regular review of acquisition metrics Providing product input and insights for creative development Maximizing portfolio results, within the broader set of products, channels, and priorities for Citi Cards acquisitions Provide acquisition subject matter expertise in product management Partners with product on pricing strategy, new products and enhanced value props Partner with Risk/Analytics to prioritize product and cross channel initiatives Monitors test performance and proactively recommends rollout Monitors and tracks account volume, works with channel owners to explain variances and plan around changing behavior Provide acquisition subject matter expertise in product management and overall P&L discussions Project management lead on approval process for acquisition programs including: management and negotiation of timelines, creating team alignment and providing strategic thought leadership. Owns overall marketing strategy and marketing roadmap Sets strategy, aligns with Citi Channel acquisition teams Optimizes across “owned “ (eg core Citi and Partner channels ) and “earned” (eg PR, Brand, Advocacy) channels and drives efficiency Manages any new product launches or product construct changes across acquisition Partners with product on pricing strategy, new products and enhanced value props Reviews creative and provides insights into marketing messages Facilitates sharing results, test plans, forecasts, and priorities with product management team; Provides inputs into quarterly strategy review and approvals Provides input into forecast Drives growth through strategic initiatives Lead strategic projects as required Supports proprietary product Planning process Qualifications: 10+ years of experience Deep understanding of the consumer cards business, financial services, Broad knowledge of P&Ls, analytics, marketing, risk, and operations. Strong knowledge of regulatory environment in this industry. Needs to fully understand risks associated with consumer protection laws and ongoing changes in industry that carry large visibility to the company. Requires deep understanding of the business and how best to optimize the use of internal and external resources as well as cross-functional teams. Expertise in devising multiple financial solutions that solve for multi-faceted business problem (accounts, activation, risk performance, ANR, CPA, ROTA, NPV). Strong customer focus and past achievement in applying a customer mindset to shape solutions and approach to realize marketplace potential and meet financial goals. Education: Bachelor’s/University degree, Master’s degree preferred ------------------------------------------------------ Job Family Group: Marketing ------------------------------------------------------ Job Family: Marketing Program Management ------------------------------------------------------ Time Type: Full time ------------------------------------------------------ Primary Location: New York New York United States ------------------------------------------------------ Primary Location Full Time Salary Range: $163,600.00 - $245,400.00 In addition to salary, Citi’s offerings may also include, for eligible employees, discretionary and formulaic incentive and retention awards. Citi offers competitive employee benefits, including: medical, dental & vision coverage; 401(k); life, accident, and disability insurance; and wellness programs. Citi also offers paid time off packages, including planned time off (vacation), unplanned time off (sick leave), and paid holidays. For additional information regarding Citi employee benefits, please visit citibenefits.com. summary: The Acquisition Product Strategy Analyst is a strategic professional who works closely with acquisition channel heads to develop effective offers and messaging for Citi Cards proprietary product portfolios (Rewards, Value, Cash). This individual serves as the primary liaison to the product management team on strategic initiatives, leading and optimizing go-to-market strategy to meet product objectives. This role requires strong analytical and communication skills, deep understanding of the consumer cards business and financial services, and expertise in devising financial solutions.

title: Business Functional Analyst - Vice President
description: Job Description: Job Title Business Functional Analyst Corporate Title Vice President Location New York, NY Overview This is a Business Functional Analyst role within the compliance division, which aims to build models to detect market manipulation via various statistical and rules-based techniques. It is also responsible to provide a fit-for-purpose User Interface (UI) to research alerts via graphs and analytical signals, implement data quality controls as defined by Deutsche Bank's data governance program. As the Compliance Delivery Manager, you will be leading the technology team to ensure the technical deliverables are delivered within the agreed timelines. What We Offer You A diverse and inclusive environment that embraces change, innovation, and collaboration A hybrid working model, allowing for in-office / work from home flexibility, generous vacation, personal and volunteer days Employee Resource Groups support an inclusive workplace for everyone and promote community engagement Competitive compensation packages including health and wellbeing benefits, retirement savings plans, parental leave, and family building benefits Educational resources, matching gift, and volunteer programs What You'll Do Manage the scope and schedule of a project with an Agile approach (Establishing and modifying the project roadmap as required), while providing transparency through consistent reporting and communication for internal and external stakeholders, as well as managing the financial aspect of a project with regards to reporting Actual spend to forecasting the cost of the project through its various lifecycles Responsible for Program Status Reporting and oversight of Project Financials in Clarity Oversee team of functional analysts and developers, perform reviews, and provide feedback on documentation produced by members of the team, as well as drive and deliver initiatives to improve the team's delivery processes and methods Drive development teams to ensure high quality delivery while maintaining good coding practice Ensure that development teams and management have a clear understanding of business priorities Manage and execute acceptance testing - both user acceptance testing (UAT), with the client performing execution, and acceptance testing prior to UAT How You'll Lead Defining and articulating what, why and when of the product (feature definition and acceptance criteria) that teams build and prove Owning and defining the program backlog Establishing a cohesive partnership with the product group Skills You'll Need Moderate large enterprise level experience in information technology with an emphasis on technology project delivery specifically in compliance technology area (market surveillance, Information barriers surveillance, sales practice/ suitability etc) Extensive experience working as a delivery Manager in a technology team in a financial services organization (preferably a tier 1 investment bank) with good knowledge of Investment bank products. Prior experience in leading a team skilled in big data technologies and Angular UI frameworks (Google cloud experience would be a plus) Knowledge of the key responsibilities of an investment bank's Compliance department (preferably Trade Surveillance, Information Barriers, and Employee Surveillance) with an in-depth understanding of software development life cycle (SDLC) with the ability to select the right tools / methodologies for a given task with strong understanding of the technology product and project lifecycle Demonstrated experience with the Agile Methodology with prior experience in data governance principles and implementation of data controls in surveillance domains (trade or ecomm surveillance preferred) Hands-on data analysis skills and use of tools using Structured Query Language (SQL), BigData environment (HIVE/Impala) etc Skills That Will Help You Excel Able to work effectively with all levels of clients and IT stakeholders up to and including director, as well as plan, own, and run a portfolio of tasks Excellent communications skills - both written and verbal, with technical and non-technical audiences Educated to bachelor's degree level or equivalent A strong critical thinker with creative problem-solving skills, while able to work with remote stakeholders and team members Flexible, able to organize and prioritize your work and the work of the team, and able to identify and interpret stakeholders needs and requirements Expectations It is the Bank's expectation that employees hired into this role will work in the New York office in accordance with the Bank's hybrid working model. Deutsche Bank provides reasonable accommodations to candidates and employees with a substantiated need based on disability and/or religion. title: Senior Strategy Analyst, Hybrid
description: The Opportunity Delaware North is hiring a Senior Strategy Analyst to join our team in Buffalo, New York. As a Senior Strategy Analyst , you will b e responsible for interfacing with senior leaders across a matrixed organization to support strategy development, operationalization, and implementation. If you like to innovate, enact change, and seek growth opportunities, apply now to join our team. Pay Minimum – Anticipated Maximum Base Salary: $79900 - $107800 / year In addition to base salary, we offer an annual bonus plan based on company and individual performance, or a role-based, uncapped sales incentive plan. The advertised pay range represents what we believe at the time of this job posting, that we would be willing to pay for this position. Only in special circumstances, where a candidate has education, training, or experience that far exceeds the requirements for the position, would we consider paying higher than the stated range. Information on our comprehensive benefits package can be found at https://careers.delawarenorth.com/whatweoffer . Benefits At Delaware North, we care about our team members' personal and professional journeys. These are just some of the benefits we offer: Medical, dental, and vision insurance 401(k) with up to 4% company match Annual performance bonus based on level, as well as individual, company, and location performance Paid vacation days and holidays Paid parental bonding leave Tuition and/or professional certification reimbursement Generous friends-and-family discounts at many of our hotels and resorts Responsibilities Coordinate high-impact cross-functional projects including defining objectives, assembling teams, and reporting on activity progress Assess the progress of strategic initiative implementations, explain the key factors impacting performance, and recommend adjustments as needed Identify market dynamics and uncover strategic opportunities, areas for improvement, and risks to the business Assist in the development of business cases and create the supporting financial models, presenting insights and findings to key internal stakeholders Collect and analyze data from internal and external sources to support decision-making processes Qualifications Bachelor's degree in economics, business administration, or a related field; advanced degree preferred 3+ years of experience in strategy, management consulting, private equity, investment banking, or a related field, with a proven track record of conducting complex analysis and modeling Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to think critically, synthesize information from multiple sources, and develop creative solutions to complex business challenges S trong interpersonal skills, with the ability to work effectively both independently and as part of a team, build relationships , and influence others to drive alignment around strategic priorities and initiatives Expert in MS Excel Shift Details Day shift Who We Are At Delaware North, you’ll love where you work, who you work with, and how your day unfolds. Whether it’s in sporting venues, casinos, airports, national parks, iconic hotels, or premier restaurants, there’s no telling where your career can ultimately take you. We empower you to do great work in a company with 100 years of success, stability and growth. If you have drive and enjoy the thrill of making things happen - share our vision and grow with us. Delaware North Companies, Incorporated and its subsidiaries consider applicants for all positions without regard to race, color, religion, creed, gender, national origin, age, disability, marital or veteran status, sexual orientation, or any other legally protected status. Ideal candidates will have a bachelor's degree in economics, business administration, or a related field, 3+ years of experience in strategy, management consulting, private equity, investment banking, or a related field, strong analytical and problem-solving skills, and excellent interpersonal skills.

title: Senior Revenue & Business Operations Analyst
description: Job Description Join Our Team as a Senior Revenue & Business Operations Analyst – Shape the future of our commercial operations at WTW! We are seeking a motivated and detail-oriented Senior Revenue & Business Operations Analyst to join our dynamic commercial team. This role will play a crucial role in supporting various activities within the sales organization, including forecasting, sales reporting, data analysis, and client analysis. Additionally, this role will be contributing to strategic and operational initiatives and coordinating with various stakeholders across the organization to support both the regional Commercial Leader and North American Practice Leader. The Role What You'll Do This is a unique opportunity to join an accelerating sales team and help shape the future of our commercial organization. Your attention to detail, experience gathering, organizing, and collating data from various sources will inform key business decisions on how and where we allocate resources and make smart data driven decisions that will support our ambitious growth targets in North America. Revenue Forecasting Work closely with the Practice Leader and finance stakeholders to develop revenue forecasts. Gather input from sales teams, market trends, and financial data to inform revenue projections. Prepares revenue and pipeline composition analytics for sales and leadership team meetings. Supports and coordinates regular key deal review and forecast calls. Participate in budgeting and planning processes to align revenue forecasts with overall financial objectives. Sales Forecasting Assist with pipeline management processes, improve CRM pipeline hygiene and accuracy. Analyze win/losses to identify areas for improvement in the sales process. Regularly review and refine forecasting models to improve accuracy and reliability. Contribute to the development of sales forecasts based on historical data and market trends. Evaluate the sales pipeline and identify bottlenecks or opportunities for improvement. Support with coordination of new business prospecting activities Sales Reporting Compile and analyze sales data to generate insightful reporting and surface trends for management review. Identify key performance indicators (KPIs) and track sales metrics to assess performance against targets. Prepare and present reports detailing sales trends, opportunities, and challenges. Data Analysis Conduct in-depth analysis of sales and revenue data to identify patterns, trends, and opportunities for improvement. Work cross-functionally with other departments to gather and analyze data relevant to sales operations. Provide actionable insights to support decision-making and strategic planning. Analyze data to draw business-relevant conclusions and in data visualization techniques and tools. Client Analysis And Sales Planning Supports Annual and Quarterly Sales, Account and Business planning processes. Assist in analyzing client behavior, preferences, and purchasing patterns. Collaborate with the marketing and sales team to identify upsell and cross-sell opportunities based on client analysis. Analyzes client retention rates and identify strategies to improve them. Strategic Collaboration Act as a trusted advisor to the Practice Leader, providing strategic support and operational guidance. Assist in coordinating and prioritizing initiatives and projects within the organization. Support the completion of varied projects such as new product launches, marketing initiatives and new market penetrations. Serve as a liaison between the Practice Leader and other departments, facilitating communication and alignment on key objectives. Contribute to the development and implementation of organizational strategies and initiatives. Key Metrics Sales and Revenue forecast accuracy Improvement in Win Rates Improvement in Pipeline Velocity Top Competencies Required Effective Communication Attention to Detail Driving Excellence Innovation Business Acumen Growth Mindset Qualifications The Requirements Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Finance, Economics, or related field. 5-7 years of relevant experience in business analysis, sales operations, or related roles. Strong analytical skills with proficiency in data analysis and techniques. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively across teams. Detail-oriented with a focus on accuracy and quality of work. Proven ability to multitask and manage competing priorities in a fast-paced environment. Strong command of Microsoft Excel. Experience with business intelligence tools and CRM software (MS Dynamics is a plus). This position will remain posted for a minimum of three business days from the date posted or until a sufficient/appropriate candidate slate has been identified. Note: Employment-based non-immigrant visa sponsorship and/or assistance is not offered for this specific job opportunity. Compensation And Benefits Base salary range and benefits information for this position are being included in accordance with requirements for various state/local pay transparency legislation. Please note that base salaries may vary for different individuals in the same role base on several factors, including but not limited to location of the role, individual qualifications, education/profession certifications, experience, performance in the role and potential for revenue generation (Producer roles only). Compensation The base salary compensation range being offered for this role is $80,000- $110,000 USD per year. This role is also eligible for an annual short-term incentive bonus. Company Benefits WTW provides a competitive benefit package which includes the following (eligibility requirements apply): Health and Welfare Benefits: Medical (including prescription coverage), Dental, Vision, Health Savings Account, Commuter Account, Health Care and Dependent Care Flexible Spending Accounts, Group Accident, Group Critical Illness, Life Insurance, AD&D, Group Legal, Identify Theft Protection, Wellbeing Program and Work/Life Resources (including Employee Assistance Program) Leave Benefits: Paid Holidays, Annual Paid Time Off (includes paid state/local paid leave where required), Short-Term Disability, Long-Term Disability, Other Leaves (e.g., Bereavement, FMLA, ADA, Jury Duty, Military Leave, and Parental and Adoption Leave), Paid Time Off Retirement Benefits: Contributory Pension Plan and Savings Plan (401k) EOE, including disability/vets

title: BA with Financial Crime Domain
description: Business Analyst with experience in Financial Crimes domain (ECRR(Enterprise Client Risk Reporting)/AML(Anti Money Laundering), KYC, Sanctions Screening (like OFAC) + Actimize tool exposure. Also Scrum Master experience is a must (Ability to play Scrum Master role for the team besides Lead BA role). Capital Markets experience. Experience in coordinating with all levels of managers, developers, QA, Stakeholders. Experience working on Jira, Agile and Scrum. Experience writing User Stories, Business Requirements, Functional requirements documents. Proficient in creating UML diagrams. Proficient in creating source to target document. Experience in Sql writing and data analysis. Experience in AML, KYC, Sanctions Screening, Actimize tool and good understanding of CDD, EDD, Risk scoring. Experience playing a Scrum Master role and various scrums ceremonies. Diverse Lynx LLC is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer. Requires strong SQL skills (complex queries, joins), data analysis expertise, and familiarity with multiple databases (Oracle, Sybase, Hadoop, SQL Server). Must have Scrum Master experience (leading scrum ceremonies and playing the role alongside Lead BA responsibilities). Experience in Capital Markets and coordinating with various stakeholders (managers, developers, QA). title: Senior Business Analyst-Manufacturing
description: Unified Door and Hardware Group is a national distributor and integrated, value-added solutions provider that specializes in distributing doors, related hardware, specialty products, and electronic access control devices to the commercial construction industry. With a strong presence in both the new construction and renovation sectors, our company stands as a leader in the market, recognized for its professionalism and integrity. Job Summary: As a Senior Business Analyst – Manufacturing, you will support Unified’s manufacturing re-automation and transformation. Using your MES/MRP systems expertise and manufacturing knowledge, you'll develop requirements and collaborate on the evaluation, selection, implementation, and support of a new MES/MRP platform and other critical systems. You will assess and document manufacturing workflows, define system requirements and enhancements, and ensure system integration. Your role includes identifying and implementing solutions to improve manufacturing efficiency and integrating with Unified’s enterprise applications. By understanding core business processes, you'll enhance information visibility and accuracy, identify process improvements, and mitigate risks. You'll build strong partnerships with business and manufacturing teams and connect with the IT shared-service organization to ensure reliable project and service delivery. Key Responsibilities: Advise and collaborate with Manufacturing department heads and teams. Work with SMEs and cross-functional teams to define MES/MRP requirements, manage RFPs, vendor selection, and product demos. Unlock MES/MRP functionality to enhance performance and drive automation. Facilitate requirements gathering, document processes and improvement opportunities, and propose system solutions. Document system change requirements, design specifications, implementation strategies, and operational procedures. Streamline processes, reduce costs, and develop production metrics. Guide end users in defining requirements and converting them into design specs. Design and implement MES/MRP solutions to enhance production and supply chain integration. Lead efforts to implement new system functionality and process modeling. Ensure MES/MRP platform meets Manufacturing objectives and client satisfaction. Align manufacturing processes and technologies across business segments. Influence senior leadership on technical directions and new approaches. Address implementation obstacles with creative solutions. Develop business cases for new software implementations and enhancements. Communicate status and risks to stakeholders and project managers. Build and maintain cross-organization partnerships. Contribute to IT team's success and strategy with a continuous improvement mindset. Liaise between manufacturing, IT, and MES/MRP vendors. Perform system enhancements, configurations, and troubleshoot issues. Assist with application design, testing, and issue resolution. Support end users by submitting system requirements to IT or vendors. Facilitate change requests, testing, and communication with user groups and QA teams. Collaborate on project management and IT SDLC methodology. Maintain change management documentation and adhere to SDLC policies. Experience: Must have 7+ years of progressive Business Analysis experience in Manufacturing, Distribution, and Financial Management systems. Minimum 7 years of experience with MES/MRP platforms and business application systems. Minimum 7 years of experience with SDLC, system development methodologies, and requirements gathering. Minimum 7 years of experience in a national multi-site manufacturing/distribution business model. Demonstrated deep understanding of manufacturing needs and workflows, with experience recommending automation and operational efficiency improvements. Prior experience in door and frame manufacturing preferred. Experience with systems and business integration. Knowledge, Skills & Abilities: Ability to translate business needs into system specifications Experience leading teams/projects from initiation to closing Proficiency in process improvement methods and system enhancement projects Excellent critical thinking, process analysis, and workflow mapping skills Strong collaboration, influencing, and listening skills Excellent oral and written communication skills, including presentation abilities Deep understanding of MES/MRP master data objects and relationships Experience in process improvement, including current-state and future-state mapping Ability to lead strategic initiatives that achieve business objectives with measurable results Capability to configure MES/MRP systems to meet manufacturing and business needs Proven ability to lead cross-functional teams in identifying system improvements, defining requirements, and testing Strong analytical thinker with effective troubleshooting and problem-solving skills Ability to design and architect solutions Excellent time management and organizational skills, with attention to detail and multitasking abilities Successful experience working in a nationwide organization Proven track record of defining and delivering complex IT strategy Positive and agile mindset focused on solving complex challenges Ability to identify root causes of performance variances Strong computer skills, including the complete MS Office Suite Project management experience is a plus Location: This position requires an onsite presence at our Port Washington, NY office Salary and Compensation: In accordance with the Pay Transparency requirements, the following represents a good faith estimate of the compensation range for this position. summary: This role supports the re-automation and transformation of Unified's manufacturing operations. As a Senior Business Analyst – Manufacturing, you will leverage your MES/MRP expertise to define requirements, select, implement, and support a new MES/MRP platform and other critical systems. Your responsibilities include identifying and implementing solutions to enhance manufacturing efficiency, improve information visibility, and mitigate risks. You will collaborate with various teams, including manufacturing, IT, and MES/MRP vendors, to drive successful project delivery and ensure alignment between manufacturing processes and technologies across business segments.

title: Business Development Analyst
description: SRC, Inc. is seeking applicants for a Business Development (BD) Analyst, who will assist the BD organization with the execution of business development activities. The BD analyst will assist the business development team in the identification, qualification, and capture management of federal government and international programs. The selected candidate will support business development strategy, competitive intelligence and related support that will lead to growth primarily defense systems to include radars, sensors, and electronic warfare technologies. Tasking may include research and analysis, presentation development, opportunity reviews, meeting coordination, and other duties as assigned. The BD analyst’s efforts are closely coordinated with the BD and operational teams. The candidate should possess strong analytical and critical thinking skills, have the ability to synthesize large amounts of information and effectively communicate across all levels of the business. Must embrace an environment of continuous learning and be adaptable to and a proponent for change. What You’ll Do Leads market research to identify and develop business intelligence to support strategy and business captures Includes research (customer, competitor, technology) to support capture planning using a variety of subscription-based and open-source resources Call plan development (industry & government) including meeting preparation, reviews, and outcomes documented with action items tracked Monitors Government websites to report and distribute updates and the status of opportunities, funding or market dynamics Tracks and confirms accuracy of data Acts as a backup SME for Salesforce to include creation of dashboards and administration of tool Schedule and support facilitation of capture review meetings Efficient transition to proposal lifecycle staff utilizing all information from the capture phase (continue to act as resource as required) Support and/or develop status reports; providing accurate weekly, monthly, quarterly completed/work-in-process information within the schedules established What You’ll Bring Bachelor’s degree in business, and 3+ years of experience in relevant field such as project management or sales support in a technology business Any equivalent combination of education training, and experience Proficient in the Microsoft Office suite with a concentration in Excel and PowerPoint preferred Strong business reporting, project management and communication skills, both verbal and written Integrative thinker with demonstrated analytical, planning and problem-solving skills and ability to connect information across the business Ability to digest and interpret large amounts of information utilizing numerous sources Ability to develop effective relationships and operate with all levels of the corporation Effective leadership, time management and organizational skills Strong business acumen, analytical, problem solving, data manipulation skills Team player who is willing to step-in when needed to support other efforts in the capture and proposal support area Must be willing to travel up to 10% of the time Remote or hybrid work possible with experience. Preferable for the candidate to be located in the following areas: Syracuse, NY; San Antonio, TX; Dayton, OH. Ways To Stand Out – Preferred Requirements Familiarity with GovWin and Sam.gov opportunity identification and tracking solutions In-depth experience using Salesforce Knowledge of the Shipley capture lifecycle or equivalent capture process What Sets Us Apart? SRC, Inc., a not-for-profit research and development company, combines information, science, technology and ingenuity to solve “impossible” problems in the areas of defense, environment and intelligence. Across our family of companies, we apply bright minds, fresh thinking and relentless determination to deliver innovative products and services that are redefining possible ®. When you join our team, you’ll be a part of something truly meaningful — helping to keep America and its allies safe and strong. You’ll collaborate with more than 1,400 engineers, scientists and professionals — with 20 percent of those employees having served in the military — in a highly innovative, inclusive and equitable work environment. You’ll receive a competitive salary and comprehensive benefits package that includes four or more weeks of paid time off to start, 10 percent employer contribution toward retirement, and 100 percent tuition support. Total compensation for this role is market competitive. The anticipated salary range for this position based out of Syracuse, NY is estimated at $59,000 to $68,000 annually. The actual salary will vary based on applicant’s experience, skills, and abilities, geographic location as well as other business and organizational needs. SRC offers competitive benefit options, for more details please visit our website. Equal Opportunity Individuals seeking employment are considered without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identify, national origin, age, status as a protected veteran, or disability. You are being given the opportunity to provide the following information in order to help us comply with federal and state Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action record keeping, reporting, and other legal requirements. Learn More About SRC About Us Employee Benefits Diversity, Equity & Inclusion Awards & Recognition Security Clearances Location Syracuse, New York Fairborn, Ohio San Antonio, TX Employment Type Full-Time Salaried Experience Required 3+ Years Education Required Bachelors Degree Security Clearance Requirement Must meet eligibility requirements Travel % 10

title: Experienced Business/Systems Analyst
description: Vistrada is seeking an Experienced Business/Systems Analyst with consulting experience. The candidate would be responsible for working with clients to gather user requirements, document various business processes and workflows, develop logical data models, develop testing strategies and plans, and to continually grow your professional skills through company provided and external training. We are open to candidates with at least 3 years of solid experience looking to grow their career and who has led or looking to lead others. Note: This position can be remote and requires travel/office time when appropriate. Prefer candidates in states in which Vistrada already operates, including: New York, Florida, Illinois, Maryland, New Hampshire & Texas. Required Experience 3+ years of experience in a mix of roles as a business analyst and/or developer, preferably with a Big 4 or other consulting firm Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with a history of learning and adapting quickly Excellent written, verbal, and consultative skills (e.g., professionalism, collaboration, negotiation, conflict resolution, quick learner, etc.) Strong process and data analysis/modeling experience Understanding of application software components, application development and application testing required Conducted QA test planning, including execution, maintenance and resolution of issues with automated test scripts. Demonstrated ability to communicate with both technical and non-technical personnel in cross-functional teams Self-starter working in a fast-paced, deadline-driven, team environment Proficiency with Microsoft Office Suite (e.g., Microsoft Word, Microsoft Excel, Microsoft PowerPoint) Nice To Have Experience with Big 4 consulting firms Communicate complex technical details in meaningful business context Master’s or bachelor’s degree in computer science, information technology management, business management administration or related Benefits Medical and Dental 401K Match Discretionary bonus and profit sharing PTO to match your needs Paid Company Holidays Training Professional development with colleagues from industry, big 4 consulting About Our Company Vistrada is a services firm focused across Business, Technology, Risk Management and Cybersecurity. We are dedicated to helping clients plan, design, implement and manage programs that generate revenue, manage risk, costs, and build their business. Vistrada distinguishes itself by providing seasoned expertise with a flexible team structure allowing agility and responsiveness to our client’s evolving needs. This ensures we bring the right team at the right time while optimizing the client’s investment. Powered by JazzHR

title: BA Technical Writer

Position Responsibilities/Duties Independently gather information from subject matter expert to organize and write technical specification, process documentation, procedure, release notes and user manuals to meets the organization standards.
