title: Trust Administration Senior Business Analyst
description: SS&C is a global provider of investment and financial services and software for the financial services and healthcare industries. Named to Fortune 1000 list as top U.S. company based on revenue, SS&C is headquartered in Windsor, Connecticut and has 20,000+ employees in over 90 offices in 35 countries. Some 18,000 financial services and healthcare organizations, from the world's largest institutions to local firms, manage and account for their investments using SS&C's products and services. Job Description Trust Administration - Senior Business Analyst SS&C Innovest, a leading provider of Trust Accounting and Payment Solution software, is looking for candidates to join its Business Analysis and Product Management Team. The focus of this position will be centered on supporting InnoTrust, our flagship ‘Software as a Service’ Trust Accounting and Wealth Management platform. The candidate will be primarily responsible for developing business requirements documents and providing solutions to meet the business needs of our existing client base, as well as incoming clients. In addition, it is expected that as part of the product management team, the candidate will support the ongoing strategic evolution of the product by developing new functional offerings and enhancing efficiencies. The successful candidate will be comfortable engaging both with external clients and well as all internal teams; most notably implementations, Development, Quality Assurance, and Client Service. Participation in the development of training and software release notifications is also required. Over time, the candidate should expect to serve as a subject matter expert to support customer service representatives for escalated issues. Required Skills Strong Business Analyst skills. Familiarity with developing detailed business requirements and specification documents. Detail-oriented and analytical approach leading to an ability to guide, understand, and translate the client's needs into a solution. Ability to manage complexity and multi-task across multiple deliverables. Ability to deliver quickly with (eventually) minimal manager direction – take ownership and work independently. A strong work ethic combined with composure while operating in a fast-paced environment Good Communication, strong interpersonal, relationship, and team participation skills. Preferred Skills/ Experience Knowledge of financial markets and securities operations. Exposure to or experience in a Trust/Fiduciary environment will be of definite value. Good working knowledge of SQL, including basic development of database queries would be a bonus. Successful Track Record in developing requirements and driving projects to completion. Familiarization with an Agile development cycle would be advantageous. Experience And Credentials 7-10 years of financial-related experience, either working in a similar Business Analysis or system analyst role within a Financial institution or Trust department. Minimum Bachelors degree Location Candidate must be able to work legally within the United States The candidate will preferably work in our New York City office location, but a remote US workplace will be considered for the right candidate. Unless explicitly requested or approached by SS&C Technologies, Inc. or any of its affiliated companies, the company will not accept unsolicited resumes from headhunters, recruitment agencies, or fee-based recruitment services. SS&C offers excellent benefits including health, dental, 401k plan, tuition and professional development reimbursement plan. SS&C Technologies is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer and does not discriminate against any applicant for employment or employee on the basis of race, color, religious creed, gender, age, marital status, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, veteran status or any other classification protected by applicable discrimination laws. Salary is determined by various factors including, but not limited to, relevant work experience, job related knowledge, skills, abilities, business needs, and geographic regions. NY: Salary range for the position: 120,000.00 USD to 150,000.00 USD. Other States Salary range for the position: 130,000 USD to 150,000 USD.
summary: SS&C Innovest, a leading provider of Trust Accounting and Payment Solution software, is seeking a Senior Business Analyst to support its flagship 'Software as a Service' Trust Accounting and Wealth Management platform, InnoTrust. This role involves gathering and documenting business requirements, translating client needs into solutions, managing complex projects, and supporting the ongoing product development and evolution. The ideal candidate will have strong analytical and communication skills, experience in financial markets and securities operations, and a familiarity with trust/fiduciary environments.

title: Energy Strategy and Adoption Forecasting Analyst
description: About Us We are the independent expert in assurance and risk management. Driven by our purpose, to safeguard life, property, and the environment, we empower our customers and their stakeholders with facts and reliable insights so that critical decisions can be made with confidence. As a trusted voice for many of the world’s most successful organizations, we use our knowledge to advance safety and performance, set industry benchmarks, and inspire and invent solutions to tackle global transformations. About The Role Do you want to be part of an organization dedicated to tackling global issues such as climate change? Are you enthusiastic about modernizing energy systems to support decarbonization and the energy transition? Do you get excited by thinking strategically and holistically about the future of energy problems and collaborating with a team exceed our customers’ expectations? DNV- Energy Systems North America group and is seeking a creative and collaborative team member with a vision for the future of the energy industry to join our new Strategy Team as an Energy Strategy and Adoption Forecasting Analyst . This role will be responsible for supporting projects involving energy efficiency, demand response, distributed energy resources, and electrification forecasting, customer adoption analysis, non-wires and non-pipeline alternatives planning and forecasting, and cost-benefit analyses. This position can be based in any of our DNV’s continental U.S. offices including Medford, MA; Madison, WA; Oakland, CA; New York, NY. What You’ll Do Support energy efficiency (EE), demand response (DR), distributed energy resource (DER), and building and transportation electrification potential studies and forecasting efforts and non-wires alternatives (NWA) planning assessments. This can include conducting research and analysis, client interaction, development of deliverables and presentation of results Assess the costs and benefits of DER and NWA programs from the perspective of utilities and ratepayers Support research on the energy and non-energy related costs and benefits of these programs Support the development of program strategies and roadmaps. This includes planning and go-to-market strategies and frameworks Evaluate and benchmark utility program designs and performance metrics to support go to market strategies and program planning Develop models and tools that support strategic analysis and planning processes Model data input development, including documentation of sources and assumptions Interpret the results of data analyses to produce concise, meaningful conclusions and recommendations for client-facing reports and professional papers What we offer Generous paid time off (vacation, sick days, company holidays, personal days) Multiple Medical and Dental benefit plans to choose from, Vision benefits Spending accounts – FSA, Dependent Care, Commuter Benefits, company-seeded HSA Employer-paid, therapist-led, virtual care services through Talkspace 401(k) with company match Company provided life insurance, short-term, and long-term disability benefits Education reimbursement program Flexible work schedule with hybrid/remote opportunities Charitable Matched Giving and Volunteer Rewards through our Impact Program Volunteer time off (VTO) paid by the company Career advancement opportunities Benefits vary based on position, tenure, location, and employee election** How We Do It WeCare, WeDare, WeShare DNV is a proud equal-opportunity employer committed to building an inclusive and diverse workforce. All employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit, or business need, without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status. DNV is committed to ensuring equal employment opportunity, including providing reasonable accommodations to individuals with a disability. US applicants with a physical or mental disability who require a reasonable accommodation for any part of the application or hiring process may contact the North America Recruitment Department (hrrecruitment.northamerica@dnv.com). Information received relating to accommodations will be addressed confidentially. DNV is proud to announce being named one of Houston’s best places to work in the 2022 Houston Business Journal – Best Places to Work competition. For more information https://www.eeoc.gov/know-your-rights-workplace-discrimination-illegal Read more here Diversity and inclusion in everything we do every day - DNV Meet our employees - DNV About DNV DNV Careers Please visit our website at www.dnv.com DNV provides a reasonable range of compensation for this role. The actual compensation is influenced by a wide array of factors, including but not limited to skill set, level of experience, and specific location. The range of starting pay for this role is $63,000 - $90,000. About You What Is Required Bachelor’s degree required. Master’s degree or emphasis in a relevant discipline (Economics, public policy, mathematics, statistics, engineering, or social sciences) is an asset but not required Interest in forecasting and modeling customer adoption and use of energy technologies Ability to manage time and workload effectively to complete multiple tasks and meet deadlines Demonstrated curiosity and desire to continue learning and evolving with the market. An interest in understanding trends in decarbonization and grid modernization developments, policies, and markets An interest in using data and research to tell a story Ability to work collaboratively with a diverse team and have a positive, team-oriented attitude and professional demeanor Excellent written and verbal English communication skills; comfortable communicating with team members with different cultural backgrounds and experience We conduct pre-employment background check and drug screening What Is Preferred Work experience, including internships or research roles, in an analytical field Experience in understanding the energy and demand savings and/or the grid services and impact opportunities of EE, DR, DER, electrification Experience in a consulting or team-based research environment While not required, please feel free to submit a cover letter with your resume that details your experience conducting data analysis and any specific knowledge in the areas of EE, DR, DERs, electrification and/or NWAs. Immigration-related employment benefits, for example visa sponsorship, are not available for this position*
summary: DNV, an assurance and risk management firm, is seeking an Energy Strategy and Adoption Forecasting Analyst to join their new Strategy Team. The role involves supporting projects related to energy efficiency, demand response, distributed energy resources, and electrification forecasting, customer adoption analysis, non-wires and non-pipeline alternatives planning and forecasting, and cost-benefit analyses. The successful candidate will have a Bachelor's degree, interest in forecasting and modeling customer adoption of energy technologies, and excellent communication skills.

title: Senior Product Analyst
description: Our Mission Healthcare should work for patients, but it doesn’t. In their time of need, they call down outdated insurance directories. Then wait on hold. Then wait weeks for the privilege of a visit. Then wait in a room solely designed for waiting. Then wait for a surprise bill. In any other consumer industry, the companies delivering such a poor customer experience would not survive. But in healthcare, patients lack market power. Which means they are expected to accept the unacceptable. Zocdoc’s mission is to give power to the patient. To do that, we’ve built the leading healthcare marketplace that makes it easy to find and book in-person or virtual care in all 50 states, across +200 specialties and +12k insurance plans. By giving patients the ability to see and choose, we give them power. In doing so, we can make healthcare work like every other consumer sector, where businesses compete for customers, not the other way around. In time, this will drive quality up and prices down. We’re 15 years old and the leader in our space, but we are still just getting started. If you like solving important, complex problems alongside deeply thoughtful, driven, and collaborative teammates, read on. Your Impact On Our Mission We are looking for a Senior Product Analyst to join our Product Analytics team at Zocdoc! As a Senior Product Analyst, you’ll partner closely with the product teams to help make better decisions that power our business. You will shape strategy for critical product areas through data, and will guide product development with relevant insights based on analysis. You will be the subject matter expert on metrics and success measurement, experiment design and visual storytelling via data. You are focused on impact, and have the skill to understand customers and promote growth. You should demonstrate curiosity, data fluency, and a collaborative work ethic. You’ll enjoy this role if you are… Passionate about working with analyzing and creating data sets A product-driven analyst who likes to partner with multiple stakeholders Excited to use technology to enhance the consumer experience Your day to day is… Providing actionable insights to help product managers understand trends, marketplace dynamics, and user behaviors Identifying and quantitatively sizing feature opportunities based on user insights, to inform our overall Product strategy Partnering with product managers to define common user paths and actions, and owning data instrumentation and architecture components Own experimentation and launch design including A/B testing setup, execution, and analysis. Inform Product partners through clear interpretation of results Translating broad questions into plans for research and discovery, perform proactive data exploration, and communicate the results in a compelling way Partnering with the Product team to understand key business health questions, and build a dashboard suite that will become the go-to resource for common themes and reduce time to insight Becoming an expert in a specific product area, handle KPI reporting used to measure the health of the business and provide critical visibility of our data to Product Managers, Engineering and other business teams Exploring data to find actionable insights and make product recommendations through funnels, cohort analyses, and long-term trend investigations You’ll be successful in this role if you have… A BA/BS degree in a quantitative discipline: computer science, statistics, applied mathematics, operations research, engineering, economics, etc. 3+ years of work experience in process execution, business intelligence, dashboarding, reporting, or data analysis Fundamental understanding of predictive modeling and/or forecasting techniques 3+ years of experience with causal analytics and experimental design, implementation, and analysis (split tests, A/B tests, holdout tests, etc.) 3+ years of experience with manipulating large data sets using SQL 2+ years of experience with Tableau, Looker or comparable data visualization tools A passion to get deep into the weeds with data and understand edge cases and how to best represent them Experience building relationships with teammates, influencing decisions at a variety of levels and across multiple teams Benefits Flexible, hybrid work environment Unlimited PTO 100% paid employee health benefit options Employer funded 401(k) match Corporate wellness programs with Headspace and Peloton Sabbatical leave (for employees with 5+ years of service) Competitive parental leave Cell phone reimbursement In office perks including: Catered lunch everyday along with snacks Commuter Benefits Convenient Soho location Zocdoc is committed to fair and equitable compensation practices. Salary ranges are determined through alignment with market data. Base salary offered is determined by a number of factors including the candidate’s experience, qualifications, and skills. Certain positions are also eligible for variable pay and/or equity; your recruiter will discuss the full compensation package details. NYC Base Salary Range $128,000—$152,000 USD About Us Zocdoc is the country’s leading digital health marketplace that helps patients easily find and book the care they need. Each month, millions of patients use our free service to find nearby, in-network providers, compare choices based on verified patient reviews, and instantly book in-person or video visits online. Providers participate in Zocdoc’s Marketplace to reach new patients to grow their practice, fill their last-minute openings, and deliver a better healthcare experience. Founded in 2007 with a mission to give power to the patient, our work each day in pursuit of that mission is guided by our six core values. Zocdoc is a private company backed by some of the world’s leading investors, and we believe we’re still only scratching the surface of what we plan to accomplish. Zocdoc is a mission-driven organization dedicated to building teams as diverse as the patients and providers we aim to serve. In the spirit of one of our core values - Together, Not Alone , we are a company that prides itself on being highly collaborative, and we believe that diverse perspectives, experiences and contributors make our community and our platform better. We’re an equal opportunity employer committed to providing employees with a work environment free of discrimination and harassment. Applicants are considered for employment regardless of race, color, ethnicity, ancestry, religion, national origin, gender, sex, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital or parental status, disability, veteran status, or any other class protected by applicable laws. Job Applicant Privacy Notice
summary: Zocdoc is looking for a Senior Product Analyst to join their Product Analytics team. This role will involve partnering with product teams to make data-driven decisions, shape product strategy, and guide development through insights. The ideal candidate is passionate about data analysis, product-driven, and enjoys using technology to enhance the consumer experience.

title: Senior Analyst Airline Optimization Horizons
description: Position Summary JetBlue is looking for a Senior Analyst Airline Optimization - Horizons to be based at JetBlue’s Support Center in Long Island City, NY. The Airline Optimization - Horizons team is responsible for understanding and quantifying the effects of the Network on the Operation, and vice versa. The Airline Optimization - Horizons team will then support planning decisions across the company to maximize the airline’s end-to-end profitability and operational robustness. The team’s short-term responsibilities include helping to optimize schedules and operational targets and working across teams to prepare the schedule for deployment. Longer-term responsibilities focus on helping closely align JetBlue’s network plan with its operational footprint. The ideal Senior Analyst Airline Optimization - Horizons candidate will have commercial or operational planning experience. This candidate will also have excellent quantitative and interpersonal skills, helping them to excel at working across teams to measure and balance planning requirements. Analytical and modeling experience are required. Essential Responsibilities Identify hidden inefficiencies in Network or operational plans and opportunities to improve processes Work closely with Route & Schedule Planning crewmembers to build schedule scenarios, assess the revenue/strategic impact of decisions, and execute Network changes as needed Use planning scenarios to measure the cost impact of schedule changes Use tools to forecast operability outcomes and disruption risk Build relationships with Operational teams to help align short- and long-term planning decisions Leverage project management and change management techniques to ensure end to end implementation of decisions Other duties as assigned Minimum Experience And Qualifications Bachelor’s Degree in Economics, Business, Mathematics, Finance, Engineering, Statistics, Supply Chain or a related field; OR demonstrated capability to perform job responsibilities with a combination of a High School Diploma/GED and at least four (4) years of previous relevant work experience Three (3) years of analytical experience in a related field such as network planning, operations planning, management consulting, financial planning & analysis, network optimization, or schedule optimization Strong capabilities with database querying (e.g., SQL) and/or high-level programming language(s) (such as Python or R) Strong airline business acumen Excellent data analysis and problem-solving skills Strong written and verbal communication ability Able to effectively influence others at equal and higher levels of the organization Ability to work independently and in a team environment Ability to work under pressure in a fast paced, deadline driven environment Proficiency with Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint Available for occasional overnight travel (10%) Must pass a pre-employment drug test Must be legally eligible to work in the country in which the position is located Authorization to work in the US is required, this position is not eligible for visa sponsorship Preferred Experience And Qualifications Master’s Degree in Economics, Business, Mathematics, Finance, Engineering, Statistics, Supply Chain or a related field; OR demonstrated capability to perform job responsibilities with a High School Diploma/GED and at least six (6) years of previous relevant work experience Two (2) years’ experience in network planning, operations planning, network optimization, maintenance planning, system operations, revenue management, or schedule optimization function Familiarity with airline schedule, route planning, or Crew production tools/processes Experience with data visualization tools (e.g. Tableau, Spotfire, or Looker) Knowledge and/or experience with best practices throughout the airline industry Crewmember Expectations: Regular attendance and punctuality Potential need to work flexible hours and be available to respond on short-notice Able to maintain a professional appearance When working or traveling on JetBlue flights, and if time permits, all capable crewmembers are asked to assist with light cleaning of the aircraft Must be an appropriate organizational fit for the JetBlue culture, that is, exhibit the title: Business Continuity Analyst (Emergency Management, Disaster Recovery)
description: Empower. Unite. Care. MetroPlusHealth is committed to empowering New Yorkers by uniting communities through care. We believe that Health care is a right, not a privilege. If you have compassion and a collaborative spirit, work with us. You can come to work being proud of what you do every day. About NYC Health + Hospitals MetroPlus Health provides the highest quality healthcare services to residents of Bronx, Brooklyn, Manhattan, Queens and Staten Island through a comprehensive list of products, including, but not limited to, New York State Medicaid Managed Care, Medicare, Child Health Plus, Exchange, Partnership in Care, MetroPlus Gold, Essential Plan, etc. As a wholly owned subsidiary of NYC Health + Hospitals, the largest public health system in the United States, MetroPlus Health's network includes over 27,000 primary care providers, specialists and participating clinics. For more than 30 years, MetroPlus Health has been committed to building strong relationships with its members and providers to enable New Yorkers to live their healthiest life. Position Overview The Business Continuity (BC) Team ensures that all Departments have comprehensive BC Plans to continue to provide services in the event of a disruption. Under the direction of the Director of Business Continuity, the Business Continuity Analyst will play a critical role in developing and managing departmental Business Continuity Plans for the organization. The BC Analyst will work with the BC Team to ensure New York State requirements are met and industry best practices/ standards are developed, maintained, and adhered to across the organization. Job Description Collaborate with managers to develop and maintain Business Continuity Plans Assist in the planning and coordination of Business Continuity activities Plan and schedule exercises to test alternative strategies, crisis management, emergency notification and the company's ability to respond to business interruptions to identify the overall state of readiness Assist with Business and Technical Impact Analysis activities (e.g. interviews, questionnaires, data input, and assessment) Work to enhance, formalize, and standardize business continuity across all critical applications and business units Help define the appropriate recovery approach and support management in the recovery of business functions when a disaster occurs Facilitate Business Continuity exercises and tests, to identify potential gaps and areas of improvement Host training sessions on the Business Continuity framework and tool Inform and train staff on their responsibilities concerning business continuity procedures and emergency response Work on special projects and assignments, as needed Minimum Qualifications Bachelor's degree in business administration, risk management, or related field 2+ years of experience in Business Continuity or related area Experience in managing projects; working with cross functional teams; being a team player Intermediate to advanced proficiency in the Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Visio, Outlook) Knowledge of Fusion Risk Management Disaster Recovery Institute International (DRII), Business Continuity Institute (BCI), Federal Emergency Management Agency (FEMA), or other business continuity professional certification is a plus Professional Competencies Integrity and Trust Excellent oral and written communication skills Ability to prioritize tasks, projects, and to manage time effectively Detail oriented paired with high organization and decision-making skills Customer Focus
summary: The Business Continuity Analyst will develop and manage departmental Business Continuity Plans, ensuring compliance with New York State requirements and industry best practices. They will collaborate with managers, plan and coordinate activities, conduct exercises, perform impact analysis, and facilitate recovery efforts during a disaster.

title: Business Analyst, Provider Data Management
description: Job Description ABOUT US Join us in making a career in Independent Living Systems, an industry leader in managing home and community-based programs for over 20 years. Independent Living Systems, LLC and its subsidiaries offer a comprehensive range of clinical and third-party administrative services to managed care organizations and providers that serve high-cost, complex member populations in the Medicare, Medicaid, and Dual-Eligible Market. ILS provides tailored integrated solutions aimed at improving health outcomes while rebalancing costs, addressing social determinants of health and connecting members with community-based resources. Position Summary The Business Analyst Provider Data Management is responsible for taking a leading role in the coordination and loading of all physicians, hospital, and ancillary contracts for all Medicaid and Medicare clients. Essential Functions Responsible for the data integrity of all provider set-ups and reimbursement configurations Responsible for all practitioner, hospital and ancillary contracts loaded into the claims system. Implement provider contracts and/or contract amendments and conduct claims testing. Program reimbursement setups applicable to the contract specifications. This includes fee for service pricing, capitation, pricing methods appropriate for office based, inpatient, outpatient, ambulatory, and emergency room settings. Responsible for timely and accurate research of resources that update critical information on a scheduled basis. Assist with ad hoc projects as necessary to meet client needs. Create and document workflows and policies and procedures (P&Ps) as necessary. Participate in client implementation and conversion projects. Represent the department by actively participating in internal meetings, external (client) meetings, and work sessions. Assist in creating and maintaining all pricing setups in the claims system and ensure all updates are processed timely and accurately. Serve as mentor and support to the staff in interpreting and implementing complex contract configurations into the claims system. Troubleshoot provider set-ups as necessary, in support of the claim processing operation. Conduct other duties as requested by department management to assure efficient company operations. Client contact required. Education And Experience Associate degree minimum or equivalent experience. Minimum four (4) years industry experience required. Experience in processing UB-04 / CMS 1500 claims required. Familiarity and understanding of provider contracts. Knowledge of company’s proprietary claim systems preferred. Must possess good understanding of claim adjudication process including ICD, CPT, HCPCS Proficient knowledge of UB04 / CMS-1500 claim adjudication process, including Medicare and Medicaid reimbursement methodologies (i.e. Per Diem, PPS, FFS, APG, Capitation, etc.) required. Excellent verbal and written communication skills required. Computer proficiency in Microsoft applications (i.e. Excel and Access.) required. Ability to travel (infrequent) Required Skills Ethical Conduct. Strategic-Critical Thinking. Leadership. Decision Making. Financial Management. Communications Proficiency. Presentation Skills. title: Senior BSA Analyst (Korean Speaking)
description: Senior BSA Analyst New York, NY (on-site) Job Description: A global banking organization is seeking a BSA Manager in NYC. Candidates must be conversational in Korean. The ideal candidate will have extensive experience in BSA compliance and be able to effectively manage and enhance the bank’s BSA Compliance Program. Responsibilities: Oversee the daily operations of the Bank’s BSA Compliance Program to ensure it remains fully compliant. Revise and update the Bank’s BSA policy and procedures in response to regulatory changes or examination results. Excellent analytical and investigative skills. Ability to develop and manage comprehensive compliance programs. Effective communication skills and the ability to implement board directives and ensure adherence to policies. Contact chase.scottland@jcwresourcing.com for more information.

title: Tech Writer/Business Analyst
description: Job Description Job Title: Tech Writer/Business Analyst Type: Direct Hire Work Location: Hybrid in New York, NY Our client is seeking a professional to work within its IT Project Management / Business Analysis Team. Ensure all documentation complies with establish standards, and best practices including management of version controls to ensure updates are published in a timely manner. Manage onboarding process of new tools and technologies. Work closely with Business Teams to document requirements for planning and sizing effort. Manage multiple projects simultaneously, ensuring deadlines are met. Drive working group meetings. Create clear and concise status summaries with action items. Coordinate with Department stakeholders to track milestones, deliverables, and dependencies. Assist with production implementation, coordinated user validation, Front to Back UAT as needed. Required Skills & Experience Bachelor's degree. Computer Science or Information Systems is a plus. 8+ years of experience in a Financial organization as a Technical Writer with Business Analysis experience relating to Trading System. Good understanding of Infrastructure (Windows, Linux, Database, Network, BCP, SAN) technologies as it relates to Application setups. External Systems such Swap Execution Facilities, booking applications Bloomberg, affirmations(ie. Markitwire / RTNS). Strong written and verbal communication skills. Ability to understand and explain technical concepts. Excellent attention to detail and organizational skills Strong organizational and time management skills. Strong work ethic and dedication/meets target dates. Proficient with MS Suite - Excel, Word, PowerPoint, Project, Visio, SharePoint, JIRA and Confluence Big Bonus Points If You Have Products knowledge– OTC IRS, FX, Fixed Income i.e., Credit Single Names / Indices, Treasuries Bills/Bonds/Notes, cash products Job Requisition # 38649 A reasonable estimate of the Base Salary for this role is $110,000 - $120,000. The disclosed pay range estimate has not been adjusted for the applicable geographic differential associated with the location at which the position may be filled. The compensation decisions are dependent on the facts and circumstances of each case, such as skills and experience levels.

title: Research Analyst
description: Title: Research Analyst Location: US Based - Open to location Level: Associate Compensation: We expect that this role will command a salary of between $150,000 and $200,000 About us: Founded in 2013, GSR is a leading market-making and programmatic trading company in the exciting and fast-evolving world of cryptocurrency trading. With more than 200 employees in 5 countries, we provide billions of dollars of liquidity to cryptocurrency protocols and exchanges on a daily basis. We build long-term relationships with cryptocurrency communities and traditional investors by offering exceptional service, expertise and trading capabilities tailored to their specific needs. GSR works with token issuers, traders, investors, miners, and more than 30 cryptocurrency exchanges around the world. In volatile markets we are a trusted partner to crypto native builders and to those exploring the industry for the first time. Our team of veteran finance and technology executives from Goldman Sachs, Two Sigma, and Citadel, among others, has developed one of the world’s most robust trading platforms designed to navigate issues unique to the digital asset markets. We have continuously improved our technology throughout our history, allowing for our clients to scale and execute their strategies with the highest level of efficiency. Working at GSR is an opportunity to be deeply embedded in every major sector of the cryptocurrency ecosystem. About the role: GSR is seeking a Research Analyst (Associate) - Business Development to join our dynamic team on a full-time basis. You will report to our Senior Strategist based in New York City but can be located in any of our 12 global locations, including London, Singapore, and New York. The Research team conducts deep, fundamental research to demonstrate thought leadership externally as well as support clients and internal business initiatives. In doing so, the Research Team contributes to GSR brand equity and awareness, elevates the level of client support, and helps business development, trading, risk, and investments accomplish their goals. The GSR Research Analyst leverages their strong understanding of cryptocurrency to generate deep insights to author industry-leading research reports, offer value-add advice to top crypto projects, support firm trading and risk decisions from a fundamental viewpoint, and work with senior management for more informed firm strategy and key business decisions. Responsibilities: Conduct deep fundamental research to: Produce external reports ranging from daily market updates to weekly news summaries, monthly crypto commentaries, and in-depth reports on key topics. Support key clients with advice and advisory regarding go to market strategies, competitive environment analyses, tokenomics, etc. Support trading and risk to monitor positions from a fundamental perspective Enhance GSR’s brand equity through conference presentations, podcast appearances, media commentary, twitter presence, etc. Build deep cross-functional knowledge of internal operating environment and external market dynamics to inform leadership team on a range of strategic and operational issues Your Profile: Bachelor’s degree or higher in finance, business, or engineering 3+ years of research or strategy experience at a digital assets, finance or technology company Strong knowledge of the cryptocurrency ecosystem and technical underpinnings is strongly preferred Basic understanding of financial trading terms, including structured and derivatives products Strong work ethic, with innate curiosity and desire to go above and beyond Proven organizational skills, with the ability to effectively prioritize tasks in a fast-paced environment What we offer: A collaborative and transparent company culture founded on Integrity, Innovation and Performance. Competitive Salary with two discretionary bonus payments a year. Benefits such as Healthcare, Dental, Vision, Retirement Planning, 30 days holiday and free lunches when in the office. Hybrid working pattern in all of our offices from London, the US, Singapore, Zug and Malaga. Regular Town Halls and offsites, team lunches and drinks. A Corporate and Social Responsibility program as well as charity fundraising matching and volunteer days. Immigration and relocation support where required. GSR is proudly an Equal Employment Opportunity employer. We do not discriminate based upon any applicable legally protected characteristics such as race, religion, color, country of origin, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression or age. We operate a meritocracy, all aspects of people engagement from the decision to hire or promote as well as our performance management process will be based on the business needs and individual merit, competence in the role. Learn more about us at www.gsr.io
summary: GSR, a leading cryptocurrency market-making and trading company, seeks a Research Analyst (Associate) - Business Development. The role involves conducting deep fundamental research on the crypto market, authoring industry-leading reports, offering advice to crypto projects, and supporting trading and risk decisions. Responsibilities include producing market updates, news summaries, crypto commentaries, in-depth reports, and supporting key clients with go-to-market strategies, competitive environment analyses, and tokenomics. The ideal candidate will have a Bachelor's degree or higher in finance, business, or engineering, 3+ years of research or strategy experience in digital assets, finance, or technology, strong knowledge of the cryptocurrency ecosystem, basic understanding of financial trading terms, and proven organizational skills.

title: Multinational Facultative Reinsurance Process Analyst
description: Job Title: Multinational Facultative Reinsurance Process Analyst Start Date: Immediate Type: Full-Time, Permanent Rate: Salary Negotiable End Client: Confidential Industry: Insurance / Re-Insurance Location: Manhattan, NY (On-Site) Travel: No Job Description: The successful candidate will function within the Reinsurance Operations team. We are looking for someone with a can-do attitude and desire to help build our business and processes within a team environment. The primary objective of the Multinational Facultative Reinsurance Operations Analyst (Analyst) is to serve as the subject matter expert (SME) of the end-to-end multinational facultative reinsurance booking workflow. The Analyst ensures the timely and accurate booking of multinational facultative reinsurance bookings. This includes the end-to-end quality review of all data elements, coding documentation, and reinsurance system results. This also includes participation in process improvement, data quality control, reporting initiatives and financial reconciliation activities. The Analyst will be responsible for the booking of complex facultative reinsurance agreements, execution of workflow exceptions, analysis, and remediation of incorrect facultative reinsurance bookings. The Facultative Reinsurance Process Analyst will collaborate with all units across the enterprise engaged in the processing and support of facultative reinsurance. This role must effectively work with our Multinational Program Management, Local Branch & Home Office Underwriting, Operations, Claims, Reinsurance Accounting, Reinsurance Services, Technology, Reinsurance Counterparties (i.e., Direct Reinsurers & Intermediaries.) This role will assist with the implementation and oversight of process flow quality controls & compliance and multinational facultative reinsurance booking reporting requirements. The duties and responsibilities of the position include: Job Duties / Responsibilities: The quality assurance review and booking of assigned multinational facultative reinsurance agreements. The Analyst will ensure that the agreement and premium booking layoff information are correct. This will pertain to complex multinational programs of work that may involve difficult premium booking requirements. Exception handling of complex facultative reinsurance agreements that require exception processing outside the standard reinsurance workflow. Confirm and validate multiple foreign currency values and conversion from original currency to U.S. dollar. Verify appropriate assumed, ceded, and retrocessions feed correctly from end to end (i.e., Direct Premium Underwriting System to Facultative Reinsurance Booking System). The daily review and completion of facultative reinsurance premium booking transactions in our ReinsurancePro Reinsurance System. Quality review of the facultative reinsurance premium booking data and documentation to ensure submissions are completed accurately, within our reinsurance guidelines and service level agreements. Collaborate with appropriate reinsurance resources (i.e., Underwriting, Reinsurance, Accounting, Operations, IT, etc.) to report and provide resolution to issues preventing the accurate and prompt completion of facultative reinsurance premium booking transactions. Produce and distribute recurring quality control reports to ensure that facultative reinsurance tasks, data and documentation are compliant with reinsurance guidelines, service level agreements, and our Reinsurance systems (i.e., eReinsure, ReinsurancePro, etc.) requirements. Maintain work tracking system to provide up to date and accurate metrics on facultative reinsurance submission premium booking activity. Provide recurring status reports on facultative reinsurance premium booking activity. Assist our other Reinsurance functions (i.e., Multinational Underwriting, Accounting, Credit, IT, Legal, & Services) to remediate facultative reinsurance coding and data quality issues. Effective Communication and Team Collaboration Translate facultative reinsurance processing activities and objectives in a manner appropriate for various audiences and stakeholders during 1-on-1 interactions, meetings and/or conference calls. Identify and escalate issues appropriately and provide timely progress updates. Ensure issues are identified, tracked, reported on and resolved in a timely manner. Monitor project progress by tracking activity; resolving problems. Apply lessons learned to each succeeding project. Collaborate with Reinsurance Operations team members to conduct peer reviews of facultative reinsurance transactions generated by other team members and provide constructive feedback in meetings or written form when required. Follow departmental workflow processes and work in a transparent manner. Assist with identification of new process improvement opportunities to the facultative reinsurance workflow and systems; support the software development life cycle for process improvement initiatives (i.e., Business Requirements, User Acceptance Testing, etc.). Participate in testing efforts when new functionality (i.e., enhancements and corrections) are developed. Completion of ad-hoc tasks and projects. Skills/Experience Required: Bachelor’s degree preferably in business-related field of study. 3+ Years of experience in insurance & reinsurance industry. Strong knowledge and experience with multinational reinsurance including treaty and facultative. Hands-on experience working with groups to analyze, define and develop business requirements and workflow processes, including IT related requirements. Experience working with underwriting, reinsurance and claims platforms and software. Experience with reinsurance systems. Attention to detail; report issues encountered in processing but also lead resolution effort. High level of self-management; independent worker with analytical skills that can contribute to multiple projects. Leadership skills with the ability to manage and coordinate teams. Strong interpersonal and collaborative skills; collaborate across groups & functions in a fast-paced setting. Effective presentation skills; strong verbal communications skills and strong writing ability. Beneficial to have knowledge and proficiency with RiPro (Sapiens) Proficiency with Microsoft Office Suites (i.e., Microsoft Excel, PowerPoint, Word). CPCU and / or ARe designations preferred but not required.
summary: This position is for a Multinational Facultative Reinsurance Process Analyst who will be responsible for the end-to-end multinational facultative reinsurance booking workflow. The Analyst will ensure the timely and accurate booking of multinational facultative reinsurance bookings, including quality review of all data elements, coding documentation, and reinsurance system results. This position requires strong knowledge and experience with multinational reinsurance including treaty and facultative, hands-on experience working with groups to analyze, define and develop business requirements and workflow processes, including IT related requirements, and experience working with underwriting, reinsurance and claims platforms and software.

title: Power Market Fundamentals analyst
description: Power Markets Analyst: We are partnered with a leading player in the energy sector, committed to delivering innovative and sustainable solutions to meet the world's growing energy needs. We are looking for a talented and motivated Analyst to join the Power Marketing & Trading team and play a crucial role in the growth of the trading business. As an Analyst in the Energy Marketing & Trading team, you will be responsible for supporting the development and execution of strategies related to the buying, selling, and trading of energy commodities. You will play a pivotal role in analyzing market data, assessing risk, and helping to optimize trading strategies. Your work will directly impact our organization's bottom line and contribute to our success in a rapidly evolving energy market. Key Responsibilities: · Analyze market data, trends, and relevant information to support trading decisions. · Collaborate with traders and risk managers to develop and refine trading strategies. · Monitor and report on energy market conditions and developments. · Assist in managing risk through the use of financial instruments and hedging strategies. · Prepare reports and presentations to communicate market insights to stakeholders. · Stay updated on industry regulations and compliance requirements. Qualifications: · 2+ years of energy markets experience in a trading or analytical role · Bachelor's degree in finance, economics, engineering, or a related field. A master's degree is a plus. · Strong analytical and quantitative skills with a keen interest in the energy market. · Knowledge of energy market fundamentals and trading concepts. · Proficiency in data analysis and financial modeling. · Excellent communication and presentation skills. · Detail-oriented with the ability to work under pressure in a fast-paced environment. · Knowledge of relevant software tools and platforms used in energy trading is an advantage.
summary: This is a Power Markets Analyst role for an energy company seeking an individual with 2+ years of energy market experience to analyze data, support trading decisions, collaborate with traders and risk managers, and contribute to the growth of the trading business.

title: Sr Demand & Deployment Analyst (New York)
description: Description Position: Sr. Demand and Deployment Analyst Your Role The Senior Demand and Deployment (D&D) Analyst develops and executes various analyses to support, inform, and influence demand forecasting and inventory deployment strategies. This role will strategically assess the business’ demand and inventory position across the Victoria’s Secret Beauty business with the intent of aligning financial and operational plans. This role may be responsible for the supervision and development of an Inventory Deployment Analyst. The ideal candidate should be a highly analytical thinker with a strong interest in product and store plan forecasting. Why You Belong Here At Victoria’s Secret & Co, we acknowledge your value. We recognize that every associate has something unique to add to our brand and business. We strive to recruit, retain, and advance diverse talent that reflects the customers we serve and the communities where we live and work. We foster a culture where everyone belongs because we know our business thrives most when we look for, listen to, and amplify diversity, equity, and inclusion. We place the customer at the heart of everything we do. We dream big, embrace curiosity and creativity while always learning from our mistakes. We lead with integrity, trust, and respect to achieve the best outcomes as one team. Your Impact Track and analyze the performance of inventory plans, making recommendations on potential areas for improvement Drive significant and measurable improvements in forecasting accuracy and inventory management Ensure inventory levels support themes and floorsets Partner with Store Operations and Logistics to streamline shipping and merchandise flow optimizing store merchandise process Report and make process/tool/talent-specific recommendations for the improvement of forecast accuracy and inventory targets Direct the creation and utilization of forecasting methods (statistical models and software tools) to deliver and monitor forecast accuracy, ensuring the achievement of forecast performance within standards Monitor and ensure consistent use of best practice methodology for the configuration of forecasting and event management processes and systems, including decision support for improved pattern after logic Prepare, report, and communicate forecast and inventory measurements to management on a weekly and period basis (forecast accuracy, inventory plans vs. targets) Fully complete analysis projects from initial business question/challenge through recommended action with little direction Leverage an understanding of the concepts of inventory micro-management Assess level of information needed and most efficient method to synthesize data to appropriately answer business question/problem Present analysis clearly in both written and verbal formats Champion change, taking risks as needed and demonstrating flexibility Adapt and embrace new systems/processes Actively pursue growth and development opportunities, continually finding ways to improve Click here for benefit details related to this position. Minimum Salary: $95,500.00 Maximum Salary: $130,515.00 VS&Co provides a range of compensation for this role as shown. Your actual salary will be determined by a number of factors, including: your specific skills and experience, geographic region, or other relevant factors. Qualifications Qualifications Your Experience Bachelor's degree in a related field 5-7 years of experience in analytical positions and/or inventory deployment, demand forecasting, merchandise planning, finance, or logistics, preferably in retail or consumer products serving high-volume, fast-paced and seasonal businesses High level of technical proficiency in relevant planning, allocation, replenishment, analytical, data management, and financial systems, such as JDA Allocation and Fulfillment, EDW, SAP, Microstrategy, Microsoft Excel, PowerPoint and Access Decisive problem-solver with strong results orientation Demonstrated ability to manage multiple priorities and customer types/levels Excellent communication, prioritizing and problem-solving skills Maintain strong cross-functional relationships An equal opportunity employer, we do not discriminate in hiring or terms and conditions of employment because of an individual’s race, color, religion, gender, gender identity, national origin, citizenship, age, disability, sexual orientation, marital status or any other protected category recognized by state, federal or local laws. We only hire individuals authorized for employment in the United States.
summary: The Senior Demand and Deployment Analyst role at Victoria's Secret & Co. involves analyzing demand and inventory data to inform forecasting and deployment strategies for the Victoria's Secret Beauty business. This role requires strong analytical skills, experience in retail or consumer products, and proficiency in various planning and analytical systems. The ideal candidate will lead improvements in forecasting accuracy and inventory management, ensuring alignment with financial and operational goals.  They will also partner with various departments to optimize merchandise flow and present analysis to management. The position offers a competitive salary range and a comprehensive benefits package.

title: SAP Demand-to-Supply Business Analyst – PP/DS & IBP :: Remote :: Long Term

title: Citi Treasury Investments - CTI Analytics Business Analyst - C12/AVP
description: Citi Treasury Investments was established in 2011 within Corporate Treasury to lead the investment of Citi’s major liquidity portfolios with oversight from Citi’s ALCOs. This involves managing the portfolios to meet all necessary regulatory requirements while achieving attractive returns. The team also conducts hedging and positioning activities for the firm at a global level to protect the firm against long term shifts in the macro environment. CTI’s Capital Markets team manages Citi’s Benchmark Debt issuance and Credit Card Securitization programs. CTI manages AFS and HTM investment securities across a variety of sectors such as US Treasuries, Agencies and MBS, as well as a range of Credit instruments such as Foreign Government Bonds, CLOs, Covered Bonds and others. Job Description This position is an Analyst role for the CTI Business and will require a person with the ability implement business requirements for projects related to the Consent Order, Business initiatives, Regulatory requirements (Fed & OCC), and Matters Requiring Attention (MRA’s). The main focus of the role will be the decommissioning of the current Summit Product Processor for Swaps, Debt, Money Markets, and Non-USD cash products. The Analyst will work closely with the Finance Transformation and Governance group on implementing the CTI Business requirements. These projects cross all sections of the CTI Business including the Rates, MBS, FX, and Capital Markets. The projects span all aspects of the business from P&L, Risk, Pricing, Valuation, Products, Operations, Accounting, Legal and Compliance. Job Requirements The Analyst is required to assist developing CTI Business requirements as the firm responds to changing Regulatory requirements (Fed & OCC), and Matters Requiring Attention (MRA’s) as well as new business initiatives developed by the desk. This role will focus on developing requirements for Economic Profit & Loss Reporting and the associated Attribution Analysis (PAA) which requires a high level of numeracy. In addition, the Analyst will be expected to act as a backup and provide ongoing support to one or more desk aligned Business Unit Managers (BUMs) who are also part of the CTI Analytics team. The Analyst will be working in partnership with: Product Control; front office; and various technology teams and therefore strong communication skills and the ability to distill complex information into simple presentations are required. The core responsibility for this role is for the Analyst to assist with insuring that the CTI Business requirements for the project(s) are understood, documented in the BRD, and assist with the implementation of system and business process changes and the installation of technical (system) and/or operational (procedural) change. In addition, the candidate will be a key resource to help drive the digital transformation for the group. As such, financial engineering expertise, python, VBA, or other coding experience is recommended. Responsibilities: Assist on multiple projects covering business initiatives & Regulatory requirements for the CTI Business Work closely with Business, Finance, and Technology partners to understand business requirements Succinctly present project updates including risks, issues and general progress at an executive level on a weekly basis Meticulous daily managing of your delivery schedule by using a clear & cogent project plan(s) Participate and manage the authoring of Project plans, Charters, BRDs & Test Plans and overall project execution as required. Work closely with business and finance partners to understand business requirements Clear summarizing of key discussion points and action items upon meeting closure Partnering with accountable participants to ensure prompt follow-ups are completed Tracking general progress and escalating all risks and issues on a daily basis Assist in BAU process, reporting, and analytic review Qualifications: Minimum Bachelor’s Degree required. Graduate level degree a plus. 1-5 years of experience within project management, financial services or consulting Experience communicating with senior managers and program sponsors Significant intellectual curiosity and desire to learn how Citi Treasury functions Superior attention to detail and diligence sufficient to withstand scrutiny of a senior audience Must be a strong influencer and have partnering skills Abstract critical thinking and problem solving skills Good understanding of understanding of a bank’s balance sheet Technical skills a plus: MS Visio, MS Project, MS Excel, MS PowerPoint, Power BI Ability to write python scripts or VBA is a plus. ------------------------------------------------------ Job Family Group: Finance ------------------------------------------------------ Job Family: Balance Sheet Management ------------------------------------------------------ Time Type: Full time ------------------------------------------------------ Primary Location: New York New York United States ------------------------------------------------------ Primary Location Full Time Salary Range: $109,120.00 - $163,680.00 In addition to salary, Citi’s offerings may also include, for eligible employees, discretionary and formulaic incentive and retention awards. Citi offers competitive employee benefits, including: medical, dental & vision coverage; 401(k); life, accident, and disability insurance; and wellness programs. Citi also offers paid time off packages, including planned time off (vacation), unplanned time off (sick leave), and paid holidays. For additional information regarding Citi employee benefits, please visit citibenefits.com. title: Director of Strategic Insights
description: About the Company: Our client, a leading strategic advisory firm, equips top investors, corporations, and foundations with the crucial insights needed to succeed in today's intricate global environment. The firm harnesses a global network of advisors with deep expertise in diplomacy, intelligence, finance, academia, and industry to deliver unmatched geopolitical risk, investment strategy, and macroeconomic intelligence. Role Overview: We are looking for a seasoned and energetic Director to lead and manage client engagements across a diverse portfolio. This role is essential for nurturing client relationships, providing top-tier strategic insights, and driving new business initiatives. Core Responsibilities: Client Engagement Leadership: Spearhead various client teams on key strategic and investment projects, including the origination, design, leadership, and execution of engagements. Developing Client Relationships: Build and enhance client relationships by: Delivering research, original content, and compelling presentations. Customizing methodologies to meet specific client needs. Briefing senior client representatives and boards with tailored insights. Gaining deep understanding of client strategies and operations to deliver precise assessments. Managing project workflows and ensuring the highest quality in all deliverables. Geopolitical and Economic Analysis: Track and analyze global risks and opportunities, leveraging personal expertise to contribute to the firm's comprehensive output. Collaborative Insight Sharing: Engage regularly with senior advisors and contributors, participate in internal policy discussions, and crystallize valuable insights from the firm’s extensive network. Intellectual Capital Development: Oversee the creation of the firm’s intellectual outputs, including presentations, memos, and briefings. Business Development: Identify new client opportunities, develop proposals, innovate new service offerings, and assess potential business ventures. Team Management: Play an active role in the Director Group to enhance the firm’s infrastructure and growth. Mentor and manage Associate and Analyst-level team members, supporting their professional development and participating in recruitment. Key Skills: Proficiency in written and spoken English. Strong drafting and communication abilities. Expertise in producing precise and concise analytical reports. Consistent high-quality work under pressure. Professional client interaction experience. Effective project management skills, capable of handling multiple projects and tight deadlines. Strict adherence to confidentiality standards. Qualifications and Experience: Over 8 years of client and project management experience, preferably in strategy or management consulting. Bachelor’s and/or Master’s degree in International Relations, International Affairs, Economics, or a related field. Why This Opportunity? This is a unique chance to be at the cutting edge of strategic advisory, working with an elite team and distinguished clients. If you are a strategic visionary with a passion for global markets and geopolitics, and you have the expertise and experience to lead high-impact projects, we are eager to meet you. To apply please contact policy@octaviusfinance.com
summary: A leading strategic advisory firm is seeking a Director to manage client engagements, provide strategic insights, and drive business growth. title: Existing Customer Marketing - Strategy Analyst (C13/VP)
description: Position Summary The US Personal Banking and Wealth Management Marketing organization drives all aspects of the customer lifecycle, from Acquisition to Engagement to Retention, across all major Business Units in Citi’s Personal Bank – Branded Cards and Lending, Retail Bank and Mortgage and Wealth. The Existing Customer Marketing (ECM) team within this organization is a critical driver of Marketing, with a vision to deepen and expand the relationships our customers have with Citi – increasing their usage of our products and services, promoting behaviors that create long-term loyalty, and thoughtfully communicating new benefits, features and products that can strengthen our relationship. The ECM organization is currently seeking a VP, ECM Strategy Analyst to drive analysis of marketing effectiveness. The role primarily involves developing and implementing analytical strategies to drive business growth, optimize operations, and enhance decision-making processes. The ideal candidate will possess a strong background in data analysis, financial services, and a proven track record of developing and monitoring key performance indicators (KPIs). Responsibilities Develop Analytics Agenda: Lead the development of a comprehensive analytics agenda that supports business goals and priorities. Work closely with stakeholders to understand their analytical needs and requirements. Continuously evaluate and refine the analytics agenda to adapt to changing business dynamics and market trends. Develop and Monitor Key Performance Indicators (KPIs): Partner with cross-functional teams to identify and define relevant KPIs aligned with business objectives. Design and implement robust measurement frameworks to track KPIs and performance metrics effectively. Regularly analyze KPI data to identify trends, patterns, and areas for improvement. Generate actionable insights and recommendations based on KPI analysis to drive strategic decision-making. Business Case Development and Scenario Planning: Develop compelling business cases that articulate the value proposition and justification for investment in strategic projects. Partner with business units to assess the feasibility and potential impact of proposed initiatives. Conduct thorough cost-benefit analyses and ROI assessments to support decision-making. Analyze various scenarios to understand their impact on financial performance. Collaborate with stakeholders to develop strategic responses to potential scenarios. Present business cases to senior management and key stakeholders, providing clear and persuasive arguments for proposed initiatives. Measure Marketing Effectiveness: Develop and implement key performance indicators (KPIs) to track and evaluate marketing initiatives' success. Monitor and evaluate the effectiveness of new initiatives and tests, adjusting as necessary to maximize outcomes. Create insightful reports and presentations to communicate findings and recommendations to stakeholders at all levels. Qualifications 5+ years of relevant experience Strong experience in scoping and creating KPI’s and metrics and developing metrics dashboards. High degree of comfort with financial and quantitative analysis, scenario development, and key P&L drivers; ability to create and model data easily and comfort with scope and direct quantitative analysis working closely with USCA and Finance Familiarity with financial services industry and competitor products/services Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to effectively convey technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders. Strong project management skills, with the ability to prioritize tasks, manage multiple projects simultaneously, and meet deadlines. title: Growth Marketing Analyst
description: GROWTH MARKETING ANALYST - Direct Response/Acquisition Our client is looking for an extremely smart and analytical person to join their DTC health/wellness/tech company. Ideally, they want someone from a performance/growth marketing agency who has experience with direct response (DR) clients and who wants an opportunity to learn podcast. There is a HUGE career upside to this role. Once fully trained on the campaign side, you can own the $10MM+ podcast side of the business. Growth Marketing Analyst Role : Reporting and optimization of paid partnerships (influencer and podcast) Track placements and post-campaign analysis Identify/Recommend top-performing partners who will elevate into the core workflow Assist the Head of Growth in expanding new partnerships by identifying, onboarding, and setting partners up for long-term success Contribute test planning Qualifications Needed: 2+ years of campaign analysis focused on acquisition and DR/direct response ( not brand awareness ) Experience leveraging large amounts of data to drive decisions Comfortable testing and optimizing You DO NOT need to have any experience with podcasts or influencer campaigns Highly prefer someone in the office in NYC 4-5 days a week, but open to looking outside of NY Total compensation includes: Base pay $80k - $110k Equity It is understood that Hansen Recruiting, LLC recruits and refers candidates, regardless of age, sex, sexual orientation, race, color, creed, religion, ethnicity, national origin, alienage or citizenship, disability, marital status, veteran or military status, genetic information or any other legally-recognized protected basis under federal, state, or local laws, regulations or ordinances.
summary: This is a Growth Marketing Analyst position at a DTC health/wellness/tech company, focused on direct response (DR) marketing and podcasting. The ideal candidate has experience with performance/growth marketing agencies and a proven track record in DR campaigns. This role offers significant career growth potential, with the opportunity to eventually manage the company's $10MM+ podcast business.

title: Senior Analyst, Ingredients Sourcing Center of Excellence
description: We’re hiring a Senior Analyst to join our Center of Excellence Team within our Strategic Sourcing department here at HelloFresh. In this exciting role, you will be a key partner to our ingredients purchasing leaders supporting core budgeting processes and driving strategic sourcing initiatives. To succeed in this role, you’ll need to have a genuine interest in analyzing ambiguous datasets to identify actionable business insights, negotiations, and a strong desire to make a data driven big impact You will … Collaborate with Procurement category leaders to facilitate and drive strategic RFx initiatives Identify and communicate actionable data driven business insights to internal partners, including senior and executive leadership Support our quarterly budgeting process for the entire enterprise across all lines of businesses Ad-hoc spend analytics You are… Data-driven – You can organize, analyze, and synthesize unstructured data into actionable insights to better inform operational decision-making. Intellectually curious – You have an insatiable desire to understand how things work, why they work the way they do, identify data-driven insights, and consistently challenge the status quo. Detail-oriented – You possess strong organizational skills and consistently demonstrate a methodical approach to all your work. A self-starter – You are highly motivated and passionate. You’re eager to take on new projects without knowing exactly what you will uncover. Agile – You thrive in fast-paced and dynamic environments and are comfortable working autonomously. A structured-thinker – You use logic to identify issues and opportunities to solve complex problems. An excellent communicator – You can explain complex technical information to a variety of audiences. You have… 3-4 years of relevant work experience in an analytical capacity (preparing reports, presentations, and data visualizations for dashboards) within a Procurement centric role and/or 2 years of management consulting experience Undergraduate degree in Supply Chain, Business, Math, Engineering, Data/Computer Science, or other relevant areas of study Advanced Fluent in Microsoft Office applications (especially Excel) and Google Suite applications (especially Google sheets / Google scripts). Basic experience with database languages and structures (e.g. SQL) and programming languages (e.g. Python) are a plus. You’ll get… Competitive salary, 401k with company match that vests immediately upon participation, and company equity plan based on role Generous PTO, including sabbatical, and parental leave of up to 16 weeks Comprehensive health and wellness benefits with options at $0 monthly, effective first day of employment Tuition reimbursement for continuing education Up to 75% discount on subscriptions to HelloFresh meal plans (HelloFresh, Green Chef, Everyplate, and Factor_) Access to 7 different Employee Resource Groups (ERGs) including those for BIPOC, women, veterans, parents, and LGBTQ+ Inclusive, collaborative, and dynamic work environment within a fast-paced, mission-driven company that is disrupting the traditional food supply chain This job description is intended to provide a general overview of the responsibilities. However, the Company reserves the right to adjust, modify, or reassign work tasks and responsibilities as needed to meet changing business needs, operational requirements, or other factors. New York Pay Range $82,500—$105,000 USD JR101424
summary: We're hiring a Senior Analyst to join our Center of Excellence Team within our Strategic Sourcing department. You will be a key partner to our ingredients purchasing leaders, supporting core budgeting processes and driving strategic sourcing initiatives. You'll analyze ambiguous datasets to identify actionable business insights and drive negotiations. You will collaborate with Procurement category leaders to facilitate and drive strategic RFx initiatives. You will identify and communicate actionable data driven business insights to internal partners, including senior and executive leadership.
benefits: Inclusive, collaborative, and dynamic work environment

title: Product Specialist
description: Citibank, N.A. seeks a Product Specialist for its New York, New York location. Duties: Lead creation of a vision and strategy and drive roadmap prioritization and execution for initiatives in the Commercial Lending transformation space, utilizing digital transformation tools and macro and micro-economic trends. Provide prioritized requirements for the build and launch of digital lending capabilities to increase client satisfaction and revenue and decrease costs for Citi Commercial Bank, and drive implementation of supporting process changes to enable adoption of digital tools. Set Key Performance Indicators (“KPIs”) for the success of the lending transformation initiatives and implement frameworks to measure regularly. Communicate status of initiatives and oversee accountable owners and tasks clearly and timely. Communicate vision and value of capabilities to internal stakeholders through direct selling and creation of marketing / awareness materials in order to maximize adoption. Partner with internal and 3rd party technology teams to drive best-in-class product development supported by the effective implementation of agile ceremonies and practices and the prioritization of scalable, future-proof technology solutions enabling integration across financial platforms (internal and external). Build and maintain yearly/quarterly/monthly product roadmap, leveraging analysis performed on market competitors. A telecommuting/hybrid work schedule may be permitted within a commutable distance from the worksite, in accordance with Citi policies and protocols. Requirements: Requires a Bachelor’s degree, or foreign equivalent, in Business Economics, Management, Finance, or related field and 3 years of progressively responsible, post-baccalaureate experience as a Product Manager, Product Specialist, IT Business Lead Analyst, Analyst, Senior Analyst, Consultant, or related position involving digital transformation efforts of business, products, processes, and systems in the financial services industry. 3 years of experience must include: End-to-end software development lifecycle; Digital transformation tools and frameworks; and Agile and scrum methodology. At least 2 years of experience must include: Application Programming Interface technologies; Strategic frameworks for corporate innovation and approaches to measure financial KPIs; Advanced knowledge of Jira and Confluence software; Macro & micro-economics trends in relation to commercial lending and financial services; Industry benchmarking and peer analysis tools and frameworks; and User experience design systems, including InVision. 10% US and international travel required. Applicants submit resumes at https://jobs.citi.com/. Please reference Job ID #24746801. EO Employer. Wage Range: $205,000 to $208,400 Job Family Group: Product Management&Develop Job Family: Product Management ------------------------------------------------------ Job Family Group: ------------------------------------------------------ Job Family: ------------------------------------------------------ Time Type: Full time ------------------------------------------------------ Primary Location: New York New York United States ------------------------------------------------------ Primary Location Full Time Salary Range: In addition to salary, Citi’s offerings may also include, for eligible employees, discretionary and formulaic incentive and retention awards. Citi offers competitive employee benefits, including: medical, dental & vision coverage; 401(k); life, accident, and disability insurance; and wellness programs. Citi also offers paid time off packages, including planned time off (vacation), unplanned time off (sick leave), and paid holidays. For additional information regarding Citi employee benefits, please visit citibenefits.com. Available offerings may vary by jurisdiction, job level, and date of hire. ------------------------------------------------------ Anticipated Posting Close Date: May 20, 2024 ------------------------------------------------------ Citi is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration without regard to their race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran. Citigroup Inc. and its subsidiaries ("Citi”) invite all qualified interested applicants to apply for career opportunities. If you are a person with a disability and need a reasonable accommodation to use our search tools and/or apply for a career opportunity review Accessibility at Citi .
