summary: Citibank seeks a Product Specialist to lead the digital transformation of its Commercial Lending division in New York City. The role involves developing a vision, driving roadmap execution, building digital lending capabilities, setting KPIs, and communicating progress to stakeholders. The ideal candidate possesses strong experience in digital transformation, software development, agile methodologies, and financial services, along with expertise in API technologies, strategic innovation frameworks, and user experience design.

title: Technical Operations Analyst
description: About Sony Music Entertainment At Sony Music Entertainment, we fuel the creative journey. We’ve played a pioneering role in music history, from the first-ever music label to the invention of the flat disc record. We’ve nurtured some of music’s most iconic artists and produced some of the most influential recordings of all time. Today, we work in more than 70 countries, supporting a diverse roster of international superstars, developing and independent artists, and visionary creators. From our position at the intersection of music, entertainment, and technology, we bring imagination and expertise to the newest products and platforms, embrace new business models, employ breakthrough tools, and provide powerful insights that help our artists push creative boundaries and reach new audiences. In everything we do, we’re committed to artistic integrity, transparency, and entrepreneurship. Sony Music Entertainment is a member of the Sony family of global companies. Sony Music Entertainment (SME) is seeking an enthusiastic and technically adept Technical Operations Analyst to join our Content Protection team. This position will play a key role in maintaining and supporting the technical and operational dimensions of SME’s intellectual property enforcement programs. As an analyst, you will be responsible for identifying and executing process improvements to improve performance, productivity, and efficiency, ensuring the fulfillment of departmental goals. We are seeking a candidate who is not only proficient in technology but also has a strong foundation in technical operations, project management, or software engineering, coupled with a fervent interest in music and technology. What you'll do: Develop, implement, and maintain the technical and operational functions of SME’s content protection initiatives Drive process improvements to increase performance, productivity, and efficiency Support SME’s Content Protection department with operational tasks, including quality assurance, content management, intellectual property enforcement, and artist/label services Evaluate and implement technologies incorporating machine learning, artificial intelligence, and music recognition technologies to further SME's content protection strategies Investigate and devise strategies to mitigate content abuses on music streaming platforms Collaborate with SME’s labels, affiliates, and business units to address Content Protection-related issues Who you are: Must possess B.S. from an accredited institution Proven experience in technical operations, project management, or software engineering Knowledgeable about machine learning, artificial intelligence, and music recognition technologies Proficient in a modern programming language (e.g., Python, Java, Javascript, R) Possess strong analytical and problem-solving skills. What we give you: You join an inclusive, collaborative and global community where you have the opportunity to fuel the creative journey A modern office environment designed to foster productivity, creativity, and teamwork An attractive and comprehensive benefits package including medical, dental, vision, life & disability coverage, and 401K + employer matching Voluntary benefits like company-paid identity theft protection and resources for pets, mental health and meditation resources, industry-leading fertility coverage, fully paid leave for childbirth or bonding, fully paid leave for caregivers, programs for loved ones with developmental disabilities and neurodiversity, subsidized back-up child and elder care, and reimbursement for adoption, surrogacy, tuition and student loans We invest in your professional growth & development Time off for a winter recess Sony Music is committed to providing equal employment opportunity for all persons regardless of age, disability, national origin, race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, pregnancy, veteran or military status, marital and civil partnership/union status, alienage or citizenship status, creed, genetic information or any other status protected by applicable federal, state, or local law. The anticipated annual base salary does not include any other compensation components or other benefits that an individual may be eligible for. The actual base salary offered depends on a variety of factors, which may include as applicable, the qualifications of the individual applicant for the position, years of relevant experience, specific and unique skills, level of education attained, certifications or other professional licenses held, and the location in which the applicant lives and/or from which they will be performing the job. New York Pay Range $75,000 — $83,000 USD
summary: Sony Music Entertainment is seeking a Technical Operations Analyst to join their Content Protection team. This role will focus on maintaining and improving the technical and operational aspects of intellectual property enforcement programs, including implementing process improvements, evaluating and implementing new technologies like machine learning and music recognition, mitigating content abuse, and collaborating with internal teams to address content protection issues.

title: Inventory Deployment Analyst
description: Description Position: Inventory Deployment Analyst Your Role The Inventory Deployment Analyst is an individual contributor responsible for end-to-end deployment strategy leading to finished goods allocation from distribution center to stores for a specific book of business. Ensures optimum inventory levels to maximize sales and margin to achieve targeted levels of inventory productivity, in support of overall product and company profitability. The Inventory Deployment Analyst will also be a liaison between stores, logistics and other cross functional partners. They will utilize several business applications including, but not limited to: JDA Allocation, SAP and MicroStrategy. Why You Belong Here At Victoria’s Secret & Co, we acknowledge your value. We recognize that every associate has something unique to add to our brand and business. We strive to recruit, retain, and advance diverse talent that reflects the customers we serve and the communities where we live and work. We foster a culture where everyone belongs because we know our business thrives most when we look for, listen to, and amplify diversity, equity, and inclusion. We place the customer at the heart of everything we do. We dream big, embrace curiosity and creativity while always learning from our mistakes. We lead with integrity, trust, and respect to achieve the best outcomes as one team. Your Impact Execute daily/weekly deployment of product to stores to improve inventory levels, maximizing sales plans/trend. Deliver budgeted sales and margin by ensuring inventory levels align with store customer preferences enabling plan sell-thru Formulate inventory deployment strategy (pre-season & in-season), considering constraints and inputs, such as inventory levels by store cluster (tiering), timing of merchandise delivery, minimum presentation, and distribution of sizes to support merchandise sales plans Develop and articulate fact-based analytical approach to deployment decisions, monitor results and action deployment adjustments with exceptional change agility Be an advocate for the field and participate in occasional store travel. Spark cross-functional action that improves the complexion of store level inventories. Quantify inventory buys by size to support targeted inventory levels by store Collaborate with the Merchandise Planner and Merchant partners to prioritize flow of product considering inventory constraints Participate in category and cross functional meetings – leverage analytics to influence decision making Consistently demonstrate analytical curiosity and socialize thoughts to drive action Work with Logistics partners to resolve external constraints that impact inventory flow to distribution center and stores Work collaboratively across multiple functions and departments within the organization. Support and execute to testing strategies, category specific initiatives and ad-hoc analysis. Support inventory management between digital and store channels Minimum Salary: $73,000.00 Maximum Salary: $97,125.00 VS&Co provides a range of compensation for this role as shown. Your actual salary will be determined by a number of factors, including: your specific skills and experience, geographic region, or other relevant factors. Qualifications Your Experience 1-3 years of inventory management and/or store analysis experience preferred Bachelor’s degree in business-related discipline preferred Experience in high volume, fast paced, specialty/big box retail environment or equivalent. Demonstrated ability to handle multiple priorities effectively Ability to work collaboratively and influence multiple partners on business decisions and able to troubleshoot issues for best possible resolution. Strong analytical skills – ability to analyze and understand quantitative data Intermediate technical skill proficiency (PC-based) using functions in Excel and Access; demonstrated ability to learn and apply new software technology. Systems used: JDA Allocation, SAP and MicroStrategy. An equal opportunity employer, we do not discriminate in hiring or terms and conditions of employment because of an individual’s race, color, religion, gender, gender identity, national origin, citizenship, age, disability, sexual orientation, marital status or any other protected category recognized by state, federal or local laws. We only hire individuals authorized for employment in the United States.
summary: The Inventory Deployment Analyst is responsible for end-to-end deployment strategy for finished goods allocation from distribution center to stores. This role ensures optimum inventory levels to maximize sales and margin, and acts as a liaison between stores, logistics, and other cross-functional partners. The analyst utilizes various business applications including JDA Allocation, SAP, and MicroStrategy.

title: Senior Strategy and Planning Analyst
description: About Ropes & Gray Ropes & Gray is a preeminent, global law firm. The firm has been ranked in the top-three on The American Lawyer's prestigious "A-List" for seven years and is ranked #1 on Law.com International's "A-List" in the U.K. - rankings that honor the "Best of the Best" firms. The firm has approximately 2,500 lawyers and professionals serving clients in major centers of business, finance, technology, and government in Boston, Chicago, Dublin, Hong Kong, London, Los Angeles, New York, San Francisco, Seoul, Shanghai, Silicon Valley, Singapore, Tokyo and Washington, D.C. The firm has consistently been recognized for its leading practices in many areas, including asset management, private equity, M&A, finance, real estate, tax, antitrust, life sciences, health care, intellectual property, litigation & enforcement, privacy & cybersecurity, and business restructuring. Ropes & Gray is an equal opportunity employer. Overview About the Strategy team A key component of Ropes & Gray’s success is a strategy team that supports the firm’s leadership in making a wide range of strategic business decisions through rigorous research, analysis, and assessment. The strategy team enjoys the trust of Ropes & Gray’s leadership and is called upon to advise on important strategic decisions about the firm’s future. The wide range of practice areas at Ropes & Gray and the broad array of client segments and geographic markets that the firm serves result in strategy team projects that span many disciplines – indeed, no two projects are alike – and variety is the name of the game. Strategy team members have diverse backgrounds, but share an immutable commitment to the excellence of our work product and to the growth and development of team members. We are dedicated professionals, we work together as a team that has a strong sense of purpose, and take great pride in our collective success. About You We are looking for a special individual to join us. Ropes & Gray is an exceptional firm and a special place to work. The strategy team is a group of highly capable, humble, and deeply committed professionals with an impressive track record of excellence in all that we do. You are our ideal candidate if you are curious, self-motivated, patient, and poised; enjoy working in an environment where team members are supportive and have each other’s backs; possess an innate desire to own and complete assignments to the highest standard in a timely manner; and have experience, aptitude, and interest in both quantitative and qualitative business analytics. As a member of the strategy team, you will feel vested in the team’s success and will care about the professional experience of colleagues. You will enjoy working on a wide variety of strategy projects that are challenging and provide opportunities for growth. Responsibilities Essential responsibilities Research and a nalysis , which is a cornerstone for every analyst/senior analyst. This means you get to be curious and learn every day. You will independently gather, analyze, structure, and synthesize qualitative and quantitative business, external market, and competitor data and information, as well as examine aspects of the firm’s client base, capabilities, and economics – to find patterns and begin to draw implications. Project management and work planning , which includes a broad range of responsibilities from developing hypotheses and figuring out how to explore them to applying effective time management skills to balance multiple efforts and consistently meet deadlines – all while ensuring the highest level of accuracy, organization, documentation, communication, and follow-through. Emerging decision support , which starts with the presentation of findings through compelling and logical deliverables such as qualitative and quantitative exhibits, as well as discrete sections of written reports. This involves working closely and iteratively with teammates to create polished, client-ready deliverables. Qualifications Desired experience, skills, and education You are the right person for the job if you: Are, first and foremost, adaptable and flexible given the dynamic nature of the strategy team’s work and evolving demands and priorities. Have an aptitude for complex research and analytical work and demonstrated strengths and interest in problem solving. Are able to work in a self-directed manner, take ownership of work, and contribute to the success of the team. Are willing to receive and provide constructive feedback. Are capable of multi-tasking, sometimes under time-sensitive conditions. Possess strong communication skills including written, verbal, and listening. Like to collaborate, build relationships, and contribute to a positive work environment. Have advanced Excel, PowerPoint, and Word skills. Have an undergraduate degree and a minimum of two years of relevant experience, ideally in a professional services environment. Compensation And Total Rewards Package Ropes & Gray is proud to offer a comprehensive Total Rewards package to our business support team members. The firm also offers comprehensive health and well-being benefits, personal and professional development, career growth opportunities and a collegial and supportive culture. The anticipated pay range for this role is $105,000 to $158,000 in New York, and $100,000 to $151,000 in Boston, which represents our good faith and reasonable estimate of the starting salary range at the time of posting. In addition, this role is eligible for a discretionary bonus based on performance. The actual offered rate for this position will be determined based on job-related, non-discriminatory factors, including qualifications and experience, geographic location, education, external market data and consideration of internal equity. Working Conditions This position requires hybrid on-site presence as an essential function of the role. Consistent and predictable on-site presence is required for ongoing business continuity, professional development and effective collaboration with colleagues and management.
summary: Ropes & Gray, a top-tier global law firm, is seeking a Strategy Analyst/Senior Analyst to join their strategy team. This role involves conducting research, analyzing business data, and supporting strategic decision-making for the firm. Ideal candidates will have strong analytical skills, experience with qualitative and quantitative data, and a demonstrated ability to work independently and as part of a team. The position offers a competitive salary, comprehensive benefits, and the opportunity to work on a variety of challenging projects within a supportive and collaborative environment.

title: Analyst - CCS Business Support
description: The base salary range for this position is dependent upon experience and location, ranging from $30.27- $37.84. Work Type:Office Location:Kikwood NY Job Summary The Analyst CCS Business Support position reports to the Manager of Device and Retail in the Customer Service Center of Excellence. The position is focused on New York support working closely with Principal and Lead Analysts. The primary responsibilities of the Analyst - CCS Business Support are to provide: First level of SAP CCS support to all functional business units within New York. Project support for New York regulatory and/or Avangrid Networks objectives. This requires working with functional groups to understand and define business requirements, identifying a solution and assisting in the implementation of the solution in SAP CCS and related interfaces within Device and Retail. This position also requires working well with end users, process owners, IT support groups, and external vendors. Key Responsibilities Day-to-day CCS production support for Customer Service business units. Effectively identify, communicate, prioritize, document, and resolve SAP CCS and/or related interface production issues between business, IT, and/or vendors. Support analysis, solution determination, testing, and implementation of Avangrid Networks application fixes and/or changes to minimize rework and production issues. Project support with business units, IT, Center of Excellence Teams and/or external vendors to understand, define business requirements and implement regulatory and/or Avangrid Networks in line with CCS system and/or related interfaces. Including analysis, project schedule, requirements/design documentation, test plans, testing, test result documentation, implementation, and post implementation support. Effectively prioritize and resolve project issues between business, IT, and/or vendors. Create, maintain, and promote standard documentation (i.e. requirements, test cases, procedures, instructions, reference materials, training materials, etc.) Analyze, develop, and/or execute manual and automatic reports to achieve business unit solutions. Required Qualifications Bachelor’s degree preferred. Associate’s degree with a minimum of 3 years relevant experience or High School/GED with a minimum of 5 years relevant experience required. Preferred Qualifications Strong verbal and written communication skills. Self-Motivated. Ability to manage multiple concurrent assignments. Strong detailed orientation and planning skills. Strong interpersonal skills. Demonstrated analytical skill. Competencies Growth & Continuous Improvement Initiative & Change Focused on Results Customer Centric Communication Collaboration Leadership #Office Mobility Information Please note that any applicant who is not a citizen of the country of the vacancy will be subject to compliance with the applicable immigration requirements to legally work in that country AVANGRID’s employment practices and policies are geared to hiring a diverse workforce and sustaining an inclusive culture. At AVANGRID we provide fair and equal employment and advancement opportunities for all employees and candidates regardless of race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, disability, protected veteran status or any other status protected by federal, state, or local law. If you are an individual with a disability or a disabled veteran who is unable to use our online tool to search for or to apply for jobs, you may request a reasonable accommodation by contacting our People and Organization department at careers@avangrid.com Job Posting End Date August-1-2024
summary: The Analyst CCS Business Support position is responsible for providing first-level SAP CCS support to New York business units, project support for regulatory and Avangrid Networks objectives, and working with functional groups to define business requirements and implement solutions in SAP CCS.

title: Life Science Consulting Senior Analyst
description: Description About Us We set out to develop a health care innovation organization that could separate the background “noise” from what warrants investment in our highly complex, rapidly evolving marketplace lacking transparency to enable our pharmaceutical and biotech clients to make better decisions and flourish. Today, ten years later, we are the preeminent U.S. market access oncology and specialty strategy partner, grounded in the structure and logic of the strategy consulting discipline, bolstered by our robust data set continuously enriched via our unequaled specialty access panel of the most highly influential access and value influencers in the U.S. With a unique staffing model of highly structured and collaborative creative thinkers akin to an oncology and specialty think tank, we have increasingly come to be viewed as an influencer in our industry. At the interface of clinical, economic, and operational evolving needs, the Dedham Group has become the go-to resource for addressing the challenges faced by the world’s leading life sciences organizations. Now, The Dedham Group is proud to be a part ofNorstella, an organization that consists of market-leading pharmaceutical solutions providers united under one goal: to improve patient access to life-saving therapies. Within this organization, The Dedham Group plays a key role helping commercial teams navigate the oncology space to get much-needed drugs to market—and helping clients connect the dots from pipeline to patient. About The Senior Analyst The Senior Analyst position at TDG is a rare and exciting opportunity for junior team members who are extremely smart and ambitious looking to further their careers in the Life Sciences industry and strategy consulting. Analysts will work on projects addressing the reimbursement, pricing, demand creation, health policy, health economics and market strategy needs of clients. Analysts will support all levels of consulting projects and business development work including: Market research (primary and secondary research) Data analysis Report and presentation development Strategy assessment and commercial insight And other duties as assigned Requirements Our ideal candidate has: A science or science-related degree from a top-tier university 1-3 years of experience in consulting or related fields within the healthcare industry Entrepreneurial and collaborative attitude Excellent time and project management skills Superior skills in using MS Office (particularly PowerPoint and Excel) Strong communication and analytical skills Benefits Medical and prescription drug benefits Health savings accounts or flexible spending accounts Dental plans and vision benefits Basic life and AD&D Benefits 401k retirement plan Short- and Long-Term Disability Paid parental leave Paid time off The expected base salary for this position ranges from $105,000 to $130,000. It is not typical for offers to be made at or near the top of the range. Salary offers are based on a wide range of factors including relevant skills, training, experience, education, and, where applicable, licensure or certifications obtained. Market and organizational factors are also considered. In addition to base salary and a competitive benefits package, successful candidates are eligible to receive a discretionary bonus. Please note- all candidates must be authorized to work in the United States. We do not provide visa sponsorship or transfers. We are not currently accepting candidates who are on an OPT visa. The Guiding Principles For Success At Norstella 01: Bold, Passionate, Mission-First We have a lofty mission to Smooth Access to Life Saving Therapies and we will get there by being bold and passionate about the mission and our clients. Our clients and the mission in what we are trying to accomplish must be in the forefront of our minds in everything we do. 02: Integrity, Truth, Reality We make promises that we can keep, and goals that push us to new heights. Our integrity offers us the opportunity to learn and improve by being honest about what works and what doesn’t. By being true to the data and producing realistic metrics, we are able to create plans and resources to achieve our goals. 03: Kindness, Empathy, Grace We will empathize with everyone's situation, provide positive and constructive feedback with kindness, and accept opportunities for improvement with grace and gratitude. We use this principle across the organization to collaborate and build lines of open communication. 04: Resilience, Mettle, Perseverance We will persevere – even in difficult and challenging situations. Our ability to recover from missteps and failures in a positive way will help us to be successful in our mission. 05: Humility, Gratitude, Learning We will be true learners by showing humility and gratitude in our work. We recognize that the smartest person in the room is the one who is always listening, learning, and willing to shift their thinking. Norstella is an equal opportunities employer and does not discriminate on the grounds of gender, sexual orientation, marital or civil partner status, pregnancy or maternity, gender reassignment, race, color, nationality, ethnic or national origin, religion or belief, disability or age. Our ethos is to respect and value people’s differences, to help everyone achieve more at work as well as in their personal lives so that they feel proud of the part they play in our success. We believe that all decisions about people at work should be based on the individual’s abilities, skills, performance and behavior and our business requirements. Norstella operates a zero tolerance policy to any form of discrimination, abuse or harassment. Sometimes the best opportunities are hidden by self-doubt. We disqualify ourselves before we have the opportunity to be considered. Regardless of where you came from, how you identify, or the path that led you here- you are welcome. If you read this job description and feel passion and excitement, we’re just as excited about you.
summary: The Dedham Group, a subsidiary of Norstella, seeks a Senior Analyst to support their oncology and specialty strategy consulting services. The role involves market research, data analysis, report development, and strategic assessment for pharmaceutical and biotech clients. The ideal candidate has a science degree from a top university and 1-3 years of experience in consulting or related healthcare fields.

title: Associate Director, Salesforce Business Analyst
description: About The Role Grade Level (for internal use): 11 Position Description: Associate Director, Salesforce Business Analyst Grade: 11 (For Internal Purposes) The Role: You will be responsible for working closely with Sales, Marketing, Product, and Technology teams to enhance and optimize the Salesforce suite of products. The ideal candidate will manage and deliver components of engagement that includes analysis of current state business process and technology, process and functional design, future state prototyping and development related to Salesforce platform. Responsibilities Work closely with sales, marketing, and other counterparts to understand business processes. Design, develop and align strategic goals and objectives with key decisions regarding Salesforce.com products and business solutions Develop a Salesforce implementation plan for the business unit based on a situational awareness of various business scenarios and motivations Collaborate across business segments to find opportunities and showcase ideas in the Innovation and emerging business pipeline Gather requirements and recommend solutions leveraging Salesforce.com (strong bias toward native Salesforce functionality). Translate business needs into solution architecture requirements Lead agile development teams to design and implement innovate solutions with a focus on adhering to standards and best practices Provide advice on best practices and approaches to technology teams and internal business clients Perform tasks such as modifying security settings, establishing workflow rules, and generating reports and dashboards Qualifications B.S. degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, MIS or equivalent combination of relevant work experience and education Experience in business analysis and technology implementation in enterprise environments 4 Yr.'s experience implementing or administering Salesforce Automation software in enterprise environments including identifying business requirements, collection of use cases/user stories, process design, testing, training and implementation support Strong expertise in at least two of the following areas is required: System Implementation, Change Enablement & User Adoption Salesforce.com Sales Force Automation Salesforce.com Service & Support Salesforce.com Communities and Mobile Salesforce.com Force.com platform development Strong project management, problem solving and troubleshooting skills Certifications are a plus: (Salesforce Certified Administrator; Certified Sales Cloud Consultant; Certified Force.com Platform App Builder) Compensation/Benefits Information (US Applicants Only) S&P Global states that the anticipated base salary range for this position is $72,300 to $143,800. Base salary ranges may vary by geographic location. In addition to base compensation, this role is eligible for an annual incentive plan. This role is eligible to receive additional S&P Global benefits. For more information on the benefits we provide to our employees, visit https://www.spgbenefitessentials.com/newhires . title: Analyst, Site & App Content Strategy
description: Description Your Role The Analyst, Site & App Content Strategy is responsible for driving growth through cohesive messaging brought to life across brand touchpoints within the site and app channels. The ability to develop strong cross-functional relationships and utilize insights to influence others are critical to this role’s success. The Analyst will work cross-functionally to understand PINK and megabrand product and promotional priorities while also building out messaging priorities through the filter of a customer-first mindset. The role will also support growth of the total digital and app channels through strategic planning, data driven insights and a view to enhance the customer experience. This role is a mix of digital merchandising, content strategy, analytics, and creative problem solving. Why You Belong Here At Victoria’s Secret & Co, we acknowledge your value. We recognize that every associate has something unique to add to our brand and business. We strive to recruit, retain, and advance diverse talent that reflects the customers we serve and the communities where we live and work. We foster a culture where everyone belongs because we know our business thrives most when we look for, listen to, and amplify diversity, equity, and inclusion. We place the customer at the heart of everything we do. We dream big, embrace curiosity and creativity while always learning from our mistakes. We lead with integrity, trust, and respect to achieve the best outcomes as one team. Your Impact Support ideation and implementation of content strategies for key launches and marketing initiatives in order to drive profitable business growth and build strong brand equity Oversee the content planning and execution of brand initiatives brought to life in Victoria’s Secret PINK site & app channels Partner with digital merchandising, production and creative teams to flow through daily business now changes designed to optimize business performance in the moment Analyze homepage & app performance inclusive of click through rate, heatmaps, financial impact to drive optimization on a daily basis Partner with creative and copy teams to advance cross category story-telling and effectively balance promotional moments with product newness Identify opportunities to drive app file growth through acquisition initiatives Proof site and app creative for product and content accuracy Manage calendarization of content, in addition to content and offer changes Recommend opportunities for innovative content messaging. Create deliverables for senior leadership strategy and launch reviews as well as content reporting and performance Support planning and execution of A/B content tests in partnership with site execution teams and apply learnings to content Work cross-functionally with other marketing channels to align on content plans Act as the liaison between PR, copy, creative and cross functional marketing teams to confirm alignment and ensure approvals Manage execution of project plans and deadlines to achieve all content objectives on time and anticipate and resolve potential problems/issues Monitor trends in competitive and consumer landscape to identify brand advancement opportunities Click here for benefit details related to this position. Minimum Salary: $67,000.00 Maximum Salary: $86,100.00 VS&Co provides a range of compensation for this role as shown. Your actual salary will be determined by a number of factors, including: your specific skills and experience, geographic region, or other relevant factors. Qualifications Your Experience Bachelor's degree in Marketing or Digital Merchandising 3-5 years in progressive consumer marketing or Digital Merchandising positions for strong brand, with a proven track record in development/execution of developing and leading strategic marketing plans Strategic, analytical and creative thinker that focuses on results Deep understanding of the digital landscape and how site and app strategically fits into the customer journey Ability to integrate information across a variety of sources and translate it into an effective strategy Excellent organizational and planning skills Exceptional written and oral communication skills Ability to perform in a fast-paced environment and welcome change as it is presented Extensive experience working in teams and managing internal cross-functional as well as external partners (i.e. agencies) Retail/Fashion digital merchandising/marketing a plus An equal opportunity employer, we do not discriminate in hiring or terms and conditions of employment because of an individual’s race, color, religion, gender, gender identity, national origin, citizenship, age, disability, sexual orientation, marital status or any other protected category recognized by state, federal or local laws. We only hire individuals authorized for employment in the United States.

This role involves understanding product and promotional priorities, building out messaging, supporting growth of the digital and app channels, and utilizing insights to influence others.

title: Senior Analyst, Sales Incentive Compensation
description: Netflix is one of the world's leading streaming entertainment services, with 260 million paid memberships in over 190 countries. Members enjoy TV series, documentaries, feature films, and mobile games across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can play, pause, and resume watching as they want, anytime, anywhere, and can change their plans at any time. The core Advertising team is charged with building a new, best-in-class Ads organization to establish Netflix as the premiere platform for advertiser partners and to drive advertising revenue. As part of the Business Operations & Strategy team, this role will be a critical builder of the Sales Incentive Compensation (SIC) program, supporting the Advertising business. This means driving new solutions across SIC plan design, quota setting and management, payout operations, program analytics, and process/tool design and implementation. Netflix is seeking a Sr. Analyst, Sales Incentive Compensation to build with us at this early stage. The ideal candidate will be an exceptionally strong analytical thinker who can demonstrate teamwork, strategic relationship building, and the ability to influence at multiple levels of the organization. They thrive in fast-paced dynamic environments and are flexible, detail-oriented, and passionate about customers and advertisers. They must also be comfortable working with numerous stakeholders across the global organization in a highly ambiguous environment. For this role, the successful candidate will have deep experience across Sales Incentives and/or Sales Ops programs and in defining and managing processes and metrics to support a high-growth sales organization. They will be able to juggle competing projects, define and execute against roadmaps to support the SIC program, and solve complex problems. This role will be accountable for the definition and implementation of Sales Incentive program metrics and measurement. Drawing insights from industry benchmarks and internal baselines will be core to success for this role. This role will also lead the building of reporting capabilities, data transformations, and forums for reviewing program health. This person will work closely with sales leaders, finance, HR, talent, legal, and other Netflix business partner teams to set and administer our SIC policies and program. Specific Responsibilities Determine the effectiveness and impact of global sales incentive compensation models, producing data insights and making design recommendations to a steering committee Drive revenue data quality, including sourcing and reconciliation Partner with engineering to design and implement SIC reporting and automation solutions Play a key role in the global SIC program foundational buildout including; SIC strategy, policy and procedure documentation, enablement and related content creation, payroll, SOX, annual plan design process, quota, and stakeholder support Define, document, and govern the health of the program metric review forums for Sr. Director and VP-level stakeholders from Sales, Finance, Talent, and Business Operations organizations Propose and present ideas effectively, influencing decisions and outcomes Design and implement SIC plans via tools, processes, and sales readiness The successful candidate must be able to roll-up their sleeves and dive deep to implement effective processes and solutions. They will be passionate about their work, detail-oriented, resourceful, analytical, and have excellent problem-solving abilities. Communication and partner-relationship skills are critical, with a deep background in SIC or sales operations. Must be a passionate advocate for creating programs that deliver exceptional results from teams. Basic Qualifications Bachelor’s degree in a related field 7+ years of sales incentive compensation, FP&A, or sales operations experience Expert-level user of Microsoft Excel and/or Google Sheets Preferred Qualifications Experience implementing variable sales compensation plans Experience working with Sales CRM and SIC tools (such as Salesforce and CaptivateIQ/Xactly/SPIFF) Demonstrated understanding of finance/FP&A concepts and processes Ability to define, aggregate, and analyze metrics to assess performance drivers Experience setting, interpreting, and governing policies for a large-scale program Experience with sales incentive compensation models for advertising Strong interpersonal and communication (written and verbal) skills Exceptional attention to detail Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top-of-market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $70,000 - $420,000. Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs. Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more details about our Benefits here. Netflix is a unique culture and environment. Learn more here. We are an equal opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, ancestry, national origin, caste, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, age, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic makeup, marital status, or military service.
summary: Netflix is seeking a Sr. Analyst, Sales Incentive Compensation to join their Advertising team and build a new, best-in-class Ads organization. This role will be a key contributor to the Sales Incentive Compensation (SIC) program, driving solutions across plan design, quota management, payout operations, analytics, and process/tool implementation. The ideal candidate will have deep experience in sales incentives and/or sales operations, demonstrating strong analytical skills, teamwork, strategic relationship building, and influencing capabilities. This role will work closely with sales leaders, finance, HR, talent, legal, and other Netflix business partner teams to set and administer SIC policies.

title: Lead Business Analytics & Reporting Analyst- Buffalo NY/ hybrid
description: Overview: This position is responsible for supporting the Retail Product organization to assist in the controls and monitoring of risk, along with supporting customer remediation efforts. Responsible for assuming the lead role in developing, maintaining, and automating reports and analysis. Primary Responsibilities: Lead the creation and maintenance of various reporting dashboards. Go beyond basic reporting and delivery with the ability to analyze large amounts of data and information to provide meaningful insights and professionally communicate those insights to management and business partners. Develop and produce high complexity departmental reports and spreadsheets to include but not limited to project or product strategy analysis, historical reporting, workflow analysis, and financial analysis. Identify trends, emerging issues and engage relevant stakeholders to develop project plans, organize virtual and physical events, synthesize multiple points of view, and communicate findings utilizing such tools as white papers, reports and other relevant formats. Lead continuous improvement of existing processes, develop new processes, or enhance existing processes where required including maintenance plans, procedural documentation, and custom tools for automation. Identify resources that can be utilized to support business operations or improve existing business processes. Present findings and make recommendations to management. Perform complex analysis and judgment-based work over multiple disciplines to support business decisions. Lead in the planning and implementation of new projects, programs, and plans to achieve short and long-term business objectives. Coordinate of the design and execution of various projects for the promotion and maintenance of the business. Take a lead role in supporting departmental audits including user recerts and compliance testing. Manage the planning, testing, and implementation of new projects, systems, products, and regulatory changes impacting the department. Act as lead for departmental system support, coordinating with business partners, vendors, and technology to address issues for the department. Adhere to applicable compliance/operational risk controls in accordance with Company or regulatory standards and policies. Promote an environment that supports diversity and reflects the M&T Bank brand. Maintain M&T internal control standards, including timely implementation of internal and external audit points together with any issues raised by external regulators as applicable. Complete other related duties as assigned. Education and Experience Required: Bachelor’s degree and a minimum of 4 years related business line experience, OR in lieu of, A combined minimum of 8 years higher education and/or work experience Supervisory/Managerial Responsibilities: Acts as an advisor and coach to mentor junior team members May provide direction and leadership to more junior staff M&T Bank is committed to fair, competitive, and market-informed pay for our employees. The pay range for this position is $71,985.72 - $119,976.20 Annual (USD). The successful candidate’s particular combination of knowledge, skills, and experience will inform their specific compensation. Location Buffalo, New York, United States of America
summary: This role supports the Retail Product organization by assisting with risk controls and monitoring, customer remediation efforts, and leading the development, maintenance, and automation of reports and analysis. Responsibilities include creating and maintaining reporting dashboards, analyzing large data sets to provide insights, developing complex reports and spreadsheets, identifying trends and issues, leading process improvement, identifying and utilizing resources, presenting findings and recommendations, leading project planning and implementation, coordinating project design and execution, supporting departmental audits, managing project planning, testing, and implementation, acting as lead for departmental system support, and ensuring compliance with company and regulatory standards.

title: Senior IT Business Analysis Specialist
description: Company: Guy Carpenter Description: Guy Carpenter is the world's premier reinsurance intermediary and strategic advisor to leading insurance and reinsurance organizations, delivering integrated solutions through its industry-leading analytics and advisory services, highly specialized product knowledge and trading relationships with reinsurance markets around the world. Guy Carpenter is seeking candidates for the following position based in the New York City office: What can you expect? As a Senior Business Analyst, you will play a critical role in translating business strategies and objectives into business requirements. You will be responsible for identifying, verifying, and documenting functional requirements using Requirements Management methodology and tools. Additionally, you will analyze, design, and document "as is" and "to be" business processes, ensuring a clear understanding of requirements within the development community. What is in it for you? This is unique opportunity to exercise your creativity and make an immediate impact across an entire enterprise. Very high buy-in and visibility by senior business management. A chance to gain valuable domain experience in large and dynamic insurance sector of the economy A competitive compensation package, including excellent employee benefits. We will count on you to: Translate business strategies and objectives into clear and concise business requirements. Provide traceability of business requirements to IT solutions and ensure system testing encompasses existing capabilities of the solution as well as future function point requirements. Identify, verify, and document functional requirements using Requirements Management methodology and tools. Identify data elements and provide data mappings/dictionaries. Analyze, design, redesign, and document "as is" and "to be" business processes. Ensure the development community has a clear and complete understanding of the requirements. Conduct and facilitate acceptance tests for solutions with the user community, including the development of UAT test scenarios and test scripts. Develop, deliver, and evaluate training and supplemental materials. Conduct and analyze feasibility studies/impact assessments regarding the implementation of IT solutions against current state parameters (process, application use-cases, and non-functional impact). Partner with Business/IT to define and manage the scope with each release. What you need to have: 7+ years of practical IT project experience working as a business analyst. Deep understanding of reinsurance operations, including the business, processes, and data. Very strong communication, negotiation, analytical, and problem-solving skills. Experience in building engaging relationships with technical and non-technical teams. Practical, current experience with Agile methodologies. What makes you stand out? Deep understanding of reinsurance operations, including the business, processes, and data. Knowledge of or practical experience with the MERN tech stack. Experience with compliance and data regulations, such as GDPR, NYDFS, etc. Agile or Project Management certifications. Experience with documenting requirements in Microsoft Azure DevOps (ADO) and Confluence Guy Carpenter & Company, LLC is a leading global risk and reinsurance specialist with more than 3,500 professionals in over 60 offices around the world. Guy Carpenter delivers a powerful combination of broking expertise, trusted strategic advisory services and industry-leading analytics to help clients adapt to emerging opportunities and achieve profitable growth. Guy Carpenter is a business of Marsh McLennan (NYSE: MMC), the world's leading professional services firm in the areas of risk, strategy and people. The company's 85,000 colleagues advise clients in over 130 countries. With annualized revenue of over $23 billion, Marsh McLennan helps clients navigate an increasingly dynamic and complex environment through four market-leading companies including Marsh, Mercer and Oliver Wyman. For more information, visit www.guycarp.com and follow us on LinkedIn and X. Marsh McLennan is committed to embracing a diverse, inclusive and flexible work environment. We aim to attract and retain the best people and embrace diversity of age background, disability, ethnic origin, family duties, gender orientation or expression, marital status, nationality, parental status, personal or social status, political affiliation, race, religion and beliefs, sex/gender, sexual orientation or expression, skin color, veteran status (including protected veterans), or any other characteristic protected by applicable law. If you have a need that requires accommodation, please let us know by contacting TANA@mmc.com Marsh McLennan is committed to hybrid work, which includes the flexibility of working remotely and the collaboration, connections and professional development benefits of working together in the office. All Marsh McLennan colleagues are expected to be in their local office or working onsite with clients at least three days per week. Office-based teams will identify at least one "anchor day" per week on which their full team will be together in person. The applicable base salary range for this role is $85,400 to $170,900. The base pay offered will be determined on factors such as experience, skills, training, location, certifications, education, and any applicable minimum wage requirements. Decisions will be determined on a case-by-case basis. In addition to the base salary, this position may be eligible for performance-based incentives. We are excited to offer a competitive total rewards package which includes health and welfare benefits, tuition assistance, 401K savings and other retirement programs as well as employee assistance programs.
summary: Guy Carpenter seeks a Senior Business Analyst to translate business strategies into requirements, document processes, and ensure system testing meets needs. This role involves collaborating with technical and non-technical teams, utilizing Agile methodologies, and conducting feasibility studies. Candidates need 7+ years of IT experience, deep understanding of reinsurance operations, strong communication skills, and practical Agile experience. Experience with MERN tech stack, compliance regulations, and Microsoft Azure DevOps is valued.

title: BSA Analyst II
description: Brief Description Join Our Team For 70 years, Teachers Federal Credit Union has been committed to guiding members toward building a strong financial foundation today for a better tomorrow. Named one of America's Best-In-State Credit Unions by Forbes Magazine in 2022, Teachers has grown into one of the leading credit unions in the United States. As we broaden our national reach, we will continue to ensure that Teachers is a Best Place to Bank and a Best Place to Work. Teachers offers a variety of exciting career opportunities ranging from part-time and full-time staffers to executive leadership roles. Summary The BSA Analyst II is responsible for supporting key functions of the BSA/AML & OFAC compliance, including BSA/AML transaction monitoring, AML case investigations, AML and OFAC alerts clearing, SAR writing and filing, CTR processing, and other compliance program functions. Education And/or Experience Bachelor’s degree or a minimum of eight years directly related experience required Minimum three years of BSA/AML experience required, with experience reviewing AML & OFAC alerts, investigating cases, and developing recommendations Working knowledge of the Bank Secrecy Act, the USA Patriot Act, Office of Foreign Asset required Financial crimes certifications or able to complete certification within first year of employment (e.g., ACAMS, CAFP, ACSS, etc.) Excel, Word, PowerPoint and project-related tools (SmartSheet) Verafin preferred Core customer information system experience (Fiserv/DNA) preferred WirExchange experience preferred Job Duties Conducts complex case and Continuing Activity Reviews, completing Suspicious Activity Reports and presenting at SAR Committee for discussion. Compiles information and statistics for report use Supports the process to prepare, review and submit Currency Transaction Reports (CTRs) within required timeframes, including performing secondary reviews to ensure completeness, accuracy and timely submission. Escalates potentially unusual or suspicious activity, or potential OFAC/sanctions issues Provides subject matter expertise and guidance to business and operations teams on BSA/AML and OFAC policies and procedures Monitors accounts and researches complex transactions for indicators of unusual or suspicious activity Leverages understanding of suspicious activity scenarios and automated alert and case management systems to complete alert and case investigation Participates in SAR Committee discussions and prepares SAR narratives for filing Supports quality assurance activities, including remediating identified gaps, developing training and guidance, and other actions as needed to improve quality of alert and case products. Researches, resolves and conducts AML investigations on alerts Reviews OFAC alerts and cases, applying understanding of sanctions regulations and reporting requirements, and escalating for action Supports compliance with 314(a) and 314(b) (PATRIOT Act) information sharing responsibilities and responds to subpoena and law enforcement inquiries Supports reviews of customer accounts to comply with CDD/EDD program requirements Identifies and reports on changing trends in anti-money laundering, staying informed on industry best practices, emerging risks, and changes to applicable BSA/AML and banking regulations. Performs other duties as assigned Benefits Of Joining The Teachers Team We provide a competitive compensation and benefits package that includes, but is not limited to: Paid time off for vacation, personal days, and holidays Fully-funded pension plan 401(k) company contribution Teachers pays 100% of Dental & Vision premium Tuition reimbursement is offered to full-time employees Exclusive employee discount of 0.96% APR on credit card loans and a 1.00% APR on all other loans through Teachers Flexible hybrid schedule for eligible positions The good faith range for this position is $30.77 - $36.92 an hour This range is an estimate, based on potential employee qualifications and operational needs. The salary may vary above and below the stated amounts, as permitted by applicable law. All candidates will be subject to a background check, credit check, and drug test to determine employment eligibility. To learn more about Teachers and to view a full list of our job opportunities please visit https://www.teachersfcu.org/about/careers Click here to view: California Privacy Notice

title: Corporate Development and Strategy Senior Analyst -M&A/Strategy
description: The Opportunity: This position will be an integral component of ACA’s work on Corporate Development/M&A activities, Strategic Planning, and other initiatives. The position will play a role in the development of ACA’s business case evaluation models, perform analyses of industry/business sector information, contribute to the execution of the firm’s overall M&A strategy and assist in managing due diligence of acquisitions. The position will be part of a small team focused on high profile and high impact projects within the organization with significant visibility to senior management of the company, including the Chief Executive Officer, Chief Financial Officer, and the Chief Strategy Officer/Head of Corporate Development. What you’ll do: Develop and own detailed company valuations and financial models. Conduct thorough transaction analysis, including M&A transaction due diligence. Direct third-party advisors and coordinate other key logistics elements of M&A transaction processing. Draft and create investment review materials for presentation to senior management, private equity sponsor and board of directors. Exhibit high quality presentation skills and an ability to work cross functionally with a broad range of professionals within the organization. Assist in research to help build business cases for acquisition proposals. Review market trends and help determine implications for ACA based on comprehensive research and data analysis. Contribute to assessments through analysis and documentation of findings. Support the development of business cases to evaluate growth opportunities and the development of key materials to communicate opportunity within the organization. Assist in due diligence and integration planning and management. Conduct preliminary research on targets and present them to senior team members. Work with teams of professionals across ACA business lines to drive strategic initiatives and coordinate internal due diligence efforts on M&A activities. Complete ad hoc projects and other tasks and duties related to broader Strategy and Corp Dev initiatives, including, among other things, preparation of materials related to board of directors’ meetings and internal senior management meetings. To qualify for the role, you must have: A bachelor’s degree (Business or Finance preferred but not required) Minimum of 2 to 3 years of experience in Corporate Strategy, Corporate Finance, M&A, Consulting, or a fast-paced project management role Knowledge of financial services, investment management, and/or Governance, Risk, and Compliance (“GRC”) verticals preferred but not required Ability to work in person in NYC office minimum 2-3 days per week Skills and attributes for success: Strong organizational and project management skills Advanced proficiency in Excel and PowerPoint Previous experience with financial statements, principles, and valuation techniques with minimal guidance required on financial concepts. Experience with financial modeling and business case analysis, including market sizing analysis. Excellent analytical skills and attention to detail Ability to prioritize and meet multiple deadlines. Strong communication skills (written and verbal) Excellent judgment and initiative Proven ability to work in a fast-paced environment and ability to prioritize and meet multiple deadlines Self-starter with the ability to work under limited supervision What working at ACA offers: We offer a competitive compensation package where you’ll be rewarded based on your performance and recognized for the value you bring to our business. Our Total Rewards package includes medical and dental coverage and 401(k) plans, and a wide range of paid time off options as well as a flexible work environment. You’ll also be granted time off for designated ACA Paid Holidays, Summer Fridays, Personal/Family Care, and other leaves of absence when needed to support your physical, financial, and emotional well-being. We also offer unique benefits such as Student Debt Forgiveness and Pet Insurance. About ACA: ACA Group is the leading governance, risk, and compliance (GRC) advisor in financial services. We empower our clients to reimagine GRC and protect and grow their business. Our innovative approach integrates consulting, managed services, and our ComplianceAlpha® technology platform with the specialized expertise of former regulators and practitioners and our deep understanding of the global regulatory landscape. What we commit to: ACA is firmly committed to a policy of nondiscrimination, which applies to recruiting, hiring, placement, promotions, training, discipline, terminations, layoffs, transfers, leaves of absence, compensation and all other terms and conditions of employment. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability or protected veteran status, or any other legally protected basis, in accordance with applicable law. Salary Range: $100,000.-$125,000.
summary: ACA Group, a leading GRC advisor in financial services, seeks a Corporate Development Analyst to contribute to their M&A activities, strategic planning, and other initiatives. This individual will develop valuation models, analyze industry data, support due diligence efforts, and present investment recommendations to senior management. Strong analytical and communication skills, proficiency in Excel and PowerPoint, and experience in financial modeling and business case analysis are essential.  The role offers a competitive compensation package, benefits, and a flexible work environment.

title: Strategy Analytics - Senior Analyst - C12/AVP
description: Job Description Citi’s Strategic Risk team is charged with identifying, measuring, and monitoring external and internal threats that could have a sustained impact on earnings or capital. It also provides competitive analysis on Citi’s performance relative to peers to the Board and other senior stakeholders. The team works in close partnership with the broader Group Strategy team, business heads, and senior leadership to identify issues of strategic importance and develop plans to mitigate associated risks. The team sits within the Finance organization. The Strategy Assistant Vice President (AVP) typically has 5-8 years of experience in Consulting or Financial Services; often coming from internal or external undergraduate analyst programs, or from external management consultancies. Strategy AVPs are core contributors and work collaboratively with other team members to deliver work products often under tight deadlines. Successful candidates work well in a highly collaborative environment and have strong problem-solving skills, with the ability to communicate key findings to senior leaders. Responsibilities: Gain a deep understanding of Citi’s global businesses and internal functions through exposure to a variety of topics in a fast-paced environment with challenging, multi-faceted assignments. Develop a strong understanding of market dynamics, regulatory developments, emerging trends, and their implications for the industry. Coordinate the conduct of key risk routines including the risk assessment of plan, review of business performance indicators, and risk appetite limits. Ensure appropriate governance controls are in place to support the strategic risk book of work. Perform analysis of financial institutions’ quarterly earnings and identify trends. Conduct in-depth research and perform deep dives on specific businesses to evaluate potential strategic weaknesses. . Develop working relationships with executives in business units, support functions and senior leadership. Structure and develop presentations for senior management and Citigroup Board of Directors, framing issues and synthesizing key findings of team analyses and recommendations. Improve problem solving, modeling, communications, and leadership skills in an environment of active mentorship and coaching. Perform other duties and functions as assigned. Qualifications: 5-8 years experience. History of academic and professional excellence and achievement. High degree of flexibility and productivity; initiative and creativity. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills and ability to work in a team. Highly motivated and self-driven, ability to multi-task productively and result orientation. Has the ability to independently own work and operate with a limited level of direct supervision. Excellent problem solving and quantitative analytical skills. Proficient with Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint Ability to synthesize large data sets and convey a clear story supported by findings. Knowledge of operational/financial modeling (forecasting, valuation) and ability to analyze financial statements. Education: Bachelor’s/University degree or equivalent experience ------------------------------------------------------ Job Family Group: Business Strategy, Management & Administration ------------------------------------------------------ Job Family: Strategy & Development ------------------------------------------------------ Time Type: Full time ------------------------------------------------------ Primary Location: New York New York United States ------------------------------------------------------ Primary Location Full Time Salary Range: $109,120.00 - $163,680.00 In addition to salary, Citi’s offerings may also include, for eligible employees, discretionary and formulaic incentive and retention awards. Citi offers competitive employee benefits, including: medical, dental & vision coverage; 401(k); life, accident, and disability insurance; and wellness programs. Citi also offers paid time off packages, including planned time off (vacation), unplanned time off (sick leave), and paid holidays. For additional information regarding Citi employee benefits, please visit citibenefits.com. Available offerings may vary by jurisdiction, job level, and date of hire. ------------------------------------------------------ Anticipated Posting Close Date: Jul 31, 2024 ------------------------------------------------------ Citi is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. Citigroup Inc. and its subsidiaries ("Citi”) invite all qualified interested applicants to apply for career opportunities. summary: Citi's Strategic Risk team seeks a Strategy Assistant Vice President (AVP) with 5-8 years of experience in Consulting or Financial Services. The role involves identifying, measuring, and monitoring internal and external threats to Citi's earnings and capital, conducting competitive analysis, and developing risk mitigation plans. The AVP will collaborate with various teams, analyze financial data, perform research, and present findings to senior management and the Board. Excellent communication, problem-solving, and quantitative analytical skills are essential.

title: Senior Strategic Planning Analyst
description: ITT, headquartered in Stamford, CT, operates competitively in 35 countries with demanding sales in 125 countries around the globe. ITT partners with engaged customers to deliver enduring solutions to the vital industries that continuously advance our modern way of life. ITT employees thrive in an inviting and professional company culture. ITT offers an extremely competitive benefits program. Our employees are provided medical and dental coverage, 401K savings plan, life insurance protection, sickness and accident income protection, a generous vacation and holiday program, a tuition reimbursement program, and a program that allows you to use tax-free dollars to pay for many health care and dependent care expenses. Summary The role will be a key contributor to our global strategy and M&A team. Support the creation and execution of ITT’s long term strategic vision with a focus on market data analytics. This role is responsible for creating tools and managing large data sets from internal and external market data, to create actional insights for our strategic planning process and support our product / business development teams. Additional responsibilities include supporting the planning and execution of key internal strategic initiatives and business cases. This role will also be involved in mergers and acquisitions by supporting valuations with market assessments, building the strategic rationale and supporting due diligence activities on active deals. Essential Responsibilities Market Data Analytics: Develop digital tools and processes for analysis of internal market and product data. Extract and manage large data sets. Create quarterly market analysis reports utilizing external market research and internal data to develop actional insights for our market and product teams. Provide market assumptions and support to product managers for business cases. Perform internal analysis of sales quotation funnels, market opportunities and orders / sales trends. Strategic Planning: Analyze and research industry trends, market conditions, customers, and competitors to identify threats and opportunities. Understand and shape the company’s strategy and mission. Provide underlying market analyses to build market sizes (SAMs and TAMs) and growth rates for core markets, products and strategic initiatives. Analyze market data and translate findings into meaningful, actionable insights and recommendations. Create business plans for key strategic initiatives, including market attractiveness analyses. Strategic Plan Communication: Support annual strategic planning process for recommendations to ITT Leadership and Board of Directors to support effective decision-making. Internally communicate strategic direction and priorities to all internal stakeholders. M&A / Business Development: Create market analysis for targets and support development of valuation models. Prepare strategic presentations for senior leadership to evaluate potential deals. Support due diligence efforts for active M&A transactions. Position Requirements Education: BS in Marketing, Business or Engineering Experience: 2-4 years of work experience in marketing, strategy or consulting Strong working with databases and implementing new business intelligence dashboards, digital tools, and analytics Professional experience in using one or more of the following analytical tools (Power BI, SAS, SQL, R, or Python) will be a plus Demonstrated market research capabilities and analysis, including sizing market opportunities (total available market vs service available market) Apply analytical skills to extract and manipulate large data sets Excellent verbal and written communication skills to simplify complex information for decision making Strategic mindset with experience in market sizing and analysis Self-motivated / directed, and can easily function in a high-demand, high-performance culture Ability to work cross-functionally to support key internal stakeholders in supporting analysis Safety is a core value at ITT. Our employees understand and follow all ITT safety policies and procedures, participate in workplace inspections, safety training, and in the development of job safety analyses. This position requires use of information which is subject to the International Traffic in Arms Regulations (ITAR). All applicants must be U.S. persons within the meaning of ITAR. ITAR defines a U.S. person as a U.S. Citizen, U.S. Permanent Resident (i.e. 'Green Card Holder'), Political Asylee, or Refugee. “ITT Corporation is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran or disability status, or any other characteristic protected by law.” Equal Pay Act Statement We aim to pay our ‘ITT’ers’ fairly and competitively in the locations that they live and work. Pay-for-performance is a principle that we believe in, and employees are rewarded based not only on ‘what’ they accomplish, but also on ‘how’ they reflect ITT’s values. ITT offers a competitive salary and robust total rewards package, such as health insurance, 401(k), short and long-term disability, paid time off, growth and developmental opportunities, and other incentive compensation programs. Specific benefits are dependent upon whether or not the position is part of a collective-bargaining agreement. The salary offered to a candidate is based several factors such as candidate experience and qualifications, location, as well as market and business considerations. Equal Pay Act Range Annual Salary range between $90,000 - $140,600 includes benefits and incentive plans.
summary: This role supports ITT's global strategy and M&A team by analyzing market data, creating strategic insights, and supporting business development activities. The ideal candidate has experience with market research, data analysis, and strategic planning.
benefits: Health care and dependent care expense program

title: People Services Operations Analyst
description: The People Service Delivery (PSD) team’s mission is to run the best people-focused service delivery business in the industry. Leading with care and empathy, we develop efficient processes, systems, and programs. We aim to ensure employees feel heard and have the resources and support they need during the most important moments so they can do the best work of their careers. As part of PSD, the Service Delivery Excellence team improves the efficiency and effectiveness of operations by providing deep insight into operational performance, recommended actions to improve business outcomes, and reporting solutions to improve stakeholders’ self-sufficiency with data.The People Services Operations Analyst is responsible for providing business area leaders with deep insight into the status of their operations and where they can drive improvements in line with People Service Delivery’s near-term goals and long-term vision. People Services Operations Analyst Responsibilities: Establish and maintain PSD functional (e.g., onboarding, benefits) measurement strategies and tracking mechanisms Conduct routine analysis of functional trends to identify top gaps and improvement opportunities Apply advanced business analytics methods to identify the top issues impacting People Service Delivery operations, root causes, and opportunities Drive measurement plans for major initiatives to ensure they align to organizational goals and accurately reflect the results of those initiatives Manage ad hoc, complex, and short-turnaround reporting requests from PSD stakeholders and leaders Improve the quality of team-wide operational analysis (e.g., control charts) to improve insight and speed to action Ensure data integrity through aligned vendor and company measurement approaches and upstream processes that impact data (e.g., case management) Collaborate with technical cross functional partners, ensuring business requirements are prioritized and delivered within an expected timeframe Report on conclusions to business area leaders through live presentations, executive summaries, and self-serve dashboards/reports Consult with business area leaders on their measurement needs, timing requirements, and other expectations Produce high-quality presentations and deliverables using data visualization best practices Support data training programs that elevate the analytic skill of data users Minimum Qualifications: 6+ years experience in operations measurement and analytics functions 3+ years experience in a People/HR function Extensive data and analytical expertise, including knowledge of industry best practices and measurement standards Experience working with standard data analytics and reporting tools (e.g., Tableau) Experience working with Salesforce and Workday systems Experience working in a fast-paced environment while also building infrastructure that scales Effective communication, influencing, and change management skills Knowledge of the HR domain and core processes (e.g., benefits, payroll, onboarding, learning) Preferred Qualifications: Bachelor’s degree in business, operations, consulting, or equivalent Master’s degree in data analytics, data science, or equivalent Six Sigma or equivalent certification Experience with process mining systems (e.g., Celonis) and methodologies Experience on projects that use AI/ML for advanced data analysis Experience with Robotic Process Automation (RPA) and related process improvement methodologies About
