Project manage Product communications for brand field organization in collaboration with Global Retail team and Store Operations team Basic Qualifications Bachelorâ€™s degree in retail, business, finance, marketing or related fields Strong analytical and mathematical skills - able to extract conclusions from available data Self-starter who is willing to â€œroll up the sleevesâ€ to advance project work Able to use sound critical thinking to provide innovative solutions Strong time management & organizational skills Attention to detail Excellent verbal and written communication skills Microsoft Office Experience (Outlook, PowerPoint, Excel, Word) Advanced Excel Skills Knowledge of Retail Math and Planning, Buying and Merchandising principles 2+ yearsâ€™ work experience in retail planning, buying or merchandising Job Title/Job Description: Business Analyst - Location Planning Work Hours: 40 hours/week Brand: O & SGH AFE/Cost Center #: 110111 Location: NY (open to remote) Location should be listed on the top of the resume Start date: 3/4 or 3/11 Length of assignment: 4 months Years of Experience Needed: 1-3 Max Budgeted Bill Rate: *** Client requires last 7 years of employment verfication and minimum education required for all roles is High School dipoloma unleass specified in the job description.
summary: This is a 4-month temporary Business Analyst role with two rotations. The first rotation involves supporting day-to-day activities for CLIENT location planning, including inventory analysis, service level optimization, and communication with distribution centers. The second rotation focuses on supporting the SGH Assortment Execution team, collaborating with merchandising and store planning teams to maximize sales, margin, and customer satisfaction. The role requires strong analytical and communication skills, experience with retail planning and merchandising principles, and proficiency in Microsoft Office (especially Excel).

title: Senior Analyst, Marketing Science
description: About Annalect Annalect is the Data & Technology arm of Omnicom Media Group Annalect’s 2,000+ innovators leverage data and technology to help clients across Omnicom build relationships that matter — whether that means fostering consumers’ trust in brands, building new experiences, or delivering advanced analytics where it’s most needed. Annalect is the driving force behind Omni, Omnicom’s unique open operating system, which works hand-in-hand with clients’ and partners’ data and tools, to orchestrate better marketing outcomes. Annalect’s unique approach to data and technology – one that relies on transparency, neutrality, and interoperability – allows us to deliver purpose-built and scalable solutions that make data actionable. Our advanced teams of product leaders, data scientists, consultants, and engineers enable us to meet the business goals of our internal and external clients. Team Overview Marketing Science is focused primarily on Marketing Mix Modelling and Multi-touch attribution. Marketing Science teams manage data processing (primarily in SQL, R scripting, Python, Excel, and PowerPoint), data exploration and the statistical analysis of media data. Marketing Science team members handle client’s requests, work closely with internal cross-agency teams to support their needs, collect data from clients, clean and organize that data, and create statistical models, and build presentations highlighting key results, recommendations, and takeaways. Key Responsibilities Builds out an analytics pipeline to support mid- and post-media campaign analysis Performs exploratory and explanatory data analysis to understand ingested data Independently Performs ad-hoc quantitative analyses at the client’s request and manages Develops multi-source attribution models Process and clean data (SQL, Excel, Python/R) Use and contribute to existing code base (Python, R, VBA) Assists with presenting actionable insights to clients and client agency teams Development of presentations to clients, including the results of attribution and modelling projects in a clear and insightful narrative, digestible by a lay person Provide guidance and learning opportunities to a team of analysts working on disaggregated analyses Work closely with internal stakeholders such as media activation, marketing intelligence, and media buying teams Required Skills And Qualifications Bachelor’s degree in statistics, mathematics, economics, engineering, information management, social sciences or business/marketing related fields. 2 to 4 years of experience in a quantitative data driven field, media, or other relevant field Strong knowledge with SQL; advanced user of R/Python Strong MS Office skills such as Excel and PowerPoint Experience with delivering and operationalizing reporting solutions for clients Excellent communication skills are a must Preferred Understanding of marketing mix modeling/econometric analysis and/or other branches of market research (custom survey research, advertising testing or tracking, new product research, etc.) Prior in-depth experience with multi-touch attribution is preferred Some experience in client facing duties. Previous experience in frequent conversing / presenting analytical insights with clients is highly preferred Familiarity of machine learning techniques such as clustering, classification, and regression Comfortable working in a highly dynamic and agile environment Experience with data visualization platforms (Qlikview, Plotly, SAS, Tableau, etc.) Prior agency experience Basic understanding of databases and Data Modeling Perks Of Working At Annalect Culture! We have an incredibly fun, collaborative environment that encourages engagement and work/life balance Generous PTO that includes vacation days, personal days, a fantastic Summer Friday program and extended time off around the holiday season. As part of Omnicom, we have the backing and resources of a global billion-dollar company, but also have the flexibility and pace of a “startup” - we move fast, break things, and innovate. This is the pay range the Company believes it will pay for this position at the time of this posting. Consistent with applicable law, compensation will be determined based on relevant experience, other job-related qualifications/skills, and geographic location (to account for comparative cost of living). The Company reserves the right to modify this pay range at any time. For this role, benefits include: health insurance, vision insurance, dental insurance, 401(k), Healthcare Flexible Spending Account, Dependent Care Flexible Spending Account, vacation days, sick days, personal days, paid parental leave, paid medical leave, and STD/LTD insurance benefits. Compensation Range $50,000—$90,000 USD Annalect, a division of Omnicom Media Group is An Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or veteran status, age or any other federally protected class. Review Our Recruitment Privacy Notice
summary: Annalect, Omnicom Media Group's data & tech arm, seeks a Marketing Science Analyst to build and manage analytics pipelines for media campaign analysis. This role involves exploratory data analysis, ad-hoc quantitative analyses, multi-source attribution modeling, data processing, and client presentation. The ideal candidate has 2-4 years of experience in a quantitative field, strong SQL and R/Python skills, and excellent communication skills.

title: Senior Analyst - Corporate Card Loyalty  & Benefits Marketing Operations
description: You Lead the Way. We’ve Got Your Back. With the right backing, people and businesses have the power to progress in incredible ways. When you join Team Amex, you become part of a global and diverse community of colleagues with an unwavering commitment to back our customers, communities and each other. Here, you’ll learn and grow as we help you create a career journey that’s unique and meaningful to you with benefits, programs, and flexibility that support you personally and professionally. At American Express, you’ll be recognized for your contributions, leadership, and impact—every colleague has the opportunity to share in the company’s success. Together, we’ll win as a team, striving to uphold our company values and powerful backing promise to provide the world’s best customer experience every day. And we’ll do it with the utmost integrity, and in an environment where everyone is seen, heard and feels like they belong. Join Team Amex and let's lead the way together. Global Commercial Services (GCS) is the global leader in payment solutions for Small, Medium (SME) and Global and Large (G&L) enterprises. The Corporate Solutions team within Global Commercial Products is responsible for developing and managing a suite of corporate payment and spend enablement solutions uniquely differentiated through innovative benefits, features and partnerships underpinned by seamless digital experiences. As the corporate payments ecosystem rapidly evolves, we are committed to maintaining our leadership position. As such, we created a new Corporate Program Product Management organization to bring together all core corporate payment products including corporate cards, central billing solutions (BTA), and virtual cards. The team will spearhead the creation of best-in-class payment experiences and capabilities meeting the evolving needs of G&L and US MM customers. The Senior Analyst, Corporate Card Membership Rewards and Benefits will champion product and marketing operations across the Membership Rewards and Benefits programs within US Corporate Card portfolio’s Platinum, Gold, and Green cards. In this role, the individual will be supporting product operations such as decommissioning aspects of the Membership Rewards program and Benefits program and onboarding net new product functionality. Responsibilities also include marketing operations such as managing marketing blocks, conducting annual reviews of marketing collateral for internal and external partners and clients, and assisting in executing marketing campaigns to drive Membership Rewards and Benefits enrollments and engagement. This individual will work closely with external agency partners and internal marketing teams to build on our product vision and collaborate to identify impactful marketing messaging. This role will work cross functionally with several groups across American Express including GCS Marketing, US Consumer MR COE, Account Development, Finance, and more. How will you make an impact in this role? Responsibilities: Support Corporate Card MR and Benefits marketing efforts, partnering with product and marketing teams, managing creative agencies, managing the marketing review process, and maintaining team assets Support development and execution of communications to customers, internal partners and sales teams Champion product decommissions and onboarding for Corporate Card Membership Rewards and Benefits Partner with cross-functional teams on Corporate Card Membership Rewards and Benefits program enhancements and strategic projects to grow Membership Rewards and Benefits enrollments Works closely with Consumer and Small Business and Loyalty teams, identifying opportunities to coordinate marketing strategies Minimum Qualifications: Ability to operate independently and proactively; taking initiative and demonstrating resilience in the face of challenges Excellent relationship building skills, a strong collaborator with ability to work well across multiple partners and projects Highly organized, with exceptional prioritization and time management skills Strong attention to detail and commitment to excellence A customer-first mindset and passion for serving commercial customers Exceptional verbal and written communications skills Bachelor's degree Preferred Qualifications: Marketing operations and/or product management experience Salary Range: $55,000.00 to $105,000.00 annually + bonus + benefits The above represents the expected salary range for this job requisition. Ultimately, in determining your pay, we’ll consider your location, experience, and other job-related factors. We back our colleagues and their loved ones with benefits and programs that support their holistic well-being. That means we prioritize their physical, financial, and mental health through each stage of life. Benefits include: Competitive base salaries Bonus incentives 6% Company Match on retirement savings plan Free financial coaching and financial well-being support Comprehensive medical, dental, vision, life insurance, and disability benefits Flexible working model with hybrid, onsite or virtual arrangements depending on role and business need 20+ weeks paid parental leave for all parents, regardless of gender, offered for pregnancy, adoption or surrogacy Free access to global on-site wellness centers staffed with nurses and doctors (depending on location) Free and confidential counseling support through our Healthy Minds program Career development and training opportunities For a full list of Team Amex benefits, visit our Colleague Benefits Site. American Express is an equal opportunity employer and makes employment decisions without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran status, disability status, age, or any other status protected by law. We back our colleagues with the support they need to thrive, professionally and personally. That's why we have Amex Flex, our enterprise working model that provides greater flexibility to colleagues while ensuring we preserve the important aspects of our unique in-person culture. Depending on role and business needs, colleagues will either work onsite, in a hybrid model (combination of in-office and virtual days) or fully virtually. US Job Seekers/Employees - Click here to view the “Know Your Rights” poster and the Pay Transparency Policy Statement. If the links do not work, please copy and paste the following URLs in a new browser window: https://www.dol.gov/agencies/ofccp/posters to access the three posters. Employment eligibility to work with American Express in the U.S. is required as the company will not pursue visa sponsorship for these positions.
summary: American Express is hiring a Senior Analyst for their Corporate Card Membership Rewards and Benefits program. This individual will be responsible for supporting product and marketing operations, including decommissions and onboarding, marketing collateral management, and campaign execution. The role will involve close collaboration with internal and external partners, including marketing teams, agencies, and cross-functional groups across Amex.  This role will focus on driving Membership Rewards and Benefits enrollment and engagement for Corporate Card portfolio's Platinum, Gold, and Green cards.
benefits: Retirement savings plan with 6% company match
Medical, dental, vision, life insurance, and disability benefits
Flexible working model (hybrid, onsite, or virtual)

title: Reporting Analyst - Bronx, NY
description: *This role is fully on-site at our Bronx, NY distribution center* Company Overview Led by dynamic owner Joe Gurrera (and his commitment to superior quality) Citarella has grown from a respected NYC fish market into a full-scale, Ultimate Gourmet Market with locations across New York City, the Hamptons, and Greenwich, Connecticut. A family-run business, we’re driven by a passion for great food. We delight customers with the finest selection of fresh seafood, prime, dry-aged beef, chef-prepared specialties and handcrafted pastries, international cheeses, imported groceries, and more. Join our team of seasoned professionals and become a part of the fabric of the New York food scene. Responsibilities & Duties The Reporting Business Analyst position is responsible for generating, creating, and analyzing reports for various financial statistics to provide management the tools and data for better decision making and accountability. S/he will be responsible for making business recommendations based on analysis that will result in overall cost savings, increased productivity, efficiency and/or revenue generation. Reporting to the Finance Team, the reporting analyst is responsible for updating, analyzing, and distributing all identified daily/weekly/monthly sales reports. Responsible for making business recommendations based on analysis that will result in overall cost savings. increased productivity, efficiency and/or revenue generation. Work with FP&A team to identify areas to analyze and build reports to improve business. Work with various stakeholders throughout the company to ensure financial tools are used consistently and properly. Generate and organize reports through various systems and databases to provide Managers and Executives data in a functioning format to make better decisions and to hold teams accountable Develop new reports to assist managers in highlighting areas of opportunity for better management and accountability Analyzing data and ensuring its accuracy throughout the company Constant communication with Warehouse/Store Management to generate reports based on the needs of the business Maintains and Oversees the Store Ordering Tool used by stores to place orders Forecast sales and movement to project business demands and determine changes that may need to be implemented Minimum Requirements Bachelor’s degree in Finance, Accounting, or a related field required A minimum of 1 - 2 years of accounting/financial experience Demonstrated decision-making ability and leadership skills Excellent verbal and written communication skills with the ability to influence others through data and logic Advanced Skills in Microsoft Excel (Pivot Tables, Macros, etc.) Knowledge of SageX3, Magento & SMS is a plus Experience utilizing SQL to problem solve is a plus Combined skill set of critical thinking and development Excellent interpersonal communication and organizational skills Able to work flexible work schedules to accommodate business level At Citarella, we value a diverse, inclusive workforce and we provide equal employment opportunity for all applicants and employees. All qualified applicants for employment will be considered without regard to an individual’s race, color, sex, gender identity, gender expression, religion, age, national origin or ancestry, citizenship, physical or mental disability, medical condition, family care status, marital status, domestic partner status, sexual orientation, genetic information, military or veteran status, or any other basis protected by federal, state or local laws. Citarella will reasonably accommodate qualified individuals with disabilities to the extent required by applicable law. EOE/M/F/V/D
summary: This position involves generating, analyzing, and distributing financial reports to support decision-making and improve efficiency within Citarella's grocery business. The Reporting Business Analyst will collaborate with the Finance Team and other stakeholders, identify areas for improvement, create reports using various systems and databases, and ensure data accuracy. The role requires strong analytical and communication skills, advanced Excel proficiency, and experience with specific software systems.

title: Communications Manager, IT Business Operations (20303)
description: Overview / Objective The Communications Manager of IT Business operations is the responsible for IT program and department operational communications and content. The NFL seeks an individual with experience creating and maintaining programs for successful, inspiring, and engaging content and communications that highlight the mission, goals, and work at all levels of the IT department. The ideal candidate is a skilled story weaver who can combine multiple threads across different topics and subjects to create a larger epic themes and stories. This individual also creates a formal program with tracking and reporting for IT executives for IT initiatives, themes, and stories. This individual is also responsible for IT resource tracking and reporting. This individual is creative and resourceful as well as an excellent listener. This role must be conducted with the utmost of integrity, trust, and discretion handling time and stakeholder sensitive information. As the IT lead for creating interactions and content to drive engagement, this individual takes a deliberate and thoughtful approach that is formal, consistent, and measured for continuous improvement. Responsibilities Establishes, manages, and implements a comprehensive and effective IT brand, stakeholder, and team engagement program in collaboration with the CIO and IT Leadership Primary author and editor of IT communications, policies, and content across all forms of media (presentations, written, visual, video) Assists IT leaders and team members in creating individual communications and campaigns Contributing author and editor of external IT communications in partnership with sponsorship Authors and develops content in collaboration with the CIO, IT Leadership and HR to build an engaging and rewarding IT team culture Develops storylines that emphasize NFL values, foster growth and improvement, motivate IT team members, deepen working relationship and celebrate successes and strengths Managing the on-boarding approval process for IT Contingent Workers Create monthly Resource Trending Report for distribution to CIO Creation of job descriptions for IT roles Write letters, interdepartmental memos, and other business correspondence Collaborate with NFL PR to manage, coordinate, and edit IT’s response press requests and releases Author and edit speeches and presentations for internal and external appearances by IT team members Manages the planning and operation of the calendar year of internal IT team events, IT leadership and town hall meetings under the Office of the CIO. Assists in the planning and implementation of strategic IT workshops with internal team members, stakeholders, partners, vendors, and Clubs. Works with the Office of the CIO leadership to implement and uses metrics to measure the impact of IT programs and communications Proactively researches, designs, proposes, and manages IT brand and knowledge sharing campaigns, including multi-year long-term programs. Required Qualifications 3+ years authoring and editing public or internal relations communications and content across written, presentations, visualizations, photo and video content 3+ years authoring technical documents and policies 3+ years planning and facilitating town hall style meetings and collaborative workshops 3+ years planning, creating, and executing team building and department values and culture content and events Skilled content author across written, visualizations (e.g., data, graph, charts), speeches, presentations, video scripts Skilled at establishing and maintaining internal and external business relationships Excellent knowledge of IT and Digital business practices, vocabulary, and terminology Excellent at authoring story lines and illustrations that tie technical work and accomplishments to corporate business objectives and outcomes Preferred Qualifications College degree or equivalent professional or military experience Confident host and public speaker Experienced creating workflow diagrams Experienced working with VIP external business partners, franchise owners and executives, sponsorship representatives Experienced technical business analyst Skilled in utilizing project, resource, and task management software Other Key Attributes / Characteristics High degree of communication skills; verbal and written Excellent at building and maintaining relationships with stakeholders across the organization Highly collaborative, plays to win and celebrate as team Flourishes in a high pressure, high stakes, high engagement workplace Professional who identifies with the NFL values of integrity, resilience, respect, responsibility to team, tradition and innovation Physical Demands N/A Travel As needed travel to NFL offices (NJ, LA) Infrequent travel to NFL events and partner meetings Terms / Expected Hours of Work FSLA Exempt NFL employees are required to work 40 hours per week. Salary / Pay Range This job posting contains a pay range, which represents the range of salaries or hourly rates that the NFL believes, in good faith, at the time of this posting that it might be willing to pay for the posted job in the location(s) specified. The NFL expects to hire for this position near the middle of the range. Only in truly rare and exceptional circumstances, where an external candidate has experience, credentials or expertise that far exceed those required or expected for the position, would the NFL consider paying a salary or rate near the higher end of the range. Salary $100,000 — $125,000 USD The NFL maintains a Flexible Workplace Policy that provides members of our workforce with opportunities to periodically work from a location of their choice while maintaining a priority on in-person work at an NFL office, which enables us to more effectively collaborate, connect, and build a workplace culture that will drive our continued success. The NFL is committed to building a diverse, equitable, and inclusive work environment that reflects our incredibly diverse fan base. We provide an environment of mutual respect where equal employment opportunities are available to all employees and applicants without regard to status as protected by applicable federal, state, or local law.
summary: The NFL is seeking a Communications Manager for IT Business Operations to manage internal and external communications for the IT department. This role involves creating and maintaining engaging content, tracking IT resources, and developing storylines that align with NFL values. The ideal candidate will have strong writing and presentation skills, experience in IT and digital business practices, and the ability to build relationships with stakeholders across the organization.

title: Junior Product Analyst - Paid Apprenticeship (New York, NY)
description: Job Description ATTENTION MILITARY AFFILIATED JOB SEEKERS - Our organization works with partner companies to source qualified talent for their open roles. The following position is available to Veterans, Transitioning Military, National Guard and Reserve Members, Military Spouses, Wounded Warriors, and their Caregivers . If you have the required skill set, education requirements, and experience, please click the submit button and follow the next steps. This is an apprenticeship Apprenticeship is an outstanding alternative to college. You get to develop industry skills, earn a competitive salary, and it's completely free! Qualification Digital Business Accelerator Duration 12 months Training provider Multiverse As a Multiverse apprentice you'll have access to awesome social events, extra training from great companies and your own personal coach who will support and guide you through your qualification. 8:00am-5:00pm Mon-Fri [Application Deadline, 7/19, 2pm EST] As a Junior Product Analyst on our Catalyst team, you’ll be an integral part of our lead management platform. Your role will involve supporting both product development and operational aspects. You’ll collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure seamless operations, enhance our CRM system, and optimize lead management processes. A typical day In this role, with training and coaching you can expect to: Product Support Assist in maintaining and improving our lead management platform, including the Sales platform and Partner platform. Collaborate with product management, developers, and designers to define product features and enhancements. Gather user feedback and analyze it to identify areas for improvement. Monitor product performance metrics and suggest improvements. Operations Support: Work closely with operations teams to streamline processes related to lead management. Support issue identification and planning efforts. Troubleshoot operational issues and provide timely solutions. Cross-Functional Collaboration: Participate in product reviews and contribute insights. Assist in creating presentations and reports related to product performance. Qualities of a Good Product Analyst A successful Product Analyst within our Catalyst team combines technical acumen with a passion for improving operational efficiency. You’ll play a vital role in shaping our lead management platform and ensuring its success. Auto req ID 418916BR Minimum Education Required High School/GED Job_Category Apprenticeship Additional Qualifications/Responsibilities You must have Either a High School Diploma, GED, or Associate Degree This is an in person role- must have existing commutable residence with expectation to work on-site in either the 1 Broadway NY or Berkeley Heights, NJ office. Must be legally authorized to work in the United States without the need for employer sponsorship, now or at any time in the future. Must participate in routine background and clearances Skills needed Problem solving, Teamwork, Organization Technical Skills: Basic Excel and Powerpoint skills; comfort with technology/digital native preferred. Analytical Skills: Ability to analyze data and draw actionable conclusions. Communication: Strong communication skills to collaborate with diverse teams. Adaptability: Thrive in a dynamic environment and adapt to changing priorities. Preferred experience: Relevant experience in product management or operations work. City* New York City State* New York Job Code Analyst_ _Analyst Affiliate Sponsor Fiserv
summary: This is an apprenticeship opportunity for a Junior Product Analyst to support both product development and operational aspects of a lead management platform. The role involves collaborating with cross-functional teams to ensure seamless operations, enhance the CRM system, and optimize lead management processes.

title: Performance Marketing Analyst - Partnerships
description: Performance Marketing Analyst - Partnerships Tech - Startup Hybrid | New York City | United States (U.S.) $90,000 - $100,000 Base + Benefits A disruptor in the tech space is looking to bring on a hands-on Performance Marketing Analyst - Partnerships to join their team to successfully lead campaign analytics, insights generation, and campaign reporting to meet business growth globally. THE ROLE: As a Performance Marketing Analyst - Partnerships you will work cross-functionally and lead the analysis of large amounts of 1st & 3rd-party data to generate key insights that enable senior leadership, thus driving digital optimization & business growth. You will be responsible for: Collecting/cleaning/analyzing substantial marketing & web data using Google Analytics & BigQuery (or SQL) Designing & executing A/B tests and analyzing/interpreting results; performing website tracking Performing statistical analysis & scripting using Python or R; developing dashboards in Tableau Extracting key insights from analyses & tests, and delivering data-driven recommendations YOUR SKILLS: Progressive commercial digital/marketing/web analytics experience in media, eCommerce, etc. Proficient in gathering, cleansing & analyzing website data in Google Analytics (i.e., GA360, GA4) Familiar with/ digital data platforms & tools (i.e., Adobe Analytics, Google Tag Manager, Salesforce) Well-versed in core advanced analytics data mining & scripting tools such as Python, R, and SQL Proficient in building customized dashboards using BI tools (i.e., Looker, Power BI, Qlik, Tableau) Proven commercial experience designing, executing, and analyzing statistical tests (i.e., A/B) Strong knowledge of media channels & concepts (i.e., Display, Paid Search, SEM, SEO, Social) Proven commercial experience extracting insights from web data (i.e., clickstream, website traffic) Well-versed in advanced analytics techniques (i.e., LTV, trend analysis, user journey analysis) Comfortable working cross-functionally with/ technical & non-technical teams; presenting to leaders Strong verbal/written communication, negotiation, and presentation skills across the business Bachelor's degree in Business, Computer Science, Economics, Engineering, Mathematics, Physics, Psychology, or related field; M.B.A. or M.S. preferred BENEFITS: As a Performance Marketing Analyst - Partnerships, you can make up to a $100,000 base salary (depending on your experience) along with a discretionary equity package. HOW TO APPLY: Please register your interest by submitting your resume to Oisin Ennis via the apply link on this page.
summary: This role involves analyzing marketing data, building dashboards, conducting A/B tests, and providing data-driven recommendations to support digital optimization and business growth.

title: Software Implementation Consultant
description: Software Implementation Consultant / Business Systems Analyst - Buffalo This is a hybrid (40% remote and 60% onsite) role in Buffalo, NY. To get the best candidate experience, please consider applying for a maximum of 3 applications within 12 months to ensure you are not duplicating efforts. Applicants must be authorized to work for any employer in the U.S. We are unable to sponsor or assume sponsorship responsibilities for employment visas at this time. About Odoo Odoo ERP system is enterprise resource planning software used company-wide for the management of business processes. Odoo provides seamlessly integrated functional business apps called Odoo apps that form an ERP solution. Our unique proposition of integrated apps that work seamlessly together allows users to automate and track everything they do. The open-source development model of Odoo has allowed us to leverage thousands of developers and business experts to build the world's largest ecosystem of fully integrated business apps. Odoo has become a global network with more than 12+ million users and partners in more than 120 countries, and we continue growing with 2000+ daily downloads. We are growing fast and need to hire faster. If you want to help people transform their businesses with software, join our Business Systems Analyst Team! About the job: We're looking for Business Implementation Analysts to work one-on-one with clients across the Americas and simplify their business processes with Odoo. This is an implementation project management role for someone excited to work at the intersection of software and business. You'll be trained to become a subject matter expert across Odoo's many diverse apps (there are over 50!). If you have a proactive, "get it done" adventurous spirit, this job is for you. Responsibilities: Be a full-cycle ERP Business System Analyst for the North American market, providing our clients with a top-notch end-user implementation experience. You will set up apps for existing clients and implement our software while instructing the end user in its usage. Manage client relationships while implementing Odoo SaaS solutions Analyze all aspects of clients' business operations to map their processes to Odoo's solutions Quantify the resources required for a task/project related to an Enterprise Resource Platform implementation Project manage ERP implementations to create systems used by clients who want a product they love. Integration involves Sales, CRM, E-commerce, supply chain, manufacturing, inventory, POS, accounting, and more Collaborate with Odoo's developers to execute clients' business requirements Collaborate with clients' implementation managers on User Acceptance Testing and End User Training Occasionally advise the sales team during pre-sale regarding complex implementations Work with clients to train their end users on the Odoo platform Must-Have: Bachelor's Degree preferred Excellent planning, mapping, and communication skills combined with client interaction, being able to make in-the-moment decisions based on new information constantly An affinity with the Information Technology world, you understand the use cases of ERP (Enterprise Resource Planning software) Passion for software Enthusiastic to learn Excellent communication and interpersonal skills Nice to Have: Experience in a SaaS or ERP company Available immediately 1-2 years experience in post-sales implementations Values: You are able to work in a fast-paced startup environment with a hands-on attitude. You are open-minded and can react to change with agility. You have an intrapreneur mindset and are not afraid to take appropriate initiatives. You are a quick and autonomous learner. You have a passion for software. You are approachable, honest, and a fun team player. Compensation and Perks: Healthcare, Dental, Vision, Life Insurance, Flexible Spending Account, Health Savings Account, 401K Matching, and Commuter Benefits PTO (Paid-time-off), paid sick days and paid holidays Employee Assistance Program: 3 X 1-hour telehealth calls with certified mental health professionals Evolve in a nice working atmosphere with a passionate, growing team! Snacks, fruit, and coffee/drinks on tap! Pre-tax commuter benefits such as parking and transit Company-sponsored events for groups of 6+ employees The estimated annual compensation range for this role is $55,000-$80,000. Please note that actual salaries may vary within, above, or below this range based on factors such as education, training, experience, professional achievement, business needs, and location.
summary: Odoo is seeking a Business Implementation Analyst to work with clients across the Americas to simplify their business processes using Odoo ERP software. This is a hybrid role (40% remote, 60% onsite) in Buffalo, NY. The analyst will be responsible for managing client relationships, implementing Odoo solutions, analyzing client business operations, project managing ERP implementations, collaborating with developers, and training end users on the platform. Experience in a SaaS or ERP company, as well as 1-2 years of experience in post-sales implementations, is preferred.

title: SAP Senior Business Systems Analyst, Publishing Operations, Penguin Random House (Open to Remote)
description: SAP Senior Business Systems Analyst, Publishing Operations, Penguin Random House (Open to Remote) Penguin Random House (PRH), the world’s largest trade book publisher, is seeking a Senior Business Systems Analyst to join the 9-member Publishing Operations Systems team, which supports the core processes used by PRH employees across all departments, including Managing Editorial, Production, Inventory, Marketing, Publicity, Design, Sales, IT, Customer Service, and Fulfillment. Penguin Random House is home to genre-defining children’s literature, from Dragons Love Tacos to The Phantom Tollbooth ; best-in-class storytellers including Margaret Atwood, Tommy Orange, Celeste Ng, and Jasmine Guillory; and culture-shaping works such as Becoming by Michelle Obama and Daisy Jones & the Six by Taylor Jenkins Reid. The role includes requirements gathering, data analysis, project management, user support, and documentation. This is a great opportunity for someone with SAP consulting experience who enjoys complex problem-solving. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in SAP MM, PP, and PS modules, SAP implementation and customization, and large data set manipulation. This is a business analyst position and does not require coding. We are looking for a candidate who can multitask, remain motivated and inquisitive, communicate clearly, and is an active collaborative team member . Please apply using our ATS system by August 5, 2024, and attach examples of SAP business requirements and SAP technical specifications, as well as your cover letter and resume ,for consideration . Before applying for any role at Penguin Random House, we recommend you review our applicant resources page and look over our open-to-remote guidelines on our FAQs page. The Role: Analyze business requirements and design solutions to improve business processes, particularly in the areas of SAP MM/PP/PS modules Gather and manipulate large data sets to derive insights and drive business decisions Effectively manage complex, multi-system projects, with diverse stakeholder groups Collaborate with stakeholders to ensure that business requirements are understood and solutions meet business needs Adapt to changing needs of the business Conduct functional and technical analysis, create system design documentation, and perform configuration changes in a highly customized SAP system Develop and execute test plans to ensure that solutions are thoroughly tested and meet functional and technical requirements Required Experience for Consideration: 7+ years of experience in business systems analysis or related fields 3+ years of SAP analyst experience required SAP MM/PP/PS is a plus The Essentials: Advanced Excel required (ability to build pivot tables, vlookups, create compound and complex formulas, data validation) Analytical, data-driven approach; logical thinker with ability to articulate meaningful conclusions found in the data Experience in designing and implementing solutions to optimize business processes Strong communication skills, with the ability to collaborate with stakeholders across different departments and levels of the organization Ability to effectively prioritize work across multiple projects, working with supervisor as needed Ability to thrive either while working independently or in a team environment The salary range for this position is $100K-125K. All positions are currently eligible for annual profit award or bonus, subject to Company results. Penguin Random House job postings include a good faith compensation range for each open position. The salary range listed is specific to each particular open position and takes into account various factors including the specifics of the individual role, and candidate's relevant experience and qualifications. Full-time employees are eligible for our comprehensive benefits program. Our range of benefits include, but are not limited to, Medical/Prescription drug insurance, Dental, Vision, Health Care/Dependent Care Flexible Spending Account, Health Savings Account, Pre-Tax and Roth 401(k), Short and Long-Term Disability Insurance, Life/AD&D Insurance, Commuter Benefits, Student Loan Repayment Program, Educational Assistance & generous paid time off. Penguin Random House is the leading adult and children's publishing house in North America, the United Kingdom and many other regions around the world. In publishing the best books in every genre and subject for all ages, we are committed to quality, excellence in execution, and innovation throughout the entire publishing process: editorial, design, marketing, publicity, sales, production, and distribution. Our vibrant and diverse international community of nearly 300 publishing brands and imprints include Ballantine Bantam Dell, Berkley, Clarkson Potter, Crown, DK, Doubleday, Dutton, Grosset & Dunlap, Little Golden Books, Knopf, Modern Library, Pantheon, Penguin Books, Penguin Press, Penguin Random House Audio, Penguin Young Readers, Portfolio, Puffin, Putnam, Random House, Random House Children's Books, Riverhead, Ten Speed Press, Viking, and Vintage, among others. More information can be found at http://www.penguinrandomhouse.com/. Penguin Random House values the array of talents and perspectives that a diverse workforce brings. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, national origin, religion, age, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, or protected veteran status. Company: Penguin Random House LLC Country: United States of America State/Region: New York City: New York Postal Code: 10019 Job ID: 272074 Date: Jul 8, 2024 Location: New York, NY, US, 10019 Nearest Major Market: Manhattan Nearest Secondary Market: New York City Job Segment: Book Publishing, Systems Analyst, SAP, Operations Manager, Data Analyst, Publishing, Technology, Operations, Data
summary: Penguin Random House is seeking a Senior Business Systems Analyst to join their Publishing Operations Systems team. This role involves analyzing business requirements, designing solutions, gathering and analyzing data, managing projects, and providing user support. The ideal candidate will have strong experience with SAP MM, PP, and PS modules, SAP implementation and customization, and large data set manipulation. This is a business analyst position and does not require coding. The salary range for this position is $100K-125K.

title: Senior Analyst, Capacity and Performance Management
description: Overview Job Purpose The New York Stock Exchange (an Intercontinental Exchange company) is seeking a results oriented, self-motivated individual to join the Technology Capacity and Performance Management (CPM) team in New York. This individual will be joining a team working in a cutting edge high throughput, low latency trading environment and responsible for the implementation and management of the application capacity and performance management framework for all NYSE Group subsidiaries. CPM engages with product teams to assess current capacity and planning capabilities, define monitoring data requirements and metrics, perform data collection and analysis, and monitor and forecast system performance and capacity. The successful candidate is required to demonstrate technical problem solving and communication skills, as well as the ability to comfortably multitask and work in a mission critical environment. Responsibilities Data Acquisition & Analysis Identify data requirements and metrics to support the monitoring and reporting of system capacity and performance. Onboard new tools and data sets and perform the requisite data transformations and analytics to support CPM monitoring and reporting. Use statistical analysis and modeling skills to monitor trends and model future capacity needs. Provide assistance with production investigations and resolution of technical issues and/or problems impacting business services or individual customers. Collaborate with technology leads to develop system changes designed to improve capacity and performance. Business Intelligence Dashboards & Reporting Establish and maintain dashboards and reports showing current and projected capacity and performance for all business services and applications. Develop customized reports for product teams to support service delivery and customer engagement. Knowledge And Experience Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or related field. 2-4 or more years of experience in Performance Engineering and Capacity Planning of highly available and scalable application infrastructures. Experience using databases and statistical modeling techniques to perform data analysis techniques. Experience with high level scripting languages (e.g. Python) to support data analysis and reporting. Experience with business intelligence or data visualization platforms (e.g. Tableau, Splunk). Understanding of network protocols such as TCP/IP and Multicast data flow . A team player with a passion for building a culture of innovation and flawless execution. Excellent communications skills Prior experience with high through-put and low latency systems, particularly High Frequency/Trading applications desirable. Experience using Grafana or Tableau or QuickSight for BI dashboards and visualization desirable. Schedule This role offers work from home flexibility of 1 day per week. Base Salary Range for New York Candidates The expected base salary for this role is between 106,000 - 203,500 USD. The base salary range does not include Intercontinental Exchange’s incentive compensation. While we provide this range as general guidance, at ICE we compensate employees based on the skillset and experience of the individual. Intercontinental Exchange, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin or ancestry, age, disability or veteran status, or other protected status.
summary: The New York Stock Exchange (NYSE) is seeking a results-oriented individual to join their Technology Capacity and Performance Management (CPM) team in New York.  The ideal candidate will have experience in performance engineering, capacity planning, data analysis, and scripting languages. This role involves working in a high-throughput, low-latency trading environment and managing application capacity and performance for NYSE Group subsidiaries.

title: Analyst or Sr. Analyst, Innovation Operations & Insights
description: New York is leading the nation in the fight on global climate change and the transition to a clean energy-powered economy. The Climate Leadership and Community Protection Act (Climate Act) has created the most aggressive climate change goals in the nation and requires an ambitious agenda that blends proven catalysts with innovative approaches while operating across a broader energy arena that is rapidly evolving. New York State Energy Research & Development Authority (NYSERDA) is a driving force in realizing this agenda. NYSERDA works with stakeholders that span residents, business owners, developers, community leaders, local government officials, universities, utilities, investors, entrepreneurs, and more, to develop, invest, and foster conditions that: Attract the private sector capital investment needed to expand New York’s clean energy economy. Overcome barriers to using clean energy at a large-scale in New York. Enable New York’s communities and residents to benefit equitably from energy efficiency and renewable energy. Job Overview The Analyst/Sr. Analyst is responsible for the collection, management, and analysis of data related to investments made by NYSERDA to advance innovation across NYS. The person will work closely with members of the Innovation Team, NYSERDA’s Performance Management Team, and Finance Team to ensure that NYSERDA remains on track with its investments to achieve specific goals and receives intended outcomes from its investments. Primary Responsibilities Essential functions and duties include but are not limited to: Manage program metrics collection from end-to-end and ensure data completeness, accuracy, and reasonableness: Develop and issue requests for data; manage workflows for timely intake; identify and implement solutions and tools to improve data quality; and develop and execute processes and procedures that result in increased staff and vendor compliance, quality assurance, and remedial actions. Perform rigorous data analysis necessary to support effective program delivery: Conduct data analyses required to improve program performance, increase impact, streamline customer, and partner interactions, reduce cycle times, and manage risks associated with program delivery. Effectively communicate findings, provide recommendations, and problem-solve with management and other relevant internal and external stakeholders. Collaborate with colleagues on analysis of financial data. Utilize analytical skills to aggregate financial information from a portfolio of ~200 projects to provide a wholistic (past, present, and future forecasted) understanding of the financial performance of the Innovation Team. Develop decision-useful dashboards and reports: Develop or meaningfully contribute to the development of dashboards and reporting. Lead conceptual design, IT implementation, and operation of tools and processes that enable business unit portfolio analysis and decision-making. Perform other responsibilities as assigned. Ability to demonstrate respect, equity and inclusive behavior and practices of a diverse workforce and community. Minimum Qualifications Analyst - Bachelor’s degree with 3 years’ experience, Senior Analyst – Bachelor’s degree with 8+ years’ experience Salary range for Analyst: $73,836-$102,189. Salary range for Sr. Analyst: $108,665-$137,319. Experience should be in an operations, business, or data-centric role, implementing process and operational improvements relevant to operations and performance management activities, with at least a portion of that time in a supervisory role. A bachelor’s degree from a wide variety of disciplines will be considered for this role including areas of study such as data science, engineering, business administration, accounting, etc. Awareness of relevant trends, developments, and reliable information sources for measurement of performance in the innovation sector. Experience and skill in performing business analyses, documenting requirements and specifications, and mapping processes. Experience with project management methods, processes, standards, and tools. Skill in managing multiple diverse activities simultaneously, delivering on commitments, and operating with speed, accuracy, and strong judgment. Ability to quickly identify and drive to the best possible solution when presented with a series of opportunities and constraints. Ability to be a self-starter and function well both independently and in teams. Excellent presentation and interpersonal skills that resonate with audiences of different backgrounds. Advanced software skills in Visio; ASANA; and Oracle is encouraged. Preferred Qualifications Master’s degree with 5 years experience A Master's degree from a wide variety of disciplines will be considered for this role including areas of study such as data science, engineering, business administration, accounting, etc. Software skills in Microsoft suite, especially Excel and SharePoint, Salesforce, and Tableau Please submit two files, one for your cover letter and another for a resume. [IND123]
summary: NYSERDA is seeking an Analyst/Sr. Analyst to manage data related to investments in clean energy innovation. The role involves data collection, analysis, reporting, and collaborating with stakeholders to ensure program effectiveness and impact. This position requires strong analytical skills, experience with data management and analysis, and project management, and the ability to communicate findings effectively.

title: 2025 Innovation Development Summer Analyst Program
description: Job Description 2025 Innovation Development Summer Analyst Program Innovation Development Summer Analyst Program As a 2025 Innovation Development Summer Analyst within the Innovation Development Program (IDP), you will be part of a collaborative, supportive, and inclusive team. You will have the opportunity to work across various core disciplines such as project-based strategy, transformation & execution, product management, process and change management, and data, technology & systems. Your role will involve strategic thinking, quantitative analysis, and communication with key stakeholders. You will also gain a deep understanding of our business and products while leveraging an innovation mindset to design client experiences and solutions. As a 2025 Innovation Development Summer Analyst You’ll Be Placed On a High-impact Team For The Summer, Where You’ll Work Across One Or More Core Disciplines Project-based strategy: Develop recommendations to improve the bank’s operational and financial performance Transformation & execution: Design new customer value propositions and help deliver a best-in-class client experience Product management: Support the build, launch, and delivery of products to solve customer challenges Process and change management: Re-engineer critical processes and help lead key organizational and change initiatives Data, technology & systems: Leverage data and platforms to drive decision-making and improve business architecture Job Responsibilities While day-to-day activities will vary based upon your team, you can expect to take on a combination of mission-critical responsibilities, including: Combining strategic thinking and quantitative analysis to answer business questions Presenting and communicating findings to key stakeholders Building a deep knowledge of our business and products Leveraging an innovation mindset to design client experiences and solutions Locations we hire for: Chicago New York City Palo Alto Plano Required Qualifications, Capabilities And Skills Fluency in English Bachelors or Masters Degree Expected Graduation Date of December 2025 - June 2026 Enrolled, in good standing, at an accredited university in the US Preferred Qualifications, Capabilities And Skills Attention to detail Eagerness to learn and develop Strong collaboration skills Ability to think critically and analyze data Basic understanding of financial services Strong verbal and written communication About The Process To be considered for the Commercial Banking Summer Analyst Programs, you must complete the following steps: Complete this application including program preference and city preference Make sure your program and city preferences align as noted in the descriptions above If you meet the minimum criteria for the Summer Analyst Program application, you will receive an invitation to complete HireVue. Note, applications will be reviewed on a rolling basis, we strongly encourage you to complete your HireVue video(s) within 1 week of receiving. If selected, our team will reach out to you with additional details. title: Product Analyst II
description: We are Farmers! We are... more than just your favorite commercials. At Farmers, we strive to deliver peace of mind to our customers by providing protection and comprehensive advice and delivering in the moments of truth. That means having people who can help us meet changing customer and business needs. Farmers high-performance culture is focused on results and the people who achieve them. We hold ourselves and others accountable for sustainably growing the business and each other. We seek solutions, own our actions, and grow through discomfort. We see setbacks as opportunities while continuously asking ourselves how we impact our customers. Farmers is an award winning, equal opportunity employer, committed to the strength of a diverse workforce. We are dedicated to supporting the well-being of our people through our extensive suite of benefits, as well as the well-being of the communities we serve through employee volunteer programs and nonprofit partnerships. Helping others in their time of need isn't just our business - it's our culture! To learn more about our high-performance culture and open opportunities, check out www.Farmers.com/careers/corporate and be sure to follow us on Instagram, LinkedIn, and TikTok. Position Overview The Product Analyst II role will report up to a Product Manager and serve as an analyst for the different products, supporting the California team with analysis needs as a whole. The primary function of the role would be to provide data analysis support for the California initiatives, as well as peer review support. The role requires analyzing information using data manipulation, correlation, and basic statistical analysis. Additional responsibilities will be to modify computer programs to extract information on customers, policy, and segments. Job Summary Responsible for obtaining and evaluating information that supports revenue growth and profitability. Analyzes information using data correlation, and basic statistical analysis. Essential Job Functions Analyzes information using data manipulation, correlation, and basic statistical analysis. Modifies computer programs to extract information from company databases. Prepares state indications and other analyses of loss experience, retention, and expense data. Responsible for development of data and information structure. Performs primary field research, including customer, distribution, competitor, insurance department, and market surveys. Identifies market segments and develops specialized pricing approaches. Measures and monitors performance of states, initiatives, and identified segments Facilitates through other parts of the organization to accomplish results. Performs other duties as assigned. Education Requirements High school diploma or equivalent required. Bachelor's degree preferred. Experience Requirements 2 years of related experience or 1.5 years in Product Analyst I role. Property and casualty industry experience preferred. Special Skill Requirement Intermediate skills with Python, SQL, Excel preferred. Beginner level SAP and PowerBI preferred. Proficient PC Skills, including word processing, spreadsheets and databases. Excellent verbal/written communication skills Physical Actions Required job duties are essentially sedentary work consisting of occasional walking, standing, and lifting and/or carrying 10 lbs maximum, and seeing. Physical Environment Required job duties are normally performed in a climate- controlled office environment. Benefits Farmers offers a competitive salary commensurate with experience, qualifications and location. CA Only: $73,360 - $100,870 Bonus Opportunity (based on Company and Individual Performance) 401(k) Medical Dental Vision Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts Life Insurance Paid Time Off Paid Parental Leave Tuition Assistance For more information, review "What we offer" on https://www.farmers.com/careers/corporate/#offer Job Location(s): Remote or Hybrid Farmers believes in a culture of collaboration, creativity, and innovation, which thrives when we have the ability to work flexibly in a virtual setting as well as the opportunity to be together in person. Our hybrid work environment combines the best of both worlds with at least three (3) days in office and up to two (2) days virtual for employees who live within fifty (50) miles of a Farmers corporate office. Applicants beyond fifty (50) miles may still be considered. Anticipated application deadline: 7/9/24 - At Farmers, the recruitment process is designed to ensure that we find the best talent to join our team. As part of this process, we typically close open positions within 8 to 21 days after posting. If you are interested in any of our open positions, we encourage you to submit your application promptly. Want to learn more about our culture & opportunities? Check out www.Farmers.com/careers/corporate and be sure to follow us on Instagram, LinkedIn, and TikTok.
summary: The Product Analyst II role at Farmers Insurance focuses on data analysis to support revenue growth and profitability. Responsibilities include analyzing data using SQL, Python, Excel, and other tools, developing data structures, identifying market segments, and measuring performance of initiatives. The role requires 2+ years of experience in a related field and experience with P&C insurance preferred. The role can be remote or hybrid with a minimum of 3 days per week in office for those within 50 miles of a Farmers corporate office.

title: Quantitative Analyst -  In-Business Risk Team - VP, New York
description: MQA In-Business Risk Team The front office Market Quantitative Analysis (MQA) team is looking for a quantitative analyst to support the front office In-Business Risk team, working along with the trading and XVA desks in managing their market risk metrics and capital. Responsibilities: Some key responsibilities include: Build analytical tools and applications for the business and traders’ use to assess market risk, stress loss and capital metrics, and to develop efficient portfolio level hedge strategies. Perform in-depth diagnosis of the current market risk and capital models and processes, partner with the business and other quant teams to propose and drive enhancement. Partner with traders, provide cost-benefit analysis to help on business prioritization, guidance and direction. Liaise with asset class quant teams to improve existing pricing models, to align with regulatory requirement and strengthen the process used for calculating risk metrics and valuation. Develop well-structured high-quality code and contribute to contribute to large-scale in-house python and C++ analytics libraries. Stay attuned to recent AI/ML advances, harnessing their power to bolster business support and analysis. Appropriately assess risk/reward of transactions when making business decisions; and ensure that all team members understand the need to do the same, demonstrating proper consideration for the firm’s reputation. Be familiar with and adhere to Citi’s Code of Conduct and the Plan of Supervision for Global Markets and Securities Services; and ensure that all team members understand the need to do the same. Adhere to all policies and procedures as defined by your role which will be communicated to you. Obtain and maintain all registrations/licenses which are required for your role, within the appropriate timeframe. Appropriately assess risk when business decisions are made, demonstrating particular consideration for the firm's reputation and safeguarding Citigroup, its clients and assets, by driving compliance with applicable laws, rules and regulations, adhering to Policy, applying sound ethical judgment regarding personal behavior, conduct and business practices, and escalating, managing and reporting control issues with transparency. Qualifications: 4+ years of experience in quantitative modeling in the financial industry. Must possess product knowledge of at least one asset class. Experience in Rates or Equities is a plus. Exposure to pricing models to evaluate risks of complex financial instruments is a plus. Must have strong technical/programming skills such as in python or C++. Experience in collaborative code development through use of Git/Bitbucket and similar platforms. Familiar with software development principles. Able to design, structure, and modularize complicated program. Familiar with SQL, and experience working with large dataset. Skilled in data cleaning, transformation, and processing using Python libraries such as pandas and numpy. Proficiency in delivering solutions using front-end frameworks like Angular and visualization tools like Tableau is a plus. Understanding of commonly used market risk metrics and method such as VaR, stress testing. Clear and concise written and verbal communication skills. This job description provides a high-level review of the types of work performed. Other job-related duties may be assigned as required. Education: A PhD or Master’s degree in a technical discipline such as statistics, mathematics, physics, computer science, quantitative finance, operations research or similar. ------------------------------------------------------ Job Family Group: Institutional Trading ------------------------------------------------------ Job Family: Quantitative Analysis ------------------------------------------------------ Time Type: Full time ------------------------------------------------------ Primary Location: New York New York United States ------------------------------------------------------ Primary Location Full Time Salary Range: $175,000.00 - $250,000.00 In addition to salary, Citi’s offerings may also include, for eligible employees, discretionary and formulaic incentive and retention awards. summary: A quantitative analyst is needed for the Market Quantitative Analysis (MQA) team at Citi to support the In-Business Risk team. The role involves developing analytical tools, diagnosing risk models, collaborating with traders, and staying up-to-date with AI/ML advancements. The ideal candidate will have 4+ years of experience in quantitative modeling, strong technical skills, and a PhD or Master's degree in a relevant field.

title: Existing Customer Marketing - Customer Management Strategy Analyst (C13/VP)
description: Position Summary The Marketing and Franchise Development organization drives all aspects of the customer lifecycle, from Acquisition to Engagement to Retention. The Existing Customer Marketing (ECM) team within this organization is a critical driver of Marketing, with a vision to deepen and expand the relationships our customers have with Citi – increasing their usage of our products and services, promoting behaviors that create long-term loyalty, and thoughtfully communicating new benefits, features and products that can strengthen our relationship. The ECM organization is currently seeking a VP, ECM Customer Management Strategy Analyst to drive analysis of marketing effectiveness within the Customer Management organization. This area of ECM focuses on developing and implementing end to end strategies that improve the overall health of our customer franchises, with a focus on our new and at-risk customer segments. The role primarily involves developing and implementing analytical strategies to drive business growth, optimize operations, and enhance decision-making processes. The ideal candidate will possess a strong background in data analysis, Digital metrics, financial services, and a proven track record of developing and monitoring key performance indicators (KPIs). Responsibilities Develop and Monitor Key Performance Indicators (KPIs): Partner with cross-functional teams to identify and define relevant KPIs aligned with business objectives. Design and implement robust measurement frameworks to track KPIs and performance metrics effectively. Regularly analyze KPI data to identify trends, patterns, and areas for improvement. Generate actionable insights and recommendations based on KPI analysis to drive strategic decision-making. Business Case Development and Scenario Planning: Develop compelling business cases that articulate the value proposition and justification for investment in strategic projects. Partner with business units to assess the feasibility and potential impact of proposed initiatives. Conduct thorough cost-benefit analyses and ROI assessments to support decision-making. Analyze various scenarios to understand their impact on financial performance. Collaborate with stakeholders to develop strategic responses to potential scenarios. Present business cases to senior management and key stakeholders, providing clear and persuasive arguments for proposed initiatives. Develop Analytics Agenda: Lead the development of a comprehensive analytics agenda that supports business goals and priorities. Work closely with stakeholders to understand their analytical needs and requirements. Continuously evaluate and refine the analytics agenda to adapt to changing business dynamics and market trends. Digital Metrics and Measurement Provide “horizontal” expertise in the area of Digital metrics, acting as a key interface with the Digital organization and providing views on how to measure and interpret Digital performance Measure Marketing Effectiveness: Develop and implement key performance indicators (KPIs) to track and evaluate marketing initiatives' success. Monitor and evaluate the effectiveness of new initiatives and tests, adjusting as necessary to maximize outcomes. Create insightful reports and presentations to communicate findings and recommendations to stakeholders at all levels. Lead the annual Planning process (expense, outcomes) Qualifications 6 - 10 years of relevant experience Strong experience in scoping and creating KPI’s and metrics and developing metrics dashboards. High degree of comfort with financial and quantitative analysis, scenario development, and key P&L drivers; ability to create and model data easily and comfort with scope and direct quantitative analysis working closely with Analytics and Finance Familiarity with financial services industry and competitor products/services Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to effectively convey technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders. Strong project management skills, with the ability to prioritize tasks, manage multiple projects simultaneously, and meet deadlines. Experience with measuring and interpreting Digital performance Education Bachelor’s Degree required, Master’s preferred. ------------------------------------------------------ Job Family Group: Marketing ------------------------------------------------------ Job Family: Marketing Program Management ------------------------------------------------------ Time Type: Full time ------------------------------------------------------ Primary Location: New York New York United States ------------------------------------------------------ Primary Location Full Time Salary Range: $129,840.00 - $194,760.00 In addition to salary, Citi’s offerings may also include, for eligible employees, discretionary and formulaic incentive and retention awards. This role focuses on developing KPIs, business cases, and an analytics agenda for improving customer franchises, leveraging digital metrics and measuring marketing effectiveness.

title: Senior Analyst, Sales Operations
description: Location: New York City, in office required 1-2 days per week Reports to: Senior Director, Revenue Operations About AlphaSense The world’s most sophisticated companies rely on AlphaSense to remove uncertainty from decision-making. With market intelligence and search built on proven AI, AlphaSense delivers insights that matter from content you can trust. Our universe of public and private content includes equity research, company filings, event transcripts, expert calls, news, trade journals, and clients’ own research content. Our platform is trusted by over 4,000 enterprise customers, including a majority of the S&P 500. Founded in 2011, AlphaSense is headquartered in New York City with over 1,300 people across the globe and offices in the U.S., U.K., Finland, India, and Singapore. For more information, please visit www.alpha-sense.com. About The Team The Revenue Operations team at AlphaSense drives productivity and improves efficiency for our account executives, account managers and sales development reps. We create and implement operational reporting & analytics, improve processes, and enable strategic initiatives that impact the revenue organization. At our core, we are a dynamic team of highly driven self-starters who are passionate about operations and thrive in a fast paced, challenging environment. About The Role We are looking for an experienced individual contributor within the Revenue Operations team to optimize processes including revenue forecasting, develop key enabling tools, streamline territories and be a partner to our Account Executive team. In this role, your responsibilities would include ownership of sales operations, a strong partnership with our Enablement team and an end to end view of our tools and processes with an overall goal of improving productivity and efficiency for our AEs and Global AE Leadership. You will have a direct impact to drive improvement in our core KPIs around pipeline, revenue, and productivity given your role and how closely you will be partnering with Sales Leaders. Who You Are At least 3+ years of experience working with a Revenue organization and playing a key role in driving productivity for a global sales organization Operations professional with a passion for driving productivity, improving processes and using new technology to drive revenue at a high growth B2B SaaS company Experience optimizing and rolling out new technology, workflows, and processes within a sales organization Excellent communication skills, and the ability to work in a dynamic, fast-paced and fun environment. Experience establishing benchmark KPIs and working with business leaders to regularly assess performance.
